options.systemMessage:
You are the **General Contractor** for a distributed job automation system. Your role is to orchestrate and coordinate multiple specialized subcontractor workflows to achieve comprehensive job application automation for ANY job type or industry.

**ARCHITECTURAL ROLE:**
- **General Contractor**: You coordinate the entire workflow execution regardless of job type
- **Subcontractor Management**: You delegate specialized tasks to workshop subcontractors
- **Quality Assurance**: You ensure proper workflow sequencing and data flow
- **Decision Making**: You make intelligent decisions about workflow execution paths

**AVAILABLE SUBCONTRACTORS:**
1. **Job Discovery Workshop**: Discovers and qualifies job opportunities from any industry/role
2. **Contact Enrichment Workshop**: Finds and verifies hiring manager contact information for any company
3. **Job Matching Workshop**: Analyzes job-resume compatibility for any position type
4. **Resume Generation Workshop**: Creates customized resumes for any opportunity
5. **Outreach Tracking Workshop**: Manages email outreach and tracking for any job application

**EXECUTION STRATEGY:**
1. **Initiate Job Discovery**: Call the job_discovery_workflow tool to find relevant opportunities
2. **Coordinate Parallel Processing**: Enable simultaneous contact enrichment and resume customization
3. **Quality Control**: Ensure proper data flow between subcontractor workshops
4. **Orchestrate Completion**: Coordinate final outreach and tracking activities

**CRITICAL RULES:**
- Your primary tool is `job_discovery_workflow` to initiate the process
- You coordinate workflow execution, not individual task processing
- Each subcontractor workshop handles its own specialized processing
- You ensure proper sequencing: Discovery → Parallel Processing → Outreach
- You maintain oversight of the entire distributed system
- You process ANY job type dynamically without assumptions about keywords or industries

**TEMPLATE EXECUTION:**
Execute the comprehensive job automation workflow by calling the job_discovery_workflow tool. The Job Discovery Workshop contains the user-configured search parameters (keywords, location, preferences) and will return relevant opportunities for processing through the specialized subcontractor workshops.

USD 178,206, with potential equity and bonuses📚 Career growth and skill development opportunities🏥 Comprehensive medical and dental benefits🌱 Inclusive and transparent company culture focused on autonomy and innovation🌍 Flexible work schedule aligned with EST time zones🌟 Employee ownership through Restricted Stock Units (RSUs)🏖️ Generous global annual leave policy including company-wide shutdown daysJobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.When you apply, your profile goes through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly.🔍 Our AI evaluates your CV and LinkedIn profile thoroughly, analyzing your skills, experience, and achievements.📊 It compares your profile to the job's core requirements and past success factors to determine your match score.🎯 Based on this analysis, we automatically shortlist the three candidates who best match the role.🧠 When necessary, our human team may perform an additional manual review to ensure no strong profile is missed.The process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias — focusing solely on your fit for the role. jobData.title: Staff Software Engineer, Social Media & Client Marketing
jobData.description: Luxury Presence is the leading digital platform revolutionizing the real estate industry for agents, teams, and brokerages. Our award-winning websites, cutting-edge marketing solutions, and AI-powered mobile platform empower real estate professionals to grow their business, operate more efficiently, and deliver exceptional service to their clients. Trusted by over 80,000 real estate professionals, including 31 of the nation’s 100 top-performing agents as published in the Wall Street Journal, Luxury Presence continues to set the standard for innovation and excellence in real estate technology.The RoleWe’re spinning up a new team to take our client marketing platform to the next level — and we’re looking for a Staff Software Engineer to lead the charge. This team will own our social media offering, helping real estate professionals unlock 24/7, done-for-you marketing at scale.This is a 0→1 opportunity with a small, high-agency squad (2–3 engineers). You'll partner with product, design, and AI to prototype rapidly, ship intelligently, and build AI-native tools that turn marketing into magic.If you’ve worked on social, martech, or influencer platforms — or if you’re active on social media yourself — you’ll feel right at home. Bonus points if you’ve built integrations with TikTok, Instagram, or Facebook APIs, or have PropTech experience.What You’ll DoLead the design and implementation of core systems for our social media marketing toolsDrive greenfield projects to deliver social-ready content pipelines, scheduling tools, and distribution integrationsDefine architecture for scalable, AI-native experiences that serve thousands of clientsRapidly prototype features using AI in your day-to-day (Langchain, OpenRouter, etc.)Mentor a small team while remaining hands-on in code and technical decisionsPartner across AI, product, and marketing to bring innovative ideas to market fastPush the boundaries of what social marketing can do for real estate prosWhat We’re Looking ForPassion for building in an AI-augmented environment with rapid iterationExperience with social media platforms, marketing tools, or creator ecosystems8+ years in full-stack engineering, with hands-on leadership in product developmentExpertise in JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, and ReactStrong systems thinker; comfortable designing scalable microservice architecturesExperience with event-driven systems (Kafka/SQS), GraphQL, and distributed databasesSaaS background with preference for multi-tenant and platform experiencesStrong communication and cross-functional collaboration skillsReal estate tech (PropTech), social platform APIs, or martech experience is a plusTech StackFrontend: React, Tailwind, Apollo, SingleSPABackend: Node.js, TypeScript (microservices), Python ETLsAI: LangChain, LangFuse, OpenRouter, MastraData: PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, ElasticsearchInfrastructure: AWS, Kubernetes, LambdaMessaging: Kafka, SQSJoin us in shaping the future of real estateThe real estate industry is in the midst of a seismic shift, and the future belongs to those who break new ground. As one of the fastest-growing companies in the proptech and marketing sectors, Luxury Presence challenges the status quo of what technology can do for real estate agents, leaders, and brokerages.We’re a team of agile and tenacious innovators working collaboratively to drive the industry forward. Together, we build game-changing products that empower modern real estate entrepreneurs to dominate their markets. From award-winning web design to agile SEO solutions to cutting-edge AI tools, we deliver tech that anticipates market shifts and keeps our clients ahead of their competition.Founded in 2016 by Stanford Business School alum Malte Kramer, Luxury Presence has grown to a global team ranked on the Inc. 5000 fastest-growing companies list three years in a row. We’re backed by world-class investors, including Bessemer Venture Partners, Toba Capital, and Switch Ventures, and have raised $52.6 million to date.More than 15,000 real estate businesses rely on our platform, including 31 of the RealTrends top 100 agents featured in The Wall Street Journal. Additionally, many of the industry’s most powerful brokerages — including Compass, Coldwell Banker, and Sotheby’s International Realty — rely on Luxury Presence as a trusted business partner.Every year since 2020, Luxury Presence has ranked on BuiltIn’s Best Place to Work lists. HousingWire named our founder and CEO a 2024 Tech Trendsetter, we’ve received several Tech100 Awards, and our lead nurturing tool just scored an Inman Innovation Award for Best AI-Powered Platform.Luxury Presence is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

documentation.QualificationsRequired3-10 years of professional experience in front-end engineering.Extensive hands-on experience with React and Next.js, including:Server-side rendering (SSR) and static site generation (SSG)Dynamic routing and API routesNext.js 13+ App Router architectureStrong proficiency in TypeScript, JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, and CSS3/SCSS.Solid understanding of state management patterns (Redux, Zustand, Context API, or Recoil).Experience integrating with REST and GraphQL APIs.Deep understanding of front-end build pipelines, including Webpack, Vite, or Turbopack.Familiarity with performance optimization, accessibility, and SEO fundamentals.Strong communication and collaboration skills.Proven experience integrating and managing headless CMS (such as Contentful, Hygraph, Sanity, or Strapi).Experience with unit testing frameworks such as Jest, React Testing Library, or Cypress.PreferredBackend exposure: Java, node, graphqlMigration experience (not just from a support position): legacy, jQuery, next.jsAEM (Adobe Experience Manager) is notable but not criticalE-commerce experience is preferableExposure to Node.js, Express, or backend-for-frontend (BFF) patterns.Experience with design systems (Storybook, Radix, shadcn/ui, Material UI, Chakra, etc.)Experience with monorepo management (Nx, Turborepo).Familiarity with React Server Components and Next.js Edge functions.Understanding of modern CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Vercel, or similar).Who You AreA self-driven, detail-oriented engineer with strong ownership over your work.Comfortable working independently while engaging constructively with cross-functional teams.A proactive problem-solver who values clarity, scalability, and performance in code.Workplace AccommodationQualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to personal characteristics or background. Reasonable accommodations are available for individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.Equal Opportunity StatementThis employer is committed to diversity and inclusion, and welcomes applicants of all backgrounds. All qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected classification.

jobData.title: Staff Full-Stack Engineer, Front-end (SEO Engineering)
jobData.description: At the organization, the mission is to bring clarity to all of life’s financial decisions and every great mission needs a team of exceptional contributors. An inclusive, flexible, and candid culture has been built where individuals are empowered to grow, take smart risks, and be unapologetically themselves (cape optional). Whether remote or in-office, support is provided for how team members thrive best. Investment is made in well-being, development, and the ability to make an impact because when one member levels up, everyone does.About the Team:The SEO Engineering team contributes to the organization’s growth engine by building the Landing Page Creator (LPC), a Next.js/React platform embedded in WordPress that enables high-traffic, SEO-optimized customer experiences. Tools and components are created to empower content and marketing teams to launch scalable, performant pages, backed by Redis caching and strong observability. Joining SEO Engineering means working on business-critical, high-impact engineering at the intersection of platform, growth, and consumer experience.About the Opportunity:A Staff Software Engineer is sought who is both a technical leader and hands-on builder, capable of driving technical excellence, front-end performance, and platform scalability while collaborating with stakeholders to shape the future of organic shopping products.This is a front-end role with full-stack elements, ideal for someone with a strong eye for design, UI/UX, accessibility, and web performance. The selected candidate will lead initiatives that enhance Core Web Vitals (CWV), technical SEO, and observability, ensuring shopping experiences are blazing fast, user-friendly, and optimized for discovery. Beyond the front-end, there will also be opportunities to work on back-end APIs and integrate with Machine Learning systems that power these experiences, enabling personalization and data-driven decision-making at scale.As a Staff Engineer, close collaboration with engineering leadership is expected to influence the engineering roadmap, contribute to best practices, and drive architectural projects that balance speed, scalability, and long-term maintainability. This is not just a strategy role. The position is hands-on, writing production-quality code, mentoring engineers, and driving technical excellence across the team. The Staff Engineer will set the pace, ensuring both high-quality execution and fast iteration, acting as a multiplier to help the entire team deliver impact.Where you can make an impact:• Shape the future of the organization’s highest-traffic organic pages by improving performance, SEO, and user engagement.• Partner with product, SEO, and data teams to run experiments, measure impact, and iterate quickly.• Take input from and partner directly with engineering leadership to drive technical initiatives to enhance performance, observability, scalability, security and developer experience.• Contribute to platform stability and resilience through effective monitoring, troubleshooting, and incident management.• Ensure high standards of technical excellence, maintaining a high-quality codebase and modernizing the stack.• Mentor and provide technical guidance to engineering team members, promoting best practices in coding, testing, and architecture.• Conduct code reviews to ensure code quality, performance, and adherence to standards, fostering a culture of continuous improvement within the engineering team.• Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in the tech and finance industries through a practice of continuous learning and self-improvement.Your experience:It is recognized that not everyone will meet all of the criteria. If most of the criteria below are met and there is excitement about the opportunity and willingness to learn, applications are encouraged.• Minimum of 8+ years in software engineering, with a strong background in client focused full stack development.• Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).• Expert in ES6, TypeScript, Node.js and the web platform; proficient in other modern languages such as Rust, Go, Python, etc.• Expert in modern front-end frameworks such as Astro.js, Nuxt.js, Next.js, React.js, Tailwind, etc.• Deeply knowledgeable about Web Performance, Core Web Vitals & Technical SEO.• Keen eye for design, usability and user experience. Understanding of accessibility best-practices.• Experience in Observability and running a production website or application at scale.• Experience with database systems, microservices architecture, RESTful APIs, IAC, CI/CD and cloud infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure).• Deep domain knowledge in technical SEO or a related field.Where:• This role will be remote (based in the U.S.).• It is believed that great work can be done anywhere. No matter where you are based, the organization offers benefits and perks to support the physical, financial, and emotional well being of you and your family.What is offered:Work Hard, Stay Balanced (Life’s a series of balancing acts, eh?)• Industry-leading medical, dental, and vision health care plans for employees and their dependents• Rejuvenation Policy Vacation Time Off plus 11 holidays plus 4 Mental Health Days Off• New Parent Leave for employees with a newborn child or a child placed with them for adoption or foster care• Mental health support• Paid sabbatical for contributors to recharge, gain knowledge and pursue their interests• Health and Dependent Care FSA and HSA Plan with monthly organizational contribution• Monthly Wellness Stipend, Cell Phone Stipend, and Wifi Stipend• Work from home equipment stipend and co-working space subsidyHave Some Fun:• Contributor-led group initiatives Employee Resource Groups for Parents, Diversity, and Inclusion, Women, LGBTQIA, and other communities• Hackathons and team events across all teams and departments• Company-wide events like employee appreciation and annual Charity Auction• Team members love to make an impact by paying it forward

The role's focus on frontend (React, TypeScript, Next.js, Tailwind) and backend (Node.js) technologies, combined with SEO and performance optimization, closely matches Ivo's expertise, resulting in a high skills overlap score and perfect experience level match.

jobData.title: Staff Software Engineer
jobData.description: Luxury Presence is the leading digital platform revolutionizing the real estate industry for agents, teams, and brokerages. Our award-winning websites, cutting-edge marketing solutions, and AI-powered mobile platform empower real estate professionals to grow their business, operate more efficiently, and deliver exceptional service to their clients. Trusted by over 80,000 real estate professionals, including 31 of the nation’s 100 top-performing agents as published in the Wall Street Journal, Luxury Presence continues to set the standard for innovation and excellence in real estate technology.The RoleAs a Staff Software Engineer, you will serve as a technical leader within your team and across the broader engineering organization. You’ll drive high-impact initiatives that shape the future of our systems, architecture, and AI-first platform strategy. From setting architectural direction to mentoring others, you’ll play a key role in delivering intelligent, scalable, and user-centric products.You’ll collaborate closely with product, design, and AI teams to launch features that leverage the latest advances in AI, while also championing engineering excellence and innovation across the org.What You’ll DoLead the design and implementation of complex systems and platform capabilitiesDrive large-scale, cross-functional projects that align technical strategy with business objectivesDefine architectural patterns and standards that improve system scalability, resilience, and maintainabilityMentor engineers across teams, elevate technical skills, and influence career growthPartner with product, design, and AI teams to deliver AI-native product experiences and developer toolingLead technical initiatives that improve developer efficiency, reduce risk, and unlock innovationFoster a culture of excellence through technical leadership in design and code reviewsShare knowledge through documentation, workshops, and cross-team collaborationWhat We’re Looking ForPassion for building in an AI-augmented environmentFamiliarity with AI tools and agent workflows; experience building or deploying AI-driven products is a plus8+ years of professional experience in full-stack engineeringDeep expertise in JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, and modern front-end frameworks like ReactExperience designing and operating scalable microservice architectures in cloud-native environments (AWS preferred)Strong understanding of GraphQL, event-driven systems (Kafka/SQS), and distributed databasesProven track record leading high-impact initiatives from concept through productionExpert-level grasp of software design principles such as SOLID, DI, and domain-driven designExperience building SaaS platforms, ideally with multi-tenant architectureStrong communicator and collaborator across product, design, AI, and engineering teamsAbility to connect technical decisions to customer impact and long-term business valueTech StackFrontend: React, Tailwind, Apollo, SingleSPABackend: Node.js, TypeScript (microservices), Python ETLsAI: LangChain, LangFuse, OpenRouter, MastraData: PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, ElasticsearchInfrastructure: AWS, Kubernetes, LambdaMessaging: Kafka, SQSJoin us in shaping the future of real estateThe real estate industry is in the midst of a seismic shift, and the future belongs to those who break new ground. As one of the fastest-growing companies in the proptech and marketing sectors, Luxury Presence challenges the status quo of what technology can do for real estate agents, leaders, and brokerages.We’re a team of agile and tenacious innovators working collaboratively to drive the industry forward. Together, we build game-changing products that empower modern real estate entrepreneurs to dominate their markets. From award-winning web design to agile SEO solutions to cutting-edge AI tools, we deliver tech that anticipates market shifts and keeps our clients ahead of their competition.Founded in 2016 by Stanford Business School alum Malte Kramer, Luxury Presence has grown to a global team ranked on the Inc. 5000 fastest-growing companies list three years in a row. We’re backed by world-class investors, including Bessemer Venture Partners, Toba Capital, and Switch Ventures, and have raised $52.6 million to date.More than 15,000 real estate businesses rely on our platform, including 31 of the RealTrends top 100 agents featured in The Wall Street Journal. Additionally, many of the industry’s most powerful brokerages — including Compass, Coldwell Banker, and Sotheby’s International Realty — rely on Luxury Presence as a trusted business partner.Every year since 2020, Luxury Presence has ranked on BuiltIn’s Best Place to Work lists. HousingWire named our founder and CEO a 2024 Tech Trendsetter, we’ve received several Tech100 Awards, and our lead nurturing tool just scored an Inman Innovation Award for Best AI-Powered Platform.Luxury Presence is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.This compensation band applies to candidates based in the United States only.

json.title: Jr. SEO Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
About NMG:

Nationwide Marketing Group works on behalf of thousands of independent appliance, furniture, bedding, electronics, specialty electronics, custom installation and rent-to-own dealers helping them grow their businesses and thrive on their own terms. With more than 5,000 members operating some 14,000 storefronts, Nationwide Marketing Group is the largest buying, marketing and business support organization of its kind, representing billions in combined annual sales across the membership. For over 50 years, the organization has remained committed to the independent channel, empowering members with the scale, sophistication and efficiencies they need to compete while delivering the unmatched business intelligence, tools and resources required to win in an ever-changing business environment. To learn more, visit our website at nationwidegroup.org or Nationwide Marketing Group LinkedIn

Why You Want to Work Here:

At Nationwide Marketing Group, we believe our strength comes from the diversity of our people and the communities we serve. We’re committed to building teams where every individual feels valued, included, and supported to do their best work. We know that different voices and perspectives don’t just make us stronger—they help us serve our Members better.

But culture at NMG goes beyond our commitment to diversity and inclusion. We’re a community built on collaboration, respect, and a shared drive to help independent businesses thrive. Here, you’ll be part of a team that celebrates wins together, tackles challenges head-on, and invests in both professional and personal growth.

NMG is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, disability, or any other protected characteristic. If you need reasonable accommodations during the hiring process, please let us know—we’ll work with you to ensure you have the support you need.

What We'll Do For You:

  • Competitive base pay and performance bonus, dependent on role.
  • Medical, Dental, Vision with low cost coverage options
  • Employer Paid Basic Life/AD&D
  • Employer Paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
  • MetLife supplemental insurance benefit options
  • Matching 401K with 100% vesting
  • Open PTO Policy, Paid Holidays, 10 weeks Paid Parental Leave to help you prioritize what matters most to you
  • Business casual work environment
  • Rewards & recognition platform -- earn points & redeem for merch!
  • Discounts Program on Electronics, Cells Phones, Health & Wellness, Travel, Entertainment, Home & Auto, Pet Insurance and more!

Job Location: Open to US Remote Candidates

Job Summary:

As a Jr. SEO Specialist, you’ll support the Sr. SEO Specialist in developing and executing SEO strategies that drive measurable growth for our clients. Your days will involve researching keywords, optimizing on-page content, managing link-building initiatives, and tracking performance across tools like GA4, Google Search Console, and Bing Webmaster Tools. You’ll help translate complex SEO data into clear insights and actions that retailers can understand and appreciate.

This isn’t a role for someone who just follows checklists. It’s for someone who’s curious, analytical, and eager to learn how all the moving parts of SEO connect to real business outcomes.

You’ll thrive here if you’re the kind of person who:

  • Simplifies complexity. You can take SEO jargon and make it click for retailers, showing them exactly how your work drives results.
  • Builds trust through action. You’re proactive in communication and take ownership of your work, ensuring retailers feel supported every step of the way.
  • Loves to learn. You stay on top of evolving SEO trends and tools, you're open to new challenges & being challenged yourself, and you enjoy experimenting with new approaches to sharpen your craft.
  • Plays for the team. You see collaboration as a competitive advantage, welcoming feedback & coaching, and building ideas with others to get the best results.

If you’re organized, thoughtful, and excited to turn search strategy into client success, this role gives you the room to grow and the mentorship to thrive.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement SEO Strategies: Including on-page and off-page optimization, to improve website traffic and search rankings.
  • Technical SEO Improvements: Regularly perform website audits to identify SEO performance gaps and areas for improvement, conduct thorough SEO audits, investigate needed enhancements, and collaborate with web developers to implement necessary improvements.
  • Keyword Research & Content Creation: Conduct comprehensive keyword research for various websites/projects to identify optimization opportunities. Findings will be used to optimize content such as meta tags, descriptions, internal linking, on-page content, and blogs, ensuring every page is primed to succeed in search engines.
  • Local SEO & Listing Management Enhancements: Conduct research and implement on-page and off-page Local SEO strategies while optimizing and managing business listings on platforms like Google Business Profile and the Semrush tool to enhance local search visibility.
  • Performance Monitoring and Analysis: Use SEO tools like Google Search Console, Google Analytics, and SEMrush to monitor and analyze website performance, and leverage AI tools to streamline workflow, boost productivity, and stay ahead of the curve.
  • Competitive Analysis: Perform analysis and report on SEO strategies and techniques used by our competitors.
  • Link Building: Build and manage high-quality backlinks through ethical and effective link-building campaigns.
  • Data Analysis and Goal Setting: Conduct in-depth data analysis by reviewing Google Analytics, Google Search Console, and SEMrush, and set goals and KPIs for organic search performance on a client basis.
  • Monthly SEO Deliverables: Shape monthly SEO deliverables on a per-client basis.
  • Stay Updated and Maintain Industry Knowledge: Keep up with SEO best practices, algorithm changes, and industry trends to ensure the website remains optimized and competitive, and maintain current knowledge of industry updates about SEO strategies, tactics, and algorithm shifts.
  • Process Improvement: Bring forward-thinking ideas to improve processes, tools, and techniques for SEO growth.
  • Team Collaboration: Work closely with internal teams to maintain and drive account integrity, and collaborate with team members to align SEO strategies with broader marketing goals.

Job Qualifications:

  • Education: Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or a related field (preferred but not mandatory).
  • Experience: Minimum of 1-2 years in a digital marketing or SEO role. Internship or freelance experience in SEO is beneficial.
  • SEO Knowledge: Basic understanding of SEO principles and best practices.
  • Certifications and Tools: Relevant certifications and proficiency in tools such as Google Search Console, Google Analytics, and SEO tools (e.g., SEMrush, Ahrefs, Moz, BrightEdge) are a plus.
  • Content Creation: Ability to create compelling content for various industries. Strong copywriting skills for engaging and SEO-friendly content.
  • Technical Skills: Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and a basic understanding of HTML.
  • Organizational Skills: Strong organizational and time management abilities.
  • Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Teamwork: Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team.
  • Interpersonal Skills: Good interpersonal skills and the ability to build relationships.

You'll Thrive Here if You're:

  • Creative: The ability to use imagination and new ideas to produce solutions
  • Collaborative: The ability to work with others to the benefit of the business and its goals
  • Influential: The ability to promote ideas and initiatives both internally and externally
  • Inspiring: The ability to motivate others towards a common goal
  • Analytical: The ability to analyze large amounts of data
  • Communicative: The ability to clearly express thoughts in written and verbal form
  • Tech savvy and learn new products quickly
  • Able to spot details in complex projects

Work Environment:

Must be able to read, write, and communicate both verbally and in written form to express and exchange ideas. While performing the responsibilities of this job, the employee must be able to access all components of workstation and other office equipment. Frequent typing, writing, bending, and twisting. Must be able to lift up to 10 pounds.

General office environment with moderate noise. This position is mostly sedentary, involves sitting most of the time, but may involve walking or standing for brief periods of time. A busy environment with many unscheduled interruptions. Frequent computer use at workstation for extended periods of time. Public contact position requiring appropriate business apparel.

json.title: Search Engine Optimisation Consultant
json.descriptionHtml:
Experienced SEO specialists skilled at auditing, optimising, and growing organic search presence for enterprise, ecommerce, sports, and finance brands invited to take the next step in your career with a fast-growing, well-respected, and ground-breaking agency.

Job Description

You will work on all aspects of SEO from on-page content optimisation to digital PR, and keep up with new SEO tools and techniques to grow traffic, sales and inbound lead volumes. Job duties will include:

  • SEO strategy definition
  • Technical on page audits – analysis, recommendations and implementations
  • Auditing website copy and suggesting optimisations
  • Occasionally writing copy for service pages and blogs / news content
  • Keeping abreast of SEO trends and algorithm updates
  • Analysing data and performing effective keyword and competitor research
  • Writing interesting articles, to be used on the agency website
  • Representing the agency at industry events
  • Building relationships with industry press, bloggers and news sites to promote our brand, our research, and our content to industry influencers and publications

You will join a small team, and be expected to hit the ground running. You should be savvy when it comes to understanding HTML and CSS, ideally with some programming knowledge (e.g. PHP, XML and JSON feeds) and JavaScript frameworks, as well as advanced tools and technology for large-scale website optimisation.

The position opens up a lot of opportunities to improve your knowledge of Google Search, Map Search, Shopping Search, News Search and video content optimisation.

The contract will include a 3 month probation period.

Job Outcomes

  • Provide technical and marketing SEO consulting
  • Training client in-house marketing & PR teams
  • Grow client organic search traffic by 20% per year
  • Reach client KPI targets (traffic, keyword rankings, SERP presence)
  • Maintain 95% client retention rate
  • Represent AccuraCast at important SEO conferences.

Apply now

Requirements

  • Native-level fluency of English (copy writing skills will be tested)
  • 2+ years experience working on SEO for enterprise and/or ecommerce
  • On-page and off-page SEO experience
  • Thorough understanding HTML and CSS
  • Good level of programming knowledge (e.g. PHP or Python)
  • Very comfortable creating & reviewing XML and JSON feeds
  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Extreme attention to detail

Additional Qualifications (Preferred)

  • Ability to speak a Western / Northern European language (especially German)
  • Candidates with a Marketing / Journalism degree
  • Experience using Google Analytics, Data Studio, Screaming Frog & SEMRush.

We Offer

Job title: Search Engine Optimisation Consultant Locality: Remote (WFH) Region: UK Country: United Kingdom Job type: Full time Hours: 40 hours per week Base salary: £25¬,000 – £60,000 / year Benefits: Private medical insurance, private pension, mental health cover, 28 days annual leave, cycle scheme, flexible working

View More Opportunities
json.descriptionText: Experienced SEO specialists skilled at auditing, optimising, and growing organic search presence for enterprise, ecommerce, sports, and finance brands invited to take the next step in your career with a fast-growing, well-respected, and ground-breaking agency.Job DescriptionYou will work on all aspects of SEO from on-page content optimisation to digital PR, and keep up with new SEO tools and techniques to grow traffic, sales and inbound lead volumes. Job duties will include:SEO strategy definitionTechnical on page audits – analysis, recommendations and implementationsAuditing website copy and suggesting optimisationsOccasionally writing copy for service pages and blogs / news contentKeeping abreast of SEO trends and algorithm updatesAnalysing data and performing effective keyword and competitor researchWriting interesting articles, to be used on the agency websiteRepresenting the agency at industry eventsBuilding relationships with industry press, bloggers and news sites to promote our brand, our research, and our content to industry influencers and publicationsYou will join a small team, and be expected to hit the ground running. You should be savvy when it comes to understanding HTML and CSS, ideally with some programming knowledge (e.g. PHP, XML and JSON feeds) and JavaScript frameworks, as well as advanced tools and technology for large-scale website optimisation.The position opens up a lot of opportunities to improve your knowledge of Google Search, Map Search, Shopping Search, News Search and video content optimisation.The contract will include a 3 month probation period.Job OutcomesProvide technical and marketing SEO consultingTraining client in-house marketing & PR teamsGrow client organic search traffic by 20% per yearReach client KPI targets (traffic, keyword rankings, SERP presence)Maintain 95% client retention rateRepresent AccuraCast at important SEO conferences.Apply nowRequirementsNative-level fluency of English (copy writing skills will be tested)2+ years experience working on SEO for enterprise and/or ecommerceOn-page and off-page SEO experienceThorough understanding HTML and CSSGood level of programming knowledge (e.g. PHP or Python)Very comfortable creating & reviewing XML and JSON feedsBachelor’s degreeExtreme attention to detailAdditional Qualifications (Preferred)Ability to speak a Western / Northern European language (especially German)Candidates with a Marketing / Journalism degreeExperience using Google Analytics, Data Studio, Screaming Frog & SEMRush.We OfferJob title: Search Engine Optimisation Consultant Locality: Remote (WFH) Region: UK Country: United Kingdom Job type: Full time Hours: 40 hours per week Base salary: £25¬,000 – £60,000 / year Benefits: Private medical insurance, private pension, mental health cover, 28 days annual leave, cycle scheme, flexible workingView More Opportunities
json.companySlogan: International Digital Marketing Agency
json.companyDescription:
Accuracast is an international digital marketing agency that works with ambitious brands to accelerate growth through data and technology.

Whether you'd like to scale internationally, or consolidate multi-national marketing operations, we can create solutions that positively impact your digital marketing campaigns.

As an international digital marketing agency, we specialise in Paid Search & Display Advertising (PPC), Generative AI Engine Optimisation (GEO), Search Engine Optimisation (SEO) and Social Media Marketing for ambitious brands.

Offices in London, New York and Madrid. 

Clients include PwC, Penguin Random House, WTW, Club Med, Informa, China Mobile and Hard Rock Hotels.

json.title: Assistant Data Entry - Junior - Remote
json.descriptionHtml:
Exciting Career Opportunity - Join Our Team!

We are looking for dedicated and motivated individuals to join our team and contribute to our continued success. This position offers a chance to grow professionally in a supportive and inclusive environment, with flexibility and long-term career potential.

Employment Type: Full-Time / Part-Time

Salary Range: $35-40/hr., Competitive, based on experience and qualifications

Job Summary

The ideal candidate will perform a range of tasks to support daily operations, contribute to team goals, and uphold our standards of excellence. This role requires a proactive attitude, a willingness to learn, and a commitment to quality and professionalism.

  • Support day-to-day operations and team functions
  • Maintain accuracy and attention to detail in assigned tasks
  • Communicate effectively with team members and clients
  • Adhere to company policies, procedures, and deadlines
  • Take initiative and show flexibility in handling tasks
  • Contribute to a positive and respectful work culture

Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent (college degree a plus)
  • Basic computer and communication skills
  • Strong organizational and time management abilities
  • Ability to work independently or as part of a team
  • Adaptable and willing to learn new tools or systems

Benefits

  • Competitive salary with opportunities for increases
  • Flexible work hours and remote options (if applicable)
  • Opportunities for career growth and advancement
  • Ongoing training and development
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance (if applicable)
  • Paid time off and holiday benefits
  • Employee support programs and recognition

Take the next step in your career and apply today. We are excited to learn more about you!

json.companyDescription:
ductoLux, es una empresa de Ingeniería de Proyectos, ubicada en el Polígono Industrial “El Prado” de Mérida (Badajoz), España.
En los últimos años, ductoLux, viene participando como contratista en grandes instalaciones de generación de energía, realizando desde la ingeniería, instalaciones, construcción y legalización de las Plantas.
A su vez ha participado en distintas obras para  diversas empresas de diversos sectores, realizándoles proyectos de llave en mano, potenciando sus conocimientos técnicos con el fin de proporcional al cliente un servicio integral.
En la actualidad, ductoLux, está en una estrategia de desarrollo junto con las grandes firmas con las que ha venido trabajando, para realizar una expansión nacional e internacional.
 ductoLux, tiene ocho familias de servicios, las cuales se detallan a continuación:
•	001 Oficina Técnica
•	002 Consultoría Técnica.
•	003 Construcción.
•	004 Instalaciones Eléctricas.
•	005 Instalaciones de Climatización.
•	006 Otras Instalaciones.
•	007 Mantenimiento.
ductoLux, ofrece al cliente un servicio integral de cada una de sus familias, poniendo todos los elementos de la empresa a su disposición, desde la concepción de la idea, durante su maduración, ejecución y posterior funcionamiento. Nos diferenciamos de la competencia, en que nos tomamos el proyecto del cliente como si fueran nuestro.
ductoLux, ofrece al cliente un asesoramiento técnico en la idea del cliente, diseña y proyecta la maduración de la idea y hace un seguimiento del trabajo una vez acabado, estando en contacto continuo con el cliente y a su disposición.

json.title: Digital Marketing & SEO Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
Part-Time Remote Position

Position Overview

We are seeking a motivated and experienced Digital Marketing & SEO Specialist who is passionate about building businesses through ROI driven digital strategies and paid media to join our growing team part-time, remotely.

The primary focus of this role will be two-fold;

  • Manage current clients and assist in growing the digital marketing department at our agency and,
  • Oversee and manage our internal marketing efforts, as well as, help build our own digital presence.

The ideal candidate will possess strong skills pertaining to Google Ads and Facebook Ads with the drive to become a holistic digital marketing specialist that is able to work in multiple ad platforms and mediums based on individual client needs. The ideal candidate can manage digital marketing campaigns from discovery to implementation, management, tracking key insights, and reporting on success.

The Responsibilities

  • Work collaboratively with our highly skilled design, development and programming team
  • Execute our internal digital marketing initiatives
  • Increase lead flow and quality prospect interactions
  • Effectively strategize and manage a small book of digital marketing clients
  • Conduct new client discovery sessions with team support in order to devise effective digital marketing campaigns
  • Effectively manage client project management communications and reporting
  • Strategize, give creative direction, build, and manage paid media campaigns
  • Manage, update & troubleshoot in-market campaigns on an on-going basis
  • Devise and collaborate on lead nurturing activities such as email automation, drip campaigns, retargeting, etc.
  • Implement content updates to create effective, cohesive marketing language throughout the entire lead/purchase flow
  • Stay up-to-date on the latest trends and best practices in digital marketing
  • Adhere to project hours & scope requirements, timelines, and tracking of all time appropriately
  • Are up-to-date on the latest and new Digital Marketing and SEO methods, technologies, best practices and trends

Experience / Qualifications / Ability

  • Experience managing paid media campaigns such as Facebook, Google, & Bing ads
  • Experience utilizing and customizing Google Analytics / Google Data Studio (*plus)
  • Experience building lead gen programs including gated inbound assets and other technical strategies
  • Experience using platforms such as SEMrush, Mangools, etc.
  • Experience generating e-commerce revenue through digital advertising
  • Experience building multi-channel retargeting campaigns
  • Ability to align project KPI’s with reporting & custom tracking metrics
  • Lead gen and e-commerce experience combined (*plus)
  • Experience managing small teams (**plus)
  • Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, handle uncertainty, and work well with clients and a multi-talented crew
  • 3+ years of recent, in-campaign experience managing paid media (paid social, search, display, etc)
  • Agency experience is a plus but not required

The Requirements

  • Full understanding of the digital marketing industry
  • Ability to teach, tailor, take control during client & executive interactions
  • Aren’t afraid to talk about money or ask difficult questions
  • Strong 2-way communication skills
  • Ability to meet deadlines and manage project timelines
  • Ability to effectively manage client communications in a professional and timely manner
  • Highly motivated, self-learner that can adapt to the rapidly changing ad platforms
  • Understands marketing principles and can create a fluid digital strategy from conception to ad delivery and on-going iterations
  • Understands and can speak to all digital marketing metrics
  • Understands tracking, pixels, and audience building
  • Understands and can devise data-driven advertising strategies
  • Display the highest level of professionalism at all times
  • Have a positive impact on culture and team morale
  • Have a positive attitude and encourage growth and success
  • Multitasking & time management skills a must
  • Highly organized with attention-to-detail and consistency
  • Ability to be a self-starter & self-motivated with a strong work ethic
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Willingness to learn and improve skills
  • Ability to analyze and propose solutions to problems
  • Working from home and independently. You must be self-managed and self-motivated
  • Able to communication through Slack and Google Meet
  • MUST be located in the US
  • Available Monday – Friday during business hours to attend to client needs

Apply to Position

json.title: Social Media Assistant
json.descriptionHtml:
At CONNETIX, we're not just a toy company; we're innovators on a mission to inspire learning through creativity and imagination with our award-winning, open-ended STEAM-accredited magnetic tiles. As we continue to rapidly expand globally, we're looking for a passionate Social Media Assistant to join our family-oriented team, based in North America.


A few of the standout things we offer:



  • Remote Work Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom of a remote work setup that helps you balance your professional and personal life.
  • Collaborative Culture: Be part of a supportive team that embraces collaboration and creativity. We encourage everyone to share their unique perspectives.
  • Award-Winning Workplace: Proudly awarded the 'Great Place to Work’ accolade for four consecutive years, reflecting our commitment to a positive and inclusive culture.


About the Role


As a Social Media Assistant, you'll help us create and share exciting content across various platforms. You'll assist with managing social media platforms and supporting our strategies to boost our online presence. You'll have the opportunity to help grow our reach and engagement on Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, Pinterest, and YouTube.


Drawing on your toolkit of experience, here is what you will be doing:



  • Learn and apply best practices for social media channels, staying updated on trends and new tools.
  • Assist the wider Social Media team, in developing social media strategies that align with our brand and goals.
  • Create on-brand content across various social media platforms, including writing and editing posts and promoting campaigns.
  • Proactively boost engagement through targeted strategies.
  • Communicate with customers engaging on our social platforms in a timely manner.
  • Develop and manage influencer relationships and campaign groups.
  • Analyze post-performance and use data to inform future strategies.
  • Attend team meetings and contribute insights and ideas.
  • Assist the Social Media Marketing Manager with marketing campaigns and other related duties.


About You:



  • Collaborative Spirit: Excellent communication skills and a team-oriented mindset to bring ideas to life together.
  • Self-Starter: Ability to work autonomously, demonstrating initiative, independence, and proactive problem-solving skills.
  • Creative and Analytical: Good understanding of social media management and strategy, with a willingness to learn best practices. Strong interest in developing analytical skills and copywriting abilities.
  • Tech-Savvy: Experience with social media scheduling/analytics tools, and knowledge of photo and video editing programs.
  • Flexible Thinker: Effective time management and multitasking skills with the ability to prioritize tasks efficiently.



Further to that, our ideal candidate will have:



  • Prior experience in managing social media and community management.
  • Strong knowledge of social media platforms including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, and more.
  • Demonstrated track record of successful social media campaigns and audience engagement.
  • Creative skills and the ability to adapt brand tone of voice.
  • Strong communication and presentation skills.



Join us at a pivotal time as we continue to expand our reach in the toy industry. You'll have the opportunity to grow alongside a forward-thinking company dedicated to making a positive impact on learning through creativity. If this sounds like the perfect fit for you, apply now!

Strong interest in developing analytical skills and copywriting abilities.Tech-Savvy: Experience with social media scheduling/analytics tools, and knowledge of photo and video editing programs.Flexible Thinker: Effective time management and multitasking skills with the ability to prioritize tasks efficiently.Further to that, our ideal candidate will have:Prior experience in managing social media and community management.Strong knowledge of social media platforms including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, YouTube, TikTok, and more.Demonstrated track record of successful social media campaigns and audience engagement.Creative skills and the ability to adapt brand tone of voice.Strong communication and presentation skills.Join us at a pivotal time as we continue to expand our reach in the toy industry. You'll have the opportunity to grow alongside a forward-thinking company dedicated to making a positive impact on learning through creativity. If this sounds like the perfect fit for you, apply now!
json.jobPosterTitle: Senior Recruitment and HR Specialist
json.companySlogan: CONNETIX is an Australian company passionate about producing open-ended toys for kids and kids at heart!
json.companyDescription:
With a mission to champion learning through play, CONNETIX brings to market award-winning, STEAM and MESH accredited magnetic tiles designed to spark imaginations and inspire children to learn and develop - all through open-ended play! 

At the heart of our brand is a passionate team of educators and industry experts driving the CONNETIX difference. We are committed to creating high-quality toys, striving for business excellence, and connecting with parents, educators and allied health professionals around the world to spread the value of open-ended play. See our inspired play community on Instagram @connetix_tiles and join in the fun! 

We are proud to be an Australian-owned construction toy brand, leading with purpose and a strong focus on building relationships. Our innovative range is stocked in quality retailers across the globe and trusted by families all over the world. 

Operating a family-focused, work-from-home business with a diverse and multinational team, CONNETIX inspires a positive workplace culture of collaboration, trust and inclusion – where every team member is valued and united through the power of play.  

CONNETIX is recognised as a Great Place to Work™ and was a 2024 National Finalist in the Telstra Best of Business Awards for Outstanding Growth and State Finalist for Embracing Innovation category.

json.title: Social Media Assistant
json.descriptionHtml:
This is a remote position.

FNEX is a global leader in private securities transactions and investment banking, specializing in private stock liquidity solutions for institutional investors. The firm provides institutional access and tailored liquidity solutions across a global network of leading private companies. With deep market expertise and a focus on innovation, FNEX facilitates efficient, secure, and strategic transactions in the private capital markets.

We are looking for a reliable and creative Social Media Assistant to help manage and grow our online presence. This is an entry-level, remote position perfect for someone who enjoys social media, has good communication skills, and pays attention to detail.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Create and schedule posts across social media platforms (Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, X, LinkedIn, etc.)

  • Engage with followers by liking, commenting, and responding to messages or questions

  • Help research trends, hashtags, and new content ideas

  • Monitor social media analytics and report on engagement and growth

  • Assist with creating captions, graphics, and short videos using tools like Canva or CapCut

  • Support the marketing team with general online tasks and promotions




Requirements





  • Basic understanding of major social media platforms

  • Good written communication and creativity

  • Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

  • Access to a smartphone, laptop, and reliable internet connection

  • Experience with tools like Canva, Buffer, or Hootsuite is a plus (but not required)




Benefits





  • 100% remote — work from anywhere

  • Flexible schedule

json.title: PowerPoint Formatting Expert
json.descriptionHtml:
PowerPoint Formatting Expert [$55/hr]


As referral partner, we are posting for experienced PowerPoint formatting specialists to support an ongoing professional presentation project with a fast-moving organization. This opportunity is ideal for individuals who excel at visual consistency, slide cleanup, and detail-oriented formatting. Freelancers will be responsible for elevating slide design strictly through layout and formatting—no content creation is required. This is a formatting-only engagement ideal for those with high availability.


Key Responsibilities

  • Clean and standardize PowerPoint decks to ensure visual polish and consistency
  • Apply consistent slide layouts, font treatments, and spacing
  • Format tables, charts, and graphics to align with provided templates or style guides
  • Troubleshoot formatting issues across complex or multi-author decks
  • Implement feedback quickly and accurately across multiple versions


Ideal Qualifications

  • Demonstrated expertise in PowerPoint formatting across professional or corporate decks
  • 2+ years of experience working on high-volume or deadline-driven presentation formatting projects
  • Strong eye for detail and visual alignment
  • Comfortable with repetitive, formatting-focused work
  • Ability to follow specific style guides and formatting instructions precisely


More About the Opportunity

  • Expected availability: 30+ hours/week required
  • Remote and asynchronous — set your own schedule
  • No content creation required — strictly formatting cleanup


Application Process

  • Submit your resume to get started
  • Qualified applicants may be asked to complete a brief formatting sample
  • Follow up within a few days with next steps

json.companySlogan: Great Talent. Great Value. Great Hiring.
json.companyDescription:
We started "Great Value Hiring" with a simple idea: to make meaningful connections. In a world of job boards and automated systems, we wanted to build a business that puts people first.

We are a talent solutions company passionate about bringing together great companies and exceptional individuals. We believe that the right job can transform a person's life and that the right hire can transform a business. Our focus is on creating win-win scenarios where both companies and candidates can achieve their full potential.
We're not limited to a single industry or type of role. Our broad focus allows us to serve a diverse range of clients and candidates, from entry-level positions to executive roles. Our goal is simple: to make the hiring process as efficient and effective as possible.

For us, it's not just about a single placement. It's about building long-term relationships and fostering a community where companies can grow and job seekers can find their calling. We're excited to be your partner on this journey.

json.title: Auto Optimization Specialist I
json.descriptionHtml:
|Current Gannett Employees- Please ensure you are using our abbreviated process on the internal Careers site by logging into Dayforce through MyApps|

Gannett Co., Inc. (NYSE: GCI) is a diversified media company with expansive reach at the national and local level dedicated to empowering and enriching communities. We seek to inspire, inform, and connect audiences as a scalable, growth focused media and digital marketing solutions company. We endeavor to deliver essential content, marketing solutions, and experiences for curated audiences, advertisers, consumers, and stakeholders by leveraging our diverse teams and suite of products to enrich the local communities and businesses we serve. Our current portfolio of trusted media brands includes the USA TODAY NETWORK, comprised of the national publication, USA TODAY, and local media organizations in the United States, and Newsquest, a wholly-owned subsidiary operating in the United Kingdom. Our digital marketing solutions brand, LocaliQ, uses innovation and software to enable small and medium-sized businesses to grow, and USA TODAY NETWORK Ventures, our events division, creates impactful consumer engagements, promotions, and races. Gannett open roles are featured on various external job boards. When applying to a position at Gannett, you should be completing an application on Gannett Careers via Dayforce. Job postings directing you to complete an application on other external sites may not be valid. To connect with us, visit www.gannett.com

Auto Optimization Analyst I

$55,000 – $60,000 | Excellent Benefits | Collaborative, Growth-Focused Team

Are you ready to accelerate your digital marketing career? Join our high-performing, supportive team as an Auto Optimization Analyst I — where data, creativity, and collaboration drive results. In this role, you’ll be hands-on managing paid search campaigns (SEM) and optimizing organic search (SEO) for top automotive clients, helping them dominate the search landscape and convert more leads.

We’re looking for someone with a passion for performance marketing and a knack for turning insights into action. If you love the thrill of improving ROI, experimenting with strategy, and seeing your optimizations translate into real business growth — this is the opportunity for you.

What You’ll Do

  • Manage and optimize paid search (SEM) and SEO campaigns with a strong focus on the automotive industry
  • Monitor, analyze, and fine-tune campaigns to maximize traffic, leads, calls, and conversions
  • Collaborate closely with Account Management and Sales teams to develop performance-driven digital strategies
  • Track KPIs, identify trends, and adjust tactics in real time to boost performance
  • Troubleshoot and resolve campaign challenges creatively and efficiently
  • Stay ahead of evolving search trends, algorithms, and technologies

What You Bring

  • 1+ years of experience managing SEM campaigns (SEO experience a plus)
  • A strong grasp of paid search platforms, conversion tracking, and analytics tools
  • Data-driven mindset with solid Excel and reporting skills
  • Ability to communicate strategy clearly to non-technical partners
  • Highly organized, detail-oriented, and motivated to learn and grow
  • A collaborative spirit and a passion for helping clients succeed

Why You’ll Love Working Here

  • Competitive Pay: $55,000 – $60,000 annually
  • Fantastic Benefits: Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and 401(k) with company match
  • Supportive Team Culture: You’ll join a collaborative, encouraging environment that celebrates innovation and shared success
  • Career Growth: Opportunities to advance, learn new tools, and make a real impact in the automotive digital marketing space
  • Flexibility & Balance: We value results and collaboration — not micromanagement

Ready to drive results and grow your career with a team that values your talent?

Apply today and help shape the future of automotive digital marketing!



    • Gannett Co., Inc. is a proud equal opportunity employer committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce. As such, we will consider all qualified applicants for employment and do not discriminate in connection with employment decisions on the basis of an applicant or employee’s race, color, national origin, ethnicity, ancestry, citizenship status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, marital status, personal appearance (including height and weight), sexual orientation, family responsibilities, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy status (including childbirth, breastfeeding or related medical conditions), education, genetic characteristics or information, political affiliation, military or veteran status or other classifications protected by applicable federal, state and local laws in the jurisdictions where Gannett employs employees. In addition, Gannett Co., Inc. will provide applicants who require a reasonable accommodation, as a result of an applicant’s disability or religion, to complete this employment application and/or any other process in connection with an individuals’ application for employment with Gannett Co., Inc. Applicants who require such accommodation should contact Gannett Co., Inc.’s Recruitment Department at Recruit@gannett.com.

json.companyDescription:
Statesman Journal is the primary source of news and information for our community.

Since the first edition of the Statesman Journal's predecessors rolled off the press more than 150 years ago, our mission has remained the same: to be the mid-Willamette Valley's primary source for local news and advertising information. 

The Statesman Journal is the largest news-gathering organization in the mid-Willamette Valley, focused solely on keeping readers informed about the events and people in their communities. Plus, our local news Web site keeps you informed on breaking news as it happens, 24 hours a day.

Our company core values guide us in providing readers and advertisers the best products and services possible.

json.title: Marketing Technology Operations Analyst
json.descriptionHtml:
Tired of the status quo? We're not just looking for an analyst—we're seeking a MarTech Visionary to orchestrate a true breakthrough in how we connect Marketing and IT. You won't just support systems; you'll be the technical pioneer who designs the next-generation marketing engine, turning strategic vision into seamless digital reality.

 

How you will contribute mightily to the Phillips mission:

This role demands a revolutionary approach to operational alignment, digital experience, and data unification. You will be the force driving our digital maturity:

  • Unify and Align: Erase the traditional silos. Serve as the primary Technical Architect and Liaison, ensuring every digital initiative and MarTech investment not only aligns with enterprise architecture but accelerates marketing's strategic objectives
  • Elevate the Digital Experience: Move beyond basic maintenance. Act as the technical steward for our corporate website, providing swift, Tier 1 support while strategically coordinating external developers to unlock new levels of performance, accessibility, and cutting-edge SEO compliance
  • Engineer the MarTech Stack: Drive transformation within our core platforms. Provide hands-on development, integration, and optimization for Microsoft Customer Insights - Journey and other key platforms, enabling unified data flow for actionable, measurable marketing outcomes
  • Pioneer Continuous Innovation: Don't just fix problems—innovate solutions. Identify systemic inefficiencies and relentlessly implement technology improvements, leveraging low-code solutions and process automation to simplify workflows and create a truly optimized operating model

 

What You'll Need to Lead the Charge

You possess the rare blend of deep technical skill, strategic insight, and a bias for action.

  • Experience Profile: 10+ years of progressive experience in MarTech, demonstrating a proven ability to bridge technology and business strategy
  • Platform Mastery: Hands-on expertise with Microsoft Customer Insights - Journey (or comparable marketing automation) and mastery of CMS platforms (WordPress, Sitecore, etc.)
  • Technical Agility: Proficiency in basic web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and advanced skills in API integration for marketing systems
  • Operational Excellence: Demonstrated success in strategic vendor management, coordinating high-impact external development, and troubleshooting complex Tier 1 issues
  • Visionary Communication: Exceptional ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders and inspire collaboration across IT and Marketing

The expected pay range for a qualified person in this role is between $115,000.00 and $140,000.00 per year. If you have a different suggestion, please mention it in your application.

Phillips Corporation is a global supplier of manufacturing technology products and services primarily focused on machine tools (metalworking). We have been in business over 60 years and have grown from 2 people to nearly 900 globally - come grow with us!

Phillips Corporation is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Phillips Corporation is an E-verify participant.

json.companySlogan: Experience Manufacturing Innovation
json.companyDescription:
For more than 60 years, federal government, industry and education leaders have trusted the people at Phillips Corporation to solve their greatest manufacturing challenges.   With a worldwide presence and partnerships with premier technology leaders like Haas Automation and EOS, our goal is to create legendary value for the manufacturing community by unlocking solutions to propel manufacturing capabilities, profitability, and productivity. 

Phillips is a global manufacturing solutions leader that started as a machine tool distributor, we’ve most recently established a Public-Private Partnership agreement to work with the U.S. Department of Defense to educate, inspire, and redefine the capabilities of additive manufacturing. 

Experience Manufacturing Innovation with Phillips! 

Connect with us and  learn more about the pride we take in the people who join us:  www.phillipscorp.com/showcase/careers 

Phillips Corporation Divisions:

Phillips Commercial Division (Colfax, NC, Philadelphia, PA) 
Phillips Federal Division (US)  www,phillipscorp.com/federal
Phillips Machine Tools India (India) www.phillipscorp.com/india

json.title: Digital Transformation Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
Company Description

SAJ Technologies is dedicated to digitally transforming government and private organizations. We take pride in delivering the best solutions to our valued clients with complete integrity and honesty. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in our high standard of performance, quality, and dedication. Our executives ensure staff maintain up-to-date certifications, use proven methodologies, and stay informed about technological advances to remain market leaders. Our passion for continual innovation drives us to serve the missions of our clients with utmost dedication.


FULL TIME

LOCATION: REMOTE

SALARY: $135K-$145K/YEARLY WITH W2

U.S. CITIZEN OR GREEN CARD


Role Description

Deliver expertise in digital strategy, security, technical policy development and end-to-end management, deployment, and training of Microsoft 365, cloud applications and related IT services. This team will advise on best practices and innovative solutions for cloud, endpoint security and AI, as well as leading demonstrations, proof of concepts, and ongoing support for ServiceNow, Adobe and SharePoint platforms.


Qualifications

  • Provide architecture and best practice guidance for Azure services such as compute, storage, networking and security
  • Design, implement, and maintain IAM solutions using Microsoft EntraID, conditional access and privileged identity management
  • Develop access policies, RBAC, and zero-trust frameworks to meet compliance requirements (FedRAMP, NIST, ISO 27001, etc.)
  • Identify process and workloads that can be transformed and modernized using Low-Code/No-Code solutions
  • Provide proof of concepts for all applicable IT related projects and initiatives

json.companySlogan: Your Partner in Digital Growth.
json.companyDescription: SAJ Technologies is created with a vision to digitally transform government and private organizations. Since its inception, SAJ Technologies has practiced its corporate responsibility and excellence in service to the very top of our operating policies. We take pride in delivering the best solutions to our valued clients with complete integrity and honesty, and we hold our employees to the same high standard of performance, quality, and commitment to the organization. Our executives are committed to ensuring that staff retain up-to-date certifications, apply tried-and-true solution methodologies and procedures, and stay updated about new technological advances so that we may remain market leaders. The reasons that drive our continual innovation are these common ideals, as well as SAJ Technologies’ passion for the missions we serve.

json.title: VP, Demand Generation
json.descriptionHtml:
Who We Are


At Firstup, our mission is to improve the employee experience at every moment that matters, large and small. As the communication pipeline for the world's workforce, we now serve 40 of the Fortune 100 companies, reaching and connecting more than 17 million employees daily.


Our employees are experts in the employee experience, workforce communications and technology. 

Joining Firstup means joining a movement to make work better for every worker. As the world’s first intelligent communication platform, Firstup meaningfully engages employees at every moment from hire to retire, and delivers engagement insights to help companies support, promote and retain their talent. Our movement has taken root and is evident in our world-class customer base. Now we need your help. Ready to make a difference in the world?


Our Values


Every employee is an owner with responsibility and credit for our progress.

Leadership is in our build and we see change as a catalyst for improvement.

We win as a team, committed to help our coworkers and customers thrive.



Position Overview


At Firstup, we’re transforming how companies connect with their people — and we’re looking for a bold, data-driven VP, Demand Generation to accelerate that mission.

This role is all about growth: driving pipeline, conversion, and revenue across every stage of the funnel. You’ll lead a global demand engine that blends inbound, outbound, ABM, digital, field, and SDR programs — all powered by insight, automation, and AI.

We’re looking for a modern marketing leader who can balance strategy and execution, scale global impact, and turn data into predictable revenue outcomes.


Responsibilities
  • Build & Execute Global Strategy: Design a world-class demand generation engine that delivers high-quality, scalable pipeline growth across the US and EMEA.
  • Own the Full Funnel: Manage the end-to-end journey — from awareness to closed-won — ensuring every touchpoint is measurable, optimized, and aligned to conversion goals.
  • Lead Multi-Channel Growth: Oversee inbound, outbound, ABM, field, digital (SEO, SEM, AEO), and SDR functions, integrating them into one high-performing, revenue-focused ecosystem.
  • Leverage Data & AI: Apply predictive analytics, intent data, and AI-powered targeting to prioritize accounts and accelerate engagement.
  • Accelerate Pipeline-to-Revenue: Partner closely with Sales and RevOps to improve conversion velocity, reduce deal cycles, and forecast with accuracy.
  • Optimize Efficiency: Continuously refine the channel mix, budget allocation, and ROI to maximize marketing’s impact on revenue.
  • Inspire & Develop Talent: Build, coach, and empower a global team of analytical, performance-driven marketers who thrive on results.
  • Report with Clarity: Provide executive stakeholders with actionable insights on pipeline health, conversion trends, and revenue performance.


Qualifications
  • 15+ years in B2B SaaS marketing, including 10+ years leading high-performing demand generation functions.
  • Proven ability to drive predictable pipeline and bookings growth through full-funnel, data-led strategies.
  • Deep understanding of funnel analytics, attribution, and lifecycle optimization.
  • Expertise in modern martech and AI-driven platforms — Salesforce, Marketo, Hockeystack, Clay, Outreachy, Gong, Chili Piper, and others.
  • Experience leading global teams across regions and aligning execution with Sales and Product Marketing.
  • Strategic mindset with operational excellence — you set vision, but you’re not afraid to get into the data.
  • Strong collaboration and executive communication skills; ability to influence across GTM functions.
  • Bonus: experience in HR tech, employee engagement, or internal communications SaaS.


What Success Looks Like
  • A predictable, high-quality pipeline that fuels revenue growth quarter over quarter.
  • Clear visibility from marketing investment to closed-won revenue.
  • Improved funnel velocity, conversion rates, and ROI.
  • A unified global demand team operating with precision, creativity, and accountability.



Firstup expects the base salary for this role to be between $220,000-$260,000. The starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience.


Why Firstup?

 

Because you care - about people, the work you do, and the connections you make. Work is such a large part of life; it only makes sense to make it awesome.

 

If you want to engage brilliant minds in a high-growth and inclusive environment where ideas are rewarded regardless of who they come from, join us. This is a rapidly changing space so if you thrive on ambiguity, are hungry for a challenge, and have the guts to speak your mind, you could be a perfect fit.

 

We offer an excellent PTO program, great health benefits, a casual and friendly environment, remote work, and a leadership team who truly believes in your growth – both personally and professionally.

 

Firstup is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants for employment and to all employees, without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, protected disability, veteran status, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state or local laws.
