json.companySlogan: A personalized experience for every employee.
json.companyDescription: Firstup’s mission is to improve the employee experience at every moment that matters. The Firstup intelligent communication platform empowers Comms, HR, and EX leaders to reach every employee and improve engagement with personalized omnichannel campaigns and real-time engagement data. Global enterprises such as Amazon, BBC, Dow, Hilton, Kraft Heinz, and Toyota use Firstup to connect millions of employees worldwide. Firstup’s vibrant community of 3,000 communicators is committed to elevating the employee experience. Learn more at firstup.io.

json.title: Junior Digital Marketing
json.descriptionHtml:
Our goal is to help every recent graduate worldwide find a job that aligns with their ambitions: join us to make the aspirations of a community of over 1,000,000 users come true!


We are constantly looking for students, recent graduates, and junior professionals who aspire to join our team. Apply for this position, and our HR team will contact you as soon as a role in this area becomes available and your CV matches the profile we are seeking.


For all Junior positions in the Marketing Field we offer a 6 months internship contract ($70,000 per year), you will have the opportunity to grow exponentially thanks to on-the-job training, you will be able to work fully remote for as long as you want and we will equip you with a latest generation MacBook.


We are coming to the US! If you would like to help Joinrs grow in your country, send your CV for this announcement: if your profile fits one of our future positions, we will contact you ;)

--


Responsibilities:

Within the team, you may be responsible for one or more of the following tasks:


  • Creation of the Digital Marketing strategy: together with the CMO, you will define the best strategy to make Joinrs known to all students and graduates in the target countries.


  • Social Media Management Support: You will be involved in planning and executing social media strategies, creating engaging content and interacting with our online community. You will learn to use platforms such as Facebook, TikTok, Threads, Instagram and X to increase brand visibility.


  • Digital Content Creation: You will participate in the creation of digital content, including blog posts, articles, email marketing and more. You'll have the opportunity to develop your copywriting skills and help maintain a relevant and engaging online presence.


  • Analysis of Marketing Metrics: together with the Data Analyst, you will use analytical tools to monitor the performance of digital campaigns. You'll analyze key metrics like website traffic, conversion, and social media engagement, making data-driven improvements.


  • Performance Marketing, Online Advertising Campaigns & Advertising: You will collaborate in the creation and management of online advertising campaigns through platforms such as Google Ads and social media advertising. You will be involved in choosing keywords, creating engaging ads and optimizing performance.


  • SEO (Search Engine Optimization): You will learn the basics of search engine optimization, helping to improve the visibility of our website. You will deal with keyword research, link building and other SEO practices to increase search engine rankings.


  • Graphic Design: If you have skills in Adobe, Figma, Canva or similar, you will have the opportunity to work with our graphic designers to create content for social media, for our website, for advertising campaigns and offline gadgets.



What We Offer:

Working in the Joinrs team means being able to choose the best psychophysical conditions for tranquility and productivity. This translates into:


  • Remote working and flexibility. You'll have the opportunity to work remotely full-time, but you can also use one of our offices.


  • Dynamic work environment. Our offices remain open, providing shared workspaces, meeting rooms, break areas, and a bar with fresh fruit and various snacks. You'll also find a foosball table and a gaming station. We aim for an informal work environment that encourages shared moments, always respecting individual activities.


  • Team building & fun. We frequently organize aperitifs, games, and leisure moments, which are integral parts of life at Joinrs, both inside and outside the office.


  • Company welfare. We guarantee you a company welfare package that meets your expectations.


  • Tech pack. You'll use advanced software and modern technologies, and you'll be provided with the latest-generation MacBook.


  • Training. You'll always have a mentor in your Joinrs journey, acting as a reference for both technical and team aspects. We ensure constant professional growth with progressively increasing responsibilities. You can participate in industry events and training courses, along with continuous education on the best e-learning platforms.


  • Social Impact. Your contribution will support thousands of recent graduates in finding the job they aspire to.


Who We Are:

Our mission is to support every recent graduate and junior professional in achieving their goals, helping them start their careers with optimism and a clear vision for their future.


We are a united team that strongly believes in collaboration: together we work, discuss, and achieve results that inspire us to aim for ever more ambitious goals.


Our community includes over 1,000,000 members across the US, UK, Europe, and Brazil, as well as 300+ companies like PwC, Accenture, Gi Group, Danone, and Siemens. And we’re growing fast—join us!

Contract & Compensation:

For all Junior positions we offer a 6-month internship contract with a salary of $70,000 yearly, aiming for a permanent contract.


The annual base salary is $70,000 (USD) which will be prorated based on internship start and end date. Actual compensation offered to the successful candidate may vary from posted hiring based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level, among other things.


Salary reviews are scheduled every six months, with your compensation increasing rapidly as you gain experience and translate it into a more significant impact.


Selection Process:

CV Screening: The first step is a curriculum vitae (CV) screening (usually within 20 days of application).


Phone Interview: The second step involves a 15-minute phone interview with our HR Manager.


Video Interview: The final step is a video interview with both the HR Manager and your future supervisor, lasting at least 45 minutes.


Why Join Our Team?

Social Impact: You'll have the opportunity to support our community in realizing their ambitions, as well as your own.


Successful Startup: Joinrs was selected among the top 10 startups globally at the Web Summit in Lisbon.


Exponential Personal Growth: You'll have the opportunity for exponential growth, both in hard and soft skills, thanks to a training program based on on-the-job training and online support.

json.companySlogan: Feel the new beginning.
json.companyDescription:
Joinrs is the window to the world of work for university students and junior profiles. It enables job seekers and companies to discover each other through shared experiences and guidance.

Our artificial intelligence model simplifies job searching: it reads all the job postings on the website and in the app and ranks them in order of compatibility based on user preferences.

On the other side, there are companies looking for young individuals ready to take on challenges. We help them find the right people from unexpected resumes and truly understand what matters to them today, making them more attractive.

Feel the new beginning.

[ Joinrs is the brand of Tutored ]

This is Joinrs Italia, here you can find 
Joinrs UK: https://www.linkedin.com/company/joinrs-en 
Joinrs US: https://www.linkedin.com/company/joinrs-us

json.title: Content Editor
json.descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Content Editor / Super Rater

Location: Remote (US)

Employment Type: Contract / Temporary

Duration: 3+ months with possibility of extension


Position Summary

The Super Rater is a high-performing content expert responsible for assessing content alignment with partner-provided guidelines. This role requires focus, critical judgment, and precise execution within timed tasks. Super Raters must balance speed with quality, remain detail-oriented under pressure, and adapt quickly to evolving instructions and workflows.


Education

  • Master’s degree preferred in English, Communications, Journalism, Linguistics, Psychology, or a related field.


Required Qualifications

  • Well-versed in Google Workspace (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Meet, Gmail) for documentation, collaboration, and reporting.
  • Ability to perform tasks within system-generated timers and meet deadlines.
  • Strong written communication, documentation, and analytical skills.
  • High degree of self-motivation, professionalism, and resilience in high-volume environments.
  • Comfort with ambiguity, evolving workflows, and complex instructions.
  • Strong time-management skills with the ability to stay focused under pressure.
  • Proficiency in computer operations and browser-based search strategies.


Preferred Experience

  • Prior experience as a Curator, Rater, Annotator, Editor, or Quality Reviewer.
  • Success in high-volume, time-bound content or rating roles.
  • Experience in AI/LLM evaluation, content moderation, or data-labeling platforms.
  • Familiarity with QA processes and productivity tools.


Key Responsibilities

  • Execute timed content-review tasks accurately and efficiently while meeting quality benchmarks.
  • Review and curate text, video, audio, and image content primarily in English.
  • Provide documentation and feedback to improve guidelines and workflows.
  • Maintain accuracy and consistency under deadlines in a high-output environment.
  • Report edge cases, anomalies, and behavioral trends to Task Leads.
  • Balance precision with speed and adapt to changing priorities and policies.



Digitive LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Partner, dedicated to fostering an inclusive environment. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, gender, nationality, caste, disability, or any legally protected characteristic. We ensure opportunities for all, based on skills, qualifications, and performance.

json.companySlogan: Digitive is a Boutique Staffing firm, specializing in high-end, niche IT, Tech, Cloud, and Digital Talent.
json.companyDescription:
Digitive is a boutique staffing firm specializing exclusively in high-end, niche IT, Tech, Cloud and Digital talent. We help solve the most challenging talent gaps at midsize to enterprise-level companies every single day, along with recently VC-funded startups facing mass hiring challenges and organizations facing urgent hiring needs. 

Digitive provides a personalized service attracting top national talent and our success is based upon the principles of honesty, integrity, and innovation. 

With over 20 year’s specialist recruitment experience, our team can assist your next hiring needs for contract, contract-to-hire, and full-time Tech and Digital talent.

json.title: Digital Accessibility Expert (US-based freelancer)
json.descriptionHtml:
Are you passionate about ensuring websites and applications are readily accessible to end-users utilizing assistive technologies? Are you knowledgeable about the guidelines defined by WCAG 2.0/2.1, Section 508 and other accessibility standards? If you enjoy collaborating with Developers and QA Engineers on accessibility standards and best practices this might be the perfect role for you!


*NOTE: This role requires having or acquiring Xfinity cable, phone, internet service


Responsibilities:

  • Act as one of the go-to SMEs on accessibility, WCAG guidelines and code-level remediation solutions for junior accessibility team members; provide regular audit reviews to ensure internal compliance with best practices
  • Prepare, run and report on feedback from user reviews and WCAG Audits
  • Be an educational resource to product teams, and running office hours
  • Identify quality issues proactively and setup training programs specific to teams or individuals to address them
  • Train new team members on accessibility compliance testing on desktop and mobile devices
  • Potentially run multiple projects with different customers


Qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or equivalent professional experience
  • 5+ years of experience in a professional Accessibility specialist capacity
  • Deep technical knowledge of accessibility; ability to provide code-level remediation and lead discussions with developers
  • Experience in and deep understanding of accessibility, including assistive technologies and WCAG checkpoints
  • Consulting agency experience and strong customer-facing skills
  • Self-starter, self-motivated, rolling up your sleeves with a focus on getting things done
  • Effectively multi task and manage concurrent activities
  • Comfortable working in a matrix environment across the organization in a collaborative manner'
  • Knowledge and fluency in using HTML, JavaScript and CSS to implement websites

json.industries: IT Services and IT Consulting, Design Services, and Software Development
json.companySlogan: Build better, faster. Release with confidence.
json.companyDescription:
Applause is the world leader in digital quality – built by innovators, powered by people and dedicated to the comprehensive digital testing and feedback needs of our global enterprise customers. Our fully managed solutions harness a powerful combination of community-based testing and advanced technology to ensure organizations can move quickly to release apps, devices and experiences that are consistently functional, intuitive and inclusive in any market. 

Our experts steward customers through the entire testing process, from strategy through execution, at every stage of the software development lifecycle. And, we seamlessly supplement existing resources, providing actionable, real-time insights that drive customer retention and revenue. 

With specialties including accessibility, AI and payment testing, we’re proud to be an essential partner to the most innovative names in the digital economy, as we work together to ensure technology works for everyone, everywhere.

Our disruptive approach harnesses the power of the Applause platform and leverages a vetted Community of more than one million digital experts worldwide. Unlike traditional testing methods (including lab-based and offshoring), we respond with the speed, scale and flexibility that digital-focused brands require and expect.

Applause provides insightful, actionable testing results that can directly inform go/no go release decisions, helping development teams build better and faster, and release with confidence.

json.title: Project Manager, Digital Marketing
json.descriptionHtml:
Seer Interactive is a digital marketing consultancy that harnesses compassion, data, technology, and AI to make a mark on our communities—our coworkers, our clients, our industry, and our neighbors. We relentlessly pursue (and share) the truth, bringing together millions of data points from quantitative and qualitative sources, enhanced by responsible, human-centered AI. Our purpose is to unlock potential across these communities, envisioning a world where doing the right thing is intuitive and informed.

At Seer, we see AI as a catalyst for innovation, collaboration, and creativity. Regardless of your division or discipline, leveraging AI is a core part of how we deliver smarter, faster, and more strategic outcomes for our clients. Our AI Council drives company-wide integration by focusing on education, purposeful implementation, and continuous learning — ensuring that AI is embedded in how we think, operate, and grow.

If you’re ready to uplift others, challenge your ego, commit to the truth, and be better than yesterday—keep reading.

Seer is a remote-first agency and a Certified B-Corp, with team members across the country. If an office environment is more your style, this position can also sit in our HQ office in Philadelphia. We can only consider candidates based in the US who can work continental US-based hours.

The Role: You’re a natural PM who loves optimizing workflow for efficiency and improving client delivery. You have a knack for collaborating with cross-divisional teams and motivating the people around you, ensuring all projects are running on-track and on-time to hit deadlines. You pay attention to the details without losing sight of the big picture and help your team members to do the same. Managing complex project timelines, competing priorities, risk, and budget is your jam and you use AI daily to help you do it. You’re the Digital Project Manager that teams dream of-- we can’t wait to meet you!

Role Highlights

  • You’ll be the primary point of contact for all new client requests on some of our highest priority accounts, working with our internal team to align on priorities and timing (1-5 accounts)
  • You will manage an integrated project plan, working with all service lines
  • You’ll plan and monitor resource utilization on the account, forecast workload, and bandwidth to proactively manage project budget, and allocate resources
  • You’ll track hours and costs to keep projects within budget, proactively raising red flags to finance and escalating to management as needed
  • You will manage and delegate tasks across team members as needed via our PM tool, Wrike.com, and/or a separate client-preferred project management tool
  • You will also manage resourcing assignments for your clients projects utilizing this tool
  • You will lead ongoing process improvements for driving greater efficiency across the company, supporting internal initiatives and operations
  • You will dive in head first to our AI tools and software to help juggle all priorities and even build out custom AI workflows to assist with efficiency day-to-day




Essential Skills

  • You have an innate talent for project management, who has experience wrangling team members, vendors, and Client stakeholders, in order to rally around a project plan and meet deadlines according to your client’s goals
  • Your approach to PM is proactive and you take anticipatory actions, demonstrating an ability to independently navigate tasks without needing explicit directions
  • You’ve managed projects with internal cross-functional teams of 8-10+ people
  • You have a working knowledge of digital marketing, including SEO, Paid Media, Data Analytics, and UX
  • You’re a champion of process and ongoing improvements with an without AI, educating the team on project management best practices while keeping your eyes/ears open for new opportunities to drive workflow efficiency, including using AI technology and tools
  • You know how to best forecast team bandwidth for upcoming projects and are quick to find workarounds for surprise roadblocks; your strong communication, organization, and time management skills are unmatched, and your team loves you for them!
  • You have experience interfacing directly with client POCs of all levels and can adapt your communication style and approach accordingly




90 Day Goals

  • Fully onboarded to your book of business, including a full understanding of your client’s scope and project plan
  • You’ve adopted Seer processes and make suggestions for how we can improve
  • You’ve started to build strong rapport and trusting relationships with clients and Seer teammates




This might not be the right role for you if

  • Time-management, context-switching, and juggling multiple projects is quite challenging
  • You do not want continued-learning and innovation to be an expectation
  • Change management is difficult and you struggle with adapting to new tools and processes
  • You are not comfortable or used to using AI every day to assist with your daily tasks




Compensation & Benefits

  • $70,000 - $82,000/ year - Your final offered compensation will be determined by your skills and experience
  • Evaluation of comp at least once a year
  • Benefit highlights




Ready to apply? Ditch the cover letter — we don’t need it. We’d rather see your AI chops. Use our Marketing Career AI Self-Assessment GPT to find out where you land on the AI marketing maturity curve and share your results with us. Our team is excited to read your application responses and will be using them to help determine who we’d like to meet with!

Have questions about recruitment at Seer? Check out our Custom GPT: Guide to Talent Acquisition at Seer to drop in your questions! You can ask it anything about our hiring process, and how to best prepare for an interview with us.

As a B-Corp Certified organization, we are committed to creating an inclusive environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Not ready to apply but want to keep in touch? Stay connected via our monthly Career Update newsletter! We'll share curated content on Seer, open roles, industry insights, career advice, events you don't want to miss, and more (so you never miss a beat).

Your final offered compensation will be determined based on your skills and experience

json.companySlogan: Certified B Corp | We help challenger brands make an impact using data & values to solve marketing’s toughest problems.
json.companyDescription:
Certified B Corporation™

Seer Interactive is a full-service search marketing agency for challenger brands that want to make an impact through digital marketing. We help you get measurable results that set you apart from the competition and impact your bottom line.

Our competitive advantage is our ability to deliver insights that are faster and better than anyone else. We do this through a combination of our People Philosophy and Proprietary Technology.

On the people side, the Seer team embodies our core values of uplifting others, committing to the truth, challenging their ego, and striving to be better than yesterday.

On the technology side, we have Seer Signals, our cloud-based data platform, which connects paid and organic search data in one experience. This platform delivers nearly real-time insights that are customized for your business and directly impact your bottom line.

We like to build tools, host webinars and create resources to help you, your business and your audience. You can find out more about our company, keep up to date on industry updates and more at www.seerinteractive.com.

json.title: Web Content Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
Our Metrowest digital agency is looking for a Web Content Specialist.


This role starts immediately and will be 15-20 hours a week, start this week and go until the end of November. You will need your own laptop for this one. The client is looking for support for a new healthcare website launch. Experinece with Sitecore or similar CMS required for this role.



We are seeking a detail-oriented Web Content Specialist to assist with website

page building, content migration, and updates within a content management

system (CMS). The ideal candidate will have strong organizational skills, a keen

eye for detail, and the ability to work independently while collaborating effectively

with our team.

Key Responsibilities:

• Build and update web pages in a CMS, following brand and accessibility

guidelines.

• Support content migration efforts from legacy platforms to new CMS

environments.

• Ensure all content is accurate, properly formatted, and optimized for the

web.

• Collaborate with stakeholders to review and approve content before

publication.

• Perform quality assurance checks to identify and resolve content or

formatting issues.

Required Qualifications:

• Proficient in working with web content management systems (CMS).

• Previous experience in website content migration projects.

• Strong attention to detail with a commitment to quality and accuracy.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to troubleshoot issues proactively.

• The ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively

Preferred Qualifications:

• Experience with Sitecore, Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Drupal, or

similar enterprise CMS platforms.

Familiarity with HTML/CSS basics and web best practices.

json.companyDescription:
Creative Cove Inc. is a staffing firm that specializes in placing highly skilled digital, design, marketing, and advertising professionals on a project, temporary-to-hire and full-time basis. Our clients range from mid-sized agencies to higher education to nonprofit and are located throughout Massachusetts, New Hampshire and Rhode Island.  
 
Many Creative Cove recruiters have prior experience working in the creative field, which gives us the ability to work in close partnership with clients to understand in depth their needs, culture and internal processes. We are confident that our expertise can help you find the right match, whether you are a client or a candidate.

Creative Cove Inc. is a division of Open Systems Technologies

json.title: Marketing Research & Data Analyst
json.descriptionHtml:
Ten Speed is a fully remote content marketing agency that helps B2B SaaS companies grow through high-impact SEO and content strategy. We’re hiring a Marketing Research & Data Analyst to lead day‑to‑day analysis, own recurring reporting, and help stand up the lightweight systems that make our work repeatable.

 

This is a full-time remote role open to candidates in IL, MI, MN, NC, FL, TX, CO, or ID. Salary range: $76,000–$88,000, plus strong benefits including 20 PTO days, wellness stipends, 401k match, and a professional development budget.

 

If you're analytical, data-driven, and passionate about leveraging insights and data-driven storytelling to drive real business outcomes, we’d love to meet you.


Role Overview

This mid‑level analyst splits time across three areas:

  1. Original research and insights that fuel content and PR for Ten Speed.
  2. Monthly reporting and analysis for client accounts.
  3. Data support for client projects that include surveys or first‑party datasets.

You will use SQL and modern BI tools, and you will apply AI responsibly to speed cleaning, exploration, and narrative drafting. This is an individual contributor role with room to grow.


Location, Salary & Benefits

  • Location: Remote (USA only — must reside in IL, MI, MN, NC, FL, TX, CO, or ID)
  • Salary Range: $76,000–$88,000 USD, depending on experience
  • Work Schedule: Flexible, with at least 4 hours overlapping Central Time
  • PTO: 20 vacation days + 7 personal/sick days + 9 holidays + 1 volunteer day
  • Health Benefits: 100% covered medical, dental, and vision for employee
  • Perks:
  • $500 one-time home office stipend
  • 401k matching
  • Wellhub membership
  • $1,000/year professional development budget
  • Summer Half-Fridays
  • 2 weeks sabbatical after 4 years
  • Bonus opportunities


What You Will Do

Over time and throughout each month, this role will be responsible for the following:

  1. Build and maintain monthly client dashboards and KPIs across GA4, GSC, HubSpot or other CRMs, and SEO tools.
  2. Run scoped ad hoc investigations that answer specific questions on content, GEO/SEO, and conversion performance.
  3. Clean, join, and QA datasets; write efficient SQL queries and simple views that support repeatable reporting.
  4. Support original research for content and PR by wrangling data, drafting charts, and surfacing headline findings.
  5. Assist with survey projects end-to-end: questionnaire review, response cleaning, basic weighting, significance tests, and clear summaries.
  6. Draft concise monthly narratives that explain drivers, anomalies, and next actions for stakeholders.
  7. Publish self‑serve dashboards in Agency Analytics, Looker Studio, or similar, and keep metric definitions and methods documented.
  8. Help maintain light data plumbing under guidance: connectors, source checks, naming conventions, and UTM hygiene.
  9. Use AI tools to speed SQL, EDA, de‑duplication, and first‑pass summaries while following privacy and quality guardrails.
  10. Document methods and templates so work is reproducible, and coach teammates on basic data literacy.


What You Bring

  • 4+ years in marketing analytics, market research, or adjacent fields in B2B or SaaS, with examples of published analyses or research‑backed content.
  • Strong SQL and working knowledge of Python or R for analysis and charting.
  • Experience with GA4, GSC, and a modern BI tool such as Looker Studio, plus comfort stitching data from CRM and SEO platforms.
  • Practical statistics: sampling, confidence intervals, hypothesis tests, and a sense for when simple beats complex.
  • Clear written communication that turns analysis into executive‑ready insights, not just dashboards.


Nice to Have

  • Familiarity with HubSpot reporting, Ahrefs or Semrush, and similar SEO/website analytics tools.
  • Experience with dbt basics, Fivetran or Census, and GitHub for versioning notebooks or queries.
  • Data storytelling or data journalism examples that led to coverage, links, or meaningful engagement.
  • Comfort designing or improving lightweight processes and documentation.
  • Thoughtful use of LLMs to improve speed and quality with transparent prompts and checks.


Tools You May Use Here

SQL, Python notebooks, BigQuery, Looker Studio, GA4, GSC, HubSpot, Ahrefs or Semrush, Amplitude, GitHub, dbt (basic), Fivetran, Census, Excel or Google Sheets.


What to Expect

Our hiring process is transparent, human, and built to help both sides assess mutual fit. Here’s what to expect:

  1. Apply Online - Submit your resume and brief application via the link below.
  2. Initial Screening Call (Intro + Fit Check) - A short conversation with our team to get to know you and your interest in the role.
  3. Skills Interview (Technical & Analytical Focus) - A deep dive into your technical knowledge and tools experience.
  4. Soft Skills Interview (Collaboration + Communication) - A conversation with a senior team member to explore how you work with clients and teams.
  5. Scenario-Based Panel Interview (Problem-Solving + Thinking in Action) - Participate in a discussion with peer-level team members around strategic scenarios, your approach, and decision-making.
  6. Offer & Background Check - Finalists will receive a formal offer and complete a background check.

Our ideal timeline is to complete interviews and extend an offer by the end of November.


About Ten Speed

Ten Speed is a remote-first marketing agency that helps B2B SaaS companies grow through SEO-driven content marketing. We believe in building high-impact content engines that actually drive pipeline and revenue — not just pageviews.

 

Our team is collaborative, transparent, and curious. We value strategic thinking, accountability, and creating a workplace where marketers can do the best work of their careers while living balanced lives.

Learn more at tenspeed.io.


How to Apply

This position is fully remote and open to U.S.-based candidates in select states. Click the button below to apply. A background check is required for final candidates.

 

Ten Speed is an equal opportunity employer. We strongly encourage people of color, LGBTQIA+ individuals, individuals with disabilities, and parents to apply. If you need accommodations or have questions, please contact us at careers@tenspeed.io.

json.companySlogan: Ten Speed is the marketing agency that drives sustainable, long-term growth for B2B brands.
json.companyDescription:
Ten Speed is an SEO & Content Marketing agency that partners with Seed to Series C SaaS companies by offering a comprehensive set of services that include: 

Strategy & SEO consulting, content creation (writing and editing), routine optimization and updating existing content, and content distribution (via social media).

Founders Nate Turner and Kevin King started the agency after building and scaling the successful SEO-focused content engine at Sprout Social, which helped fuel growth to over $100m in ARR.

After a decade of firsthand learning experiences, Ten Speed was established to help other SaaS founders and marketing leaders create successful content marketing programs of their own.


We exist to bring deep expertise and high-quality tactical implementation to companies that otherwise couldn’t pursue content optimization.

Ten Speed brings together all of the best parts of SEO tools, strategy consulting and content marketing agencies into one convenient and effective service.

json.title: Web Analyst
json.descriptionHtml:
We’re looking for a Web & Business Analytics Specialist who will partner closely with the Data Science and Product Analytics teams to improve visibility into user behavior, conversion, and engagement across digital properties. The ideal candidate has hands-on experience with Amplitude and web analytics tools, strong business acumen, and the ability to translate raw data into clear, actionable insights.


Job Title: Web & Business Analytics Specialist

Contract Period: 12 month contract

Working Location: United States (100% Remote)

We need a candidate with experience in implementing Amplitude.

Hands-on experience with Amplitude (event setup, dashboards, funnel analysis).


Qualifications

4+ years of experience in web/product/digital analytics or business intelligence.

Deep experience with Amplitude (event setup, dashboards, behavioral cohorts, funnel analysis).

Strong knowledge of GA4, Google Tag Manager, and data visualization tools (Looker, Tableau, Power BI).

Solid understanding of user behavior analysis, A/B testing, and marketing funnel optimization.

Proficiency in SQL and comfort querying large datasets.

Strong communication skills — ability to partner with both technical and non-technical teams.


Key Responsibilities

Implement and manage analytics tracking: Define, validate, and maintain event tracking across websites and apps using Amplitude, GA4, and Google Tag Manager (or similar tools).

Analyze product and marketing performance: Build and interpret dashboards that surface key insights about user engagement, conversion, and retention.

Collaborate cross-functionally: Work with Product, Marketing, and Engineering to ensure accurate tracking and consistent reporting across tools.

Develop business insights: Transform behavioral and funnel data into strategic recommendations for acquisition, activation, and retention.

Support experimentation and A/B testing: Partner with data science to measure and interpret test outcomes, leveraging Amplitude’s experimentation and cohorting capabilities.

Ensure data quality: Audit event schemas, tracking plans, and data flows between Amplitude, Segment, and other analytics systems.

json.jobPosterTitle: Sr. Technical Recruiter @ MindSource | MCA, MBA (HRM)
json.companySlogan: Your Technical Solutions Partner
json.companyDescription:
MindSource has delivered software solutions for over two decades to many hundreds of Silicon Valley companies.  Our success is based on deep technical foundations, commitment to client satisfaction and our extended worldwide network of technical talent.

json.title: Sponsored Content Editor
json.descriptionHtml:
About The Britannica Group

The Britannica Group owns two of the world's most valuable and trusted sources of knowledge: Encyclopaedia Britannica and Merriam-Webster. Britannica has been operating since 1768, and Merriam-Webster since 1828. These digital-first brands now serve a global audience of more than 200 million users a month - via our websites, newsletters, social channels, games, and more.

About The Content Studio

The newly formed Content Studio creates high-quality editorial, branded, and commerce content across newsletters and websites. We partner with advertisers, affiliates, and sponsors to tell stories that connect readers with products, services, and ideas they can trust.

About The Role

The newly formed Content Studio is seeking a versatile and self-starting Sponsored Content Editor to take ownership of all paid content (newsletter ads, dedicated emails, branded content pieces and campaigns) across the Britannica Group's media properties. Reporting to the Managing Editor, this role will sit within the Content Studio but collaborate daily with the Sales and Partnerships, Advertising, and Affiliate teams.

The Sponsored Content Editor will draft compelling, original ad copy and produce branded stories that deliver value to both readers and partners. This position requires creativity, efficiency, and strong organizational skills — balancing client goals with editorial credibility while working quickly and collaboratively.

Responsibilities

  • Uphold Britannica's high editorial standards, ensuring all copy is clear, accurate, engaging, and trustworthy.
  • Alongside the Managing Editor, take ownership of all advertising copy for the inbox and the web
  • Help set a standard for the newly formed Content Studio in terms of production quality, editorial excellence, and client satisfaction
  • Collaborate with the Managing Editor to allocate budget for branded campaigns
  • Write or assign out branded stories that meet client goals, serve readers, and reflect the brand's voice
  • Partner with the Sales, Partnerships, Ad, and Affiliate teams, and when asked, the client, to support the management and execution of client partnerships.
  • Leverage available data to inform your overall strategy, both on a granular, copyediting level and when brainstorming new campaigns.
  • Use analytics provided by the Account Managers to refine copy strategies and improve campaign outcomes
  • Seamlessly transition between your day-to-day advertiser copy tasks and longer-tail branded content projects
  • Bring an editorial perspective to client brainstorms, campaign kick-offs, and strategy sessions

Requirements

  • 5+ years in branded content, advertising copywriting, or in a hybrid role bridging digital media and marketing
  • Proven ability to write persuasive, performance-driven copy across platforms
  • Strong copy-editing skills and the ability to adapt to multiple brand voices
  • Highly organized and deadline-driven, with strong project management skills
  • Experience working directly with sales, partnerships, or client teams
  • Familiarity with affiliate marketing and performance-based campaigns
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Dynamic and flexible — able to pivot between short-form ads and long-form branded content with ease
  • Self-starter with initiative — comfortable owning projects end-to-end
  • Ability to analyze results and adjust strategies accordingly

Benefits

The anticipated annual base salary range for this position is $90,000-$120,000. Actual compensation will be determined based on factors such as the candidate's experience, skills, and geographic location.

json.companySlogan: Inspiring curiosity and the joy of learning since 1768. #EB250
json.companyDescription:
The Encyclopaedia Britannica Group is a global knowledge leader whose flagship products—from Encyclopaedia Britannica®, Britannica® Digital Learning, Britannica Knowledge Systems®, Merriam-Webster®, and Melingo®—inspire curiosity and joy of learning on multiple platforms and devices. Encyclopaedia Britannica, founded in Edinburgh, Scotland in 1768, marks its 250th anniversary this year. 

A pioneer in digital learning since the 1980s, the company today serves the needs of students, lifelong learners, and professionals by providing curriculum products, language-study courses, digital encyclopedias, and professional readiness training through its extensive products.

json.title: Marketing Specialist (Remote)
json.descriptionHtml:
Landen is an organic skincare brand established in Denmark, Copenhagen in 2020. We create hair and body care products made from botanical ingredients. With gentle, yet effective formulations and a focus on minimalist design Landen believe in encouraging positive habits of wellbeing.

About The Role

We are seeking an ambitious and highly motivated Marketing Specialist to join us and help grow our business in North America.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute marketing and communication initiatives;
  • Plan, write, edit and proof-read various communication materials including marketing collateral, blogs, print magazine, newsletters and social media posts;
  • Develop and implement cusromer acquisition and retention campaigns;
  • End-to-end coordination of the events
  • Liaise with external stakeholders and suppliers;
  • Curate and update website and app content including news and events;
  • Identify and approach potential sponsors and advertisers.

Relevant Skills & Attributes

  • Equivalent of a Degree in Marketing / Communications;
  • Outstanding communication skills with the ability to create effective written communications that accurately conveys our values and ideals;
  • Proficient in the use of Adobe Creative Suite software (Indesign, Photoshop);
  • A proven track record in participating in continuous improvement activities is a plus;
  • A 'can do' attitude and a willingness to work in a team environment.

What We Offer

  • Competitive remuneration and salary packaging options.
  • Commitment to diversity, inclusion, health and wellbeing of our people.
  • Gym membership & health insurance
  • Flexible and hybrid working environment including tailored hours, remote working, career breaks, study leave, generous paid parental leave and leave purchase plans.

Wed love to hear from you

If you meet a number of the requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application. We highly value diverse life experiences and perspectives and were open to adapting the role to suit the right person. You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn (link removed). Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Landen is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Landen is committed to embracing a diverse, inclusive and flexible work environment. We aim to attract and retain the best people regardless of their sex/gender, marital or parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, age, background, disability, sexual orientation, and gender identity.

json.title: Remote Marketing Contractor - Personal Growth Industry
json.descriptionHtml:
Are you an experienced digital marketing professional ready to scale your career in the fast-growing personal development and online education industry?

We’re seeking a results-driven Digital Marketing Contractor to design, execute, and optimize high-converting digital campaigns promoting our established personal development programs to a global audience.

This fully remote role offers performance-based earnings and the chance to build a global digital business presence from anywhere.

Responsibilities

  • Develop and execute integrated digital marketing strategies across multiple platforms, including SEO, PPC, email marketing, content marketing, and social media advertising
  • Create compelling digital campaigns that drive brand awareness, qualified leads, and online conversions
  • Manage and nurture leads via CRM platforms and marketing automation tools
  • Analyze metrics and KPIs using Google Analytics and conversion tracking to optimize ROI
  • Collaborate with the marketing team to scale successful initiatives using data-driven growth strategies
  • Conduct A/B testing, audience segmentation, and campaign optimization for continuous performance improvement

Requirements

  • Minimum 2+ years’ proven experience in digital marketing, lead generation, or performance marketing
  • Proficiency in digital tools such as Google Ads, Meta Business Suite, SEO software, and email marketing platforms (e.g., Mailchimp, ActiveCampaign)
  • Strong communication, copywriting, and presentation skills
  • Self-motivated and organized professional with excellent time management skills
  • Entrepreneurial, results-oriented mindset with measurable success metrics
  • Ability to operate independently in a remote, contractor-based role

What We Offer

  • High earning potential: $100K–$200K annually (performance-based)
  • Remote flexibility: Work from anywhere, on your own schedule
  • Comprehensive onboarding: Proven systems, ongoing mentorship, and training in digital advertising and advanced funnels
  • Established brand: Operate within a globally recognized personal development company with an expanding online footprint

Compensation

Independent contractor position with performance-based income tied directly to results and campaign success.

Eligibility

  • Must be legally eligible to work in the United States
  • Not suitable for students or entry-level candidates

Keywords: digital marketing, remote marketing job, online advertising, lead generation, content marketing, performance-based marketing, personal development, online education, work from home, global marketing

json.title: Climate Pledge Data Entry Associate
json.descriptionHtml:
Client is seeking a detail oriented short term Data Entry Associate to assist The Climate Pledge team. We are looking for an individual with excellent attention to detail, highly organized, ability to manage large volumes of data, and all within a fast-paced environment.


Responsibilities

  • Validate and input accurate information into Salesforce.
  • Identify and execute streamlined and efficient processes to ensure quick and accurate data entry.
  • Complete high-volume tasks within a set deadline.


Required Skills

  • 1+ years of related work experience
  • 1+ years of experience with Salesforce and Excel or related work experience


Preferred Skills

  • Must have high attention to detail, be well organized and a self-starter
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with strong interpersonal communication skills
  • Comfortable operating in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment
  • Advanced data entry experience with the ability to navigate and manipulate large data sets


Day to Day:

  • Data entry and data maintenance
  • Salesforce for data entry
  • Help input data, edit data, maintain data on signatories
  • Keep an eye on items to keep track of
  • If companies are reporting their emissions, etc
  • Onboard them via website that is linked to salesforce to carry them through the onboarding journey
  • Support the companies on their pledge


Interaction level with team:

  • PM and manager daily
  • Weekly team meeting
  • Biweekly meeting with partner that founded Climate Pledge with this team


YOE:

  • 1+ years of related work experience
  • 1+ years of experience with Salesforce and Excel or related work experience
  • Salesforce/data entry


Degree’s/Cert Required:

  • College degree


Must Have Skills:

  • Salesforce Experience – critical
  • Data Entry
  • Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook)


About US Tech Solutions: US Tech Solutions is a global staff augmentation firm providing a wide range of talent on-demand and total workforce solutions. To know more about US Tech Solutions, please visit www.ustechsolutions.com.

US Tech Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.


Recruiter: Zeeshan Ali

E-mail: zeeshan.ali@ustechsolutionsinc.com

Internal ID: 25-49979

json.title: Contract Content Marketing Coordinator (Remote)
json.descriptionHtml:
The physical location for the candidate selected must reside within the contiguous United States. Please note this is a contract role. Hours expected would be 2 days a week, 7.5 hours per day.

WHO WE ARE!

Susan G. Komen brings a 100% virtual working environment, and you can work anywhere within the U.S. We are a force united by a promise to end breast cancer forever. For over 40 years, we've led the way funding groundbreaking research, community health initiatives and advocacy programs in local communities across the U.S. Susan G. Komen is the ONLY organization that addresses breast cancer on multiple fronts such as research, community health, global outreach, and public policy initiatives to make the biggest impact against this disease.

Komen strives to have a culture of passionate, growth-minded professionals who thrive in a team environment and work collaboratively to inspire greatness in others! We take an ongoing approach to ensure open communication from all levels throughout the organization. It’s encouraged to give and receive feedback to ensure two-way accountability with a focus on continual improvement both personally and professionally!

What you will be doing in the role of a Content Marketing Coordinator (Contract)

The Temporary Content Marketing Coordinator will support the Brand Marketing team by assisting with analytics, reporting, SEO implementation and content/ project management across digital platforms. This role will work cross-functionally with internal stakeholders and external partners to ensure consistent brand execution and optimized content performance. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, organized and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. Hours expected would be 2 days a week, 7.5 hours per day.

What You Will Bring To The Table

  • Analytics and Reporting
  • Pull and compile data for weekly, monthly and quarterly performance reports.
  • Track and analyze performance metrics for ShareForCures and other mission-related programs.
  • Support ad campaign tracking and contribute to insights that inform future content strategies.
  • SEO and Content Optimization
  • Coordinate with Komen’s SEO partner agency to request reports, gather recommendations and summarize key findings for internal teams.
  • Support foundational SEO best practices on the back end of web pages and YouTube videos, administrative support for update.
  • Content Management and Distribution
  • Manage YouTube channel uploads, organize videos, maintaining naming conventions and ensuring consistent branding.
  • Support the optimization of digital content across Komen.org and other owned platforms such as, embedding YouTube content and linking landing pages in YouTube descriptions.
  • Project Management and Collaboration
  • Oversee design requests from Mission in Asana, ensuring timelines are met and requests continue to move through the appropriate brand marketing team members.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Creative, Digital and Mission, to support ongoing content initiatives.
  • Draft basic ad copy and assist with campaign coordination as needed.

We Know You Will Have And Be Able To

  • Bachelor’s degree and 1–3 years of experience in digital marketing, content coordination, or a related role.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Familiarity with SEO principles and analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, SEMrush, YouTube Studio).
  • Experience with Asana or similar project management software a plus.
  • Excellent communication and writing skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to shifting priorities.

So, what’s in it for you?

Komen Believes In The Importance Of Taking Care Of Our Employees So That In Turn They Can Be Committed To Supporting Our Critical Mission To Support Those Impacted By Breast Cancer And To Help Find Cures.  This Is What Komen Provides Away From The Computer

Competitive range of $21.54-$28.21/hour, exact compensation ranges are based on a range of factors including but not limited to the labor market, job level, internal equity, and budget. Offersgiven will takeinto consideration the candidate's skills, education, experience, geographic location, and other necessary credentials.

  • Flexible work arrangement in a fully remote working environment
  • A culture of learning and development
  • Bi-weekly pay days
  • And so much more!

Komen provides a remote and/or home-based working environment for all active employees. Komen defines remote as the ability to work from any physical location within the U.S. where an employee can perform specified work duties without disruption or distraction. Komen defines home-based roles as positions that are required to reside in a specific market. Work schedules for both remote and home based are determined by the organizational needs of each department.

Susan G. Komen is fair and equal in all its employment practices for people without regard to age, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation. Additionally, we embrace Diverse Teams & Perspective, and we find strength in the diversity of cultural backgrounds, ideas, and experiences.

SORRY NO AGENCIES

json.industries: Philanthropic Fundraising Services, Non-profit Organizations, and Hospitals and Health Care
json.companySlogan: A force united by a promise to end breast cancer, funding groundbreaking research, community health & advocacy programs.
json.companyDescription:
In 1980, Nancy G. Brinker promised her dying sister, Susan, that she would do everything in her power to end breast cancer forever. Two years later, that promise became the Susan G. Komen® organization and the beginning of a global movement. For over 40 years, we've led the way funding groundbreaking research, community health initiatives and advocacy programs in local communities across the U.S. and in more than 30 countries. And with your help, we’ll continue pushing for progress to end breast cancer every day, until it’s a thing of the past. For information on breast cancer and breast health, please call: 1-877- GO KOMEN or visit http://komen.org/

Join us on social media:
Facebook: www.facebook.com/SusanGKomen
Twitter: www.twitter.com/SusanGKomen
Instagram: @SusanGKomen
Pinterest: www.pinterest.com/SusanGKomen
Blog: blog.komen.org

json.title: Remote Marketing Coordinator Fellow - SEO & Web Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
Remote Marketing Coordinator Fellow - SEO & Web Specialist


Highlights plus Highly Preferred Experience

  • Fellowship with the potential for full-time employment upon completion of the program
  • $25/hour during Fellowship (~8 hours per business day)
  • $45,0000 - $55,000 starting salary for entry-level full-time Marketing Coordinators, with lots of opportunity to grow
  • Must have experience creating and executing SEO strategy and leveraging SEO tools (SEMRush, ahrefs, etc)
  • Minimum 1 year experience working as a marketing coordinator, project coordinator, account manager, or similar role, plus familiarity with PM tools such as Asana, HubSpot, Workfront, etc
  • Minimum 2 years marketing experience 
  • Must have a foundational understanding of how strategy, creative, and analytics intersect to drive awareness, engagement, and conversions, as well as familiarity with the broader sales funnel and how different marketing touch points contribute to business growth
  • This includes experience with data analysis and the ability to recommend future client strategy based on industry trends and best practices


About Raborn Media's Fellowship Program

The Raborn Media Fellowship Program is a 3 month program that aims to identify, develop, cultivate, and retain talent to build a more robust and agile team that delivers exceptional services to our clients. The Fellowship Program allows individuals to gain valuable insight into the marketing industry, hone their current skills, develop new skills, and potentially gain full-time employment after completing the program.


Core Competencies

The Raborn Media Fellowship Program provides an opportunity for professionals to showcase a robust skill set that includes:

  • Solution-Oriented Problem Solving 
  • Critical Thinking
  • Project Management 
  • Professional Communication
  • Cross-Team Collaboration 
  • Time Management
  • Effective Decision Making
  • Task Delegation and Follow-up


Must Have Qualifications

  • Authorization to work legally in the United States
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Extraordinary attention to detail with an eye for catching small errors
  • The ability and willingness to learn project management tools and processes
  • Customer service experience and the willingness to go above and beyond to exceed clients' expectations
  • The ability to think critically to make informed and logical decisions independently
  • A team player mindset with a desire to learn and constantly grow your skillset
  • Strong organizational skills
  • A knack for developing creative solutions to complex problems by thinking outside the box


Responsibilities

  • Assists with projects and tasks that support general client initiatives and goals
  • Supports marketing strategies by helping ensure projects are delivered on time, on scope, and within budget
  • Develops and fosters a sense of trust and subject matter expertise with clients
  • Helps develop SEO strategies that align with client goals and specifications for all digital media, including website and social platforms 
  • Develops and presents creative briefs
  • Helps coordinate client projects and serves as a liaison between the client and Raborn Media's creative team
  • Coordinates and tracks advertising schedules and marketing activities for assigned clients
  • Creates, assigns, and maintains tasks within project management software to ensure project milestones are met, the creative team understands their assignments, and projects are completed on time and in full
  • Provides constructive criticism on marketing materials, including website, graphic design, branding, video, social media, copywriting, and other work, especially as it relates to SEO
  • Maintain awareness of current industry and technology standards, competitive landscape, and market trends
  • Communicates with clients daily to ensure all of the client's needs are being met
  • Takes notes and transfers them to project management software to be used for direction for internal teams
  • Organizes, collaborates, and coordinates work between designers, developers, and copywriting teams
  • Performs other duties as assigned


Employment Opportunity

After completing the Fellowship Program, Fellows may be asked to continue their tenure in a full-time role as a Marketing Coordinator with Raborn Media. However, full-time employment is not guaranteed and ultimately depends on the organization's needs and the Fellow's performance during the program. Full-time Marketing Coordinators can expect to earn between $45,000 and $55,000 annually, with regular opportunities to increase base pay and receive bonuses.


Benefits for Full-Time Employees

  • Vanguard 401(k) With the Following Match: 100% Match of First 3% and 50% Match of Next 2%
  • 17 Days PTO Plus 13 Paid Holidays
  • Company Health Insurance Plan: The firm pays 50% of the employee's monthly premium. All dependents added must be paid 100% by the employee.
  • Company Dental and Vision Insurance Plans: The firm offers vision and dental plans but pays no premiums.
  • Maternity and Paternity Leave


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

json.companyDescription:
At Raborn Media, we provide an innovative and strategic approach to online marketing. We put a premium on getting to know you and your company to ensure that our services embody the very essence of your business. Our honest and transparent style ensures that you will have the utmost confidence in your investment with us. In short, our goal is to understand, meet, and exceed your goals.

The world of online marketing is continuously changing and with a new platform or trend emerging everyday, it’s hard to find stable footing to ensure your business is on the right track. That’s where we come in. We see this fast-changing field as one thing – opportunity.

Our team keeps innovation and creativity at the forefront of our work. As the digital age continues to emerge, we’re in the middle of it all finding ways to connect your business with target consumers.

json.title: Remote Digital Marketing Contractor – Personal Development Industry | $100K–$200K+ Potential
json.descriptionHtml:
Remote Marketing Contractor – Personal Development Industry (High-Earning Potential)

Are you an experienced digital marketer ready to scale your income and impact in the booming personal development industry?

We’re seeking a results-driven Marketing Contractor to promote our personal development and coaching programs to a global online audience. This remote, performance-based marketing role offers unlimited earning potential for high achievers.

Key Responsibilities

  • Plan, develop, and execute digital marketing campaigns across social media, paid ads, email, and content marketing channels
    • Create and manage sales funnels to drive awareness, engagement, and conversions
    • Use CRM tools and marketing automation platforms to build and nurture customer relationships
    • Track, analyze, and report campaign performance metrics to optimize ROI
    • Work closely with our marketing team to scale successful lead generation initiatives

    What You’ll Bring

    • 2+ years of marketing experience with measurable success
    • Strong skills in digital advertising, online lead generation, or affiliate marketing
    • Excellent copywriting and communication skills
    • Highly self-motivated, goal-oriented, and able to work independently
    • Familiarity with marketing tools (e.g., Google Ads, Meta Ads, Mailchimp, HubSpot, ClickFunnels, etc.)
    • Ambitious mindset with financial and performance goals
    • Comfortable in a remote work environment

    What We Offer

    • 💰 High earning potential: $100K–$200K+ annually (performance-based)
    • 🌎 Work from anywhere: 100% remote and flexible schedule
    • 🎯 Comprehensive training: Full onboarding and continuous support
    • ⚙️ Proven systems: Access to established marketing resources and templates
    • 🚀 Growth industry: Join the expanding global personal development and e-learning market
    • 🤝 Mentorship: Collaborate with experienced marketing leaders

    Compensation Structure

    This is an independent contractor position with performance-based compensation. Your income directly reflects your results, consistency, and commitment.

    Ready to Take Your Marketing Career Global?

    If you’re an ambitious digital marketing professional seeking flexibility, freedom, and financial growth in a thriving industry, apply today and become part of our global success story.

    Requirements

    • Must be legally eligible to work in the United States
    • Prior business or marketing experience required
    • Not suitable for students or entry-level applicants


Keywords: digital marketing, remote marketing job, online advertising, lead generation, content marketing, performance-based marketing, personal development, online education, work from home, global marketing

json.title: Digital Marketing Manager
json.descriptionHtml:
Waverly Advisors’ primary goal is to serve our clients, one another, and our communities. We aren’t your typical wealth management firm. Our intense client focus is at the center of everything we do. We go far beyond just managing our clients’ investments, offering truly in-depth financial planning. We set ourselves apart by actually living and acting on our guiding principle, ‘Serve.’ It is the reason we go to work every day.


In this role, you’ll be challenged to take on work that upholds our guiding principle and drives Waverly Advisors forward. We hope you’ll grow as a person and leader in your field and transform those around you as well.


The Digital Marketing Manager is a strategic leader responsible for driving digital visibility, lead generation, and brand credibility in a competitive HNW advisory market. This role blends modern marketing strategy, AI-enhanced technology, SEO expertise, and online reputation management, all executed within the framework of strict regulatory compliance.

You will help position the firm as a trusted authority by elevating its digital footprint across web, search, social, and email—translating strategy into measurable outcomes that support growth and client trust.


Skills & Responsibilities:

Digital Strategy & Campaign Planning

  • Develop and implement integrated digital strategies that support firm growth, HNW client acquisition, and retention goals.
  • Define audience segments (e.g., business owners, retirees, next-gen wealth) and craft targeted messaging accordingly.
  • Stay informed on industry trends, AI marketing advancements, and evolving compliance rules.

SEO & Website Optimization

  • Own all aspects of on-page and off-page SEO (technical SEO, schema markup, link building, keyword targeting).
  • Continuously optimize site UX and content to drive organic visibility and conversions.
  • Use AI tools to scale content optimization efficiently.
  • Manage firm’s Google Business Profile, ensuring accuracy, reviews monitoring, and local SEO impact.

Online Reputation & Reviews

  • Monitor and manage the firm’s online presence across Google, LinkedIn, industry directories, and review platforms.
  • Proactively manage and respond to reviews within regulatory guidelines.

Email Marketing & Lead Nurturing

Work with the marketing team to:

  • Build segmented email campaigns for clients, prospects, and centers of influence (COIs).
  • Design and optimize drip campaigns and educational series for long-term engagement.
  • Ensure compliance with email marketing regulations (CAN-SPAM, SEC/FINRA rules).

Paid Advertising & Retargeting

Work with the marketing team to:

  • Plan and manage paid campaigns via Google Ads, LinkedIn, and Facebook to target HNW prospects.
  • Leverage retargeting, geo-targeting, and AI-driven bid optimization to enhance ROI.
  • Ensure all advertising assets (copy, disclosures, performance claims) adhere to compliance standards.

Analytics, Reporting & Attribution

  • Monitor key performance metrics: site traffic, lead volume, cost per acquisition, and conversion rates.
  • Use Google Analytics, and other platforms to produce monthly/quarterly dashboards.
  • Leverage AI or predictive analytics tools for marketing attribution and performance forecasting.


Travel:

  • Some travel is required.


Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of digital marketing experience, ideally in financial services or a regulated industry.
  • Strong grasp of SEO, local search, digital ads, and AI content tools.
  • Deep understanding of online reputation management and compliance-sensitive marketing.
  • Analytical mindset with comfort interpreting KPIs and applying insights.
  • Strong communicator, collaborator, and project manager with high attention to detail.
  • Familiarity with SEC/FINRA regulations or demonstrated ability to learn quickly.


Physical Requirements:

  • Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
  • Must be able to lift 15 pounds at times.

Benefits:

  • Health, Dental, and Vision benefit options
  • 401K
  • Twelve paid holiday days per year
  • Extra vacation day on your birthday week
  • Three weeks of PTO, increasing to four weeks after three years of service (PTO is accrued quarterly)
  • Four weeks paid sabbatical program after seven consecutive years of service, maximum of two sabbaticals while employed with us
  • Compensation commensurate with experience

Legal:

Waverly Advisors, LLC. is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, gender, genetic information, national origin, disability, uniform service, veteran status, age, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law. Interested in applying? If you believe you would be a good fit for our team and would like to be considered for this position, please apply via LinkedIn.

json.companySlogan: Offering comprehensive investment management and financial planning services.
json.companyDescription:
Welcome to Waverly Advisors, LLC—simplifying the complexities of wealth management and financial planning since 1999. Our passion drives us, integrity guides us, and earning your trust is central to our mission.

For more than two decades, we’ve helped clients navigate the sophisticated needs that come with wealth. With 290+ team members in offices across the U.S., we provide comprehensive services rooted in strong personal relationships, disciplined strategies, and independent advice.

As a fee-only, federally registered investment advisory firm, we serve high-net-worth individuals and families, corporate retirement plans, trusts, endowments, and institutions—managing over $17.3 billion in assets. Our retirement plan services include plan design, consulting, and investment oversight, operating as an ERISA 3(38) fiduciary.

At Waverly, we listen. We take time to understand your goals, then build tailored strategies designed to support your life, family, and future. You don’t work with just one advisor—you gain a full team of specialists with deep technical knowledge and a shared commitment to your best interest.

Our fiduciary standard means we are bound by the duties of care and loyalty—always putting your needs first. We recognize that every wealth journey is different, and our advice evolves with yours.

While expertise is essential, what sets us apart is empathy. Our team brings curiosity, care, and long-term perspective to every relationship—helping you move forward with clarity and confidence.

Investment advisory services are offered by Waverly Advisors, LLC, ("Waverly"), an investment adviser registered with the Securities and Exchange Commission.

©2025 Waverly Advisors, LLC. All rights reserved.

json.title: Web Content Coordinator
json.descriptionHtml:
Our Metrowest digital agency is looking for a Web Content Specialist.

This role starts immediately and will be 15-20 hours a week. The client is looking for support for a new healthcare website launch. Experience with Sitecore or similar CMS required for this role.



We are seeking a detail-oriented Web Content Specialist to assist with website

page building, content migration, and updates within a content management

system (CMS). The ideal candidate will have strong organizational skills, a keen

eye for detail, and the ability to work independently while collaborating effectively

with our team.



Key Responsibilities:

• Build and update web pages in a CMS, following brand and accessibility

guidelines.

• Support content migration efforts from legacy platforms to new CMS

environments.

• Ensure all content is accurate, properly formatted, and optimized for the

web.

• Collaborate with stakeholders to review and approve content before

publication.

• Perform quality assurance checks to identify and resolve content or

formatting issues.



Required Qualifications:

• Proficient in working with web content management systems (CMS).

• Previous experience in website content migration projects.

• Strong attention to detail with a commitment to quality and accuracy.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Ability to troubleshoot issues proactively.

• The ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively

Preferred Qualifications:

• Experience with Sitecore, Adobe Experience Manager (AEM), Drupal, or

similar enterprise CMS platforms.

• Familiarity with HTML/CSS basics and web best practices.

json.companySlogan: We are a staffing firm that specializes in placing highly skilled digital, design, marketing, and advertising people!
json.companyDescription:
Creative Cove Inc. is a staffing firm that specializes in placing highly skilled digital, design, marketing, and advertising professionals on a project, temporary-to-hire and full-time basis. Our clients range from mid-sized agencies to higher education to nonprofit and are located throughout Massachusetts, New Hampshire and Rhode Island.  
 
Many Creative Cove recruiters have prior experience working in the creative field, which gives us the ability to work in close partnership with clients to understand in depth their needs, culture and internal processes. We are confident that our expertise can help you find the right match, whether you are a client or a candidate.

Creative Cove Inc. is a division of Open Systems Technologies

json.title: Chief Marketing Officer
json.descriptionHtml:
Chief Marketing Officer (CMO): Dental Support Organisation (DSO)


Job Title

Chief Marketing Officer: Dental Support Organisation (REMOTE)


Salary/Package

Competitive six-figure base ($180K - $240k) + performance bonus + equity potential + comprehensive benefits


About the Organisation:

A dynamic multi-site DSO with a growing footprint across the Western U.S., backed by strong investment and a vision to become the most patient-trusted and clinician-preferred brand in dental care.


The organisation supports clinicians with full-spectrum non-clinical functions including marketing, operations, HR, finance, and analytics.


They are now seeking a Chief Marketing Officer to lead brand strategy, digital transformation, and growth initiatives driving patient acquisition, clinician recruitment and overall market expansion.


Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute a comprehensive marketing strategy that drives new patient acquisition, brand awareness and clinic-level growth.
  • Lead digital transformation. including SEO, paid media, CRM, website optimisation, and analytics, to optimize marketing ROI.
  • Partner with Operations and Clinical teams to ensure marketing aligns with patient experience and practice performance goals.
  • Build and manage a high-performing marketing team across brand, digital, and field marketing.
  • Oversee clinician recruitment marketing, building campaigns that attract and retain top dental talent.
  • Manage relationships with external agencies and vendors to ensure brand consistency and impact.
  • Leverage data analytics to monitor performance, refine strategy, and guide executive decision-making.
  • Act as a key member of the executive leadership team, contributing to overall business strategy and growth planning.


Candidate Requirements:

  • 4+ years of marketing leadership experience within DSO, healthcare, or multi-site consumer healthcare.
  • Proven track record driving patient acquisition and brand growth through digital and traditional channels.
  • Experience managing multi-location marketing programs and optimizing marketing ROI.
  • Strong understanding of healthcare compliance in advertising and patient communications.
  • Experience in brand strategy, media, CRM and digital platforms.
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and analytical skills.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or Communications; MBA preferred.


Certifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, or Communications; MBA preferred.


Why Join:

  • Strategic seat at the executive table with clear influence on company direction.
  • Opportunity to shape one of the fastest-growing brands in the DSO market.
  • Creative autonomy backed by strong financial investment.
  • High-impact role bridging patient experience, clinician attraction, and corporate growth.


Featured Benefits:

  • Executive medical, dental, and vision
  • Hybrid
  • Competitive remuneration
  • Equity participation (dependent on seniority and experience)
  • Paid parental leave
  • Hybrid flexibility and travel support

We are Verrus.

json.title: Digital Marketing Manager
json.descriptionHtml:
We are seeking a Marketing Manager to lead and execute marketing strategies across multiple businesses. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in website design, social media content creation, and digital marketing analytics. This role requires creativity, attention to detail, and the ability to manage projects for more than one company simultaneously.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and implement marketing strategies for businesses.
  • Design and maintain websites using WordPress; ensure modern, user-friendly layouts.
  • Create engaging social media content for platforms such as Facebook, Instagram, and TikTok.
  • Monitor and improve SEO performance using tools like Google Analytics.
  • Collaborate with leadership to align marketing efforts with business goals.
  • Manage multiple projects and prioritize tasks across different companies.


REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • 3–5 years in marketing, with proven success in website design and social media management
  • Technical skills in WordPress, Canva, SEO tools, and Adobe Creative
  • Strong portfolio showcasing website design and social media campaigns.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities.


NICE TO HAVE SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

  • Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Digital Media, or related field (preferred).


Expected pay: $90-100k
