Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/storagerentalsofamerica/

json.title: Growth Lead
json.descriptionHtml:
Remote | Full-Time

tribechat.com


About Tribe

Tribe is where you can find delightful human group chats around shared interests.

We’re building a new kind of group chat platform that helps people connect through shared passions, real identities, and exciting subcultures. We are focused on bringing each human closer to their interests as well as other humans who share them.


We’re looking for a Growth Lead to own all efforts to grow Tribe’s user base and global presence. This role is perfect for someone who thrives on experimentation, knows how to scale audiences across multiple platforms, and can turn creative ideas into measurable results. This position will report directly to the CEO Rajat Asuri.


Responsibilities

Own Tribe’s growth strategy end-to-end: identify, test, and scale the best mix of tactics for user acquisition and engagement.

Social presence & community building: grow Tribe’s visibility across social channels, including content, campaigns, and partnerships.

Experimentation: design and run experiments across channels (organic, paid, partnerships, referrals, influencer campaigns) to find scalable growth levers.

Analytics & iteration: track performance metrics, analyze results, and double down on what works.

User insights: stay close to early adopters and communities, bringing back insights to refine messaging and product positioning.

Collaboration: work directly with the founders and product team to align growth initiatives with Tribe’s vision.


Requirements

Proven experience growing social audiences and driving measurable user growth for a product, ideally in social, consumer, or community platforms.

Deep understanding of multiple social channels and their growth dynamics.

Strong creativity combined with a data-driven mindset—able to run tests, measure results, and adjust quickly.

Entrepreneurial spirit: comfortable with ambiguity, scrappy experimentation, and wearing many hats.

Excellent communication skills and a knack for storytelling that resonates with online communities.

Experience with paid acquisition (social ads, influencer partnerships, referral programs).

Familiarity with growth frameworks (AARRR funnel, loops, viral mechanics).

Past work in startups, consumer apps, or community-focused platforms.


Why Join Tribe?

Be part of a ground-breaking early-stage startup redefining how communities connect online.

A tonne of responsibility as the only growth lead in the organization

Freedom to experiment, create, and directly shape growth strategy.

Work closely with experienced, successful founders who are obsessed with product and community.

A chance to scale a platform that’s all about meaningful conversations and connections. Your friends and family can use this, and you'll meet a lot of new people on the app too!


To apply: Find a way to add 20 users you don't know to any given tribe on the Tribe app (could be your own!) and send an email to raj@tribechat.com explaining how you did this and your thoughts on the best strategy for scaling the app. As a small startup working very closely together, want to see both how you strategize and how you execute!

json.title: Content Writer | $40/hr Remote
json.descriptionHtml:
At Crossing Hurdles, we work as a referral partner. We refer candidates to our partner that collaborates with world’s leading AI research labs to build and train cutting-edge AI models.


Position: Generalist Evaluator Expert

Type: Hourly Contract

Compensation: $35–$40/hour

Location: Remote

Duration: Approximately 1 month

Commitment: Minimum 10-40 hours/week, flexible and asynchronous


Role Responsibilities (Training support will be provided)

  • Design and optimize detailed prompts with multiple constraints and clear instructions for language model evaluation
  • Define and document evaluation standards and develop comprehensive rubrics for assessing correct responses in consumer contexts
  • Conduct testing and grading by running prompts through AI models and assessing outputs against expectations
  • Support benchmarking and quality assurance to ensure prompt rigor and consistency before integration into official evaluation sets
  • Collaborate with team members in quality assurance review processes to maintain evaluation reliability


Requirements

  • BS or BA degree from a reputable institution (completed or in progress)
  • Strong writing skills, critical thinking, and instructional clarity
  • Ability to work independently and meet deadlines
  • Significant familiarity with ChatGPT or similar language tools for personal or professional use
  • Experience in teaching or research is preferred
  • Access to a desktop or laptop computer (Chromebooks are not supported)


Application process: (Takes 20 min)

  1. Upload resume
  2. AI interview based on your resume (15 min)
  3. Submit form

json.companyDescription:
At Crossing Hurdles, we specialise in customised recruitment and staffing solutions designed to drive success for businesses and professionals. Our focus is on connecting organisations with top-tier talent by sourcing, screening, and presenting only the top 1% of candidates across a wide range of industries. We work closely with clients to understand their unique needs, ensuring that we find candidates who not only fit the role but also align with their organizational culture.

Over the past few quarters, we've successfully partnered with leading companies such as Angel One, Ixigo, Turing, Cars24, Veera, ABP Network, Battery Smart, Zavya, and Twin Engineers. Our expertise spans various sectors, including Tech, Product, Sales, Customer Support, Growth, Finance, and Marketing. At Crossing Hurdles, our mission is to help organizations thrive by matching them with exceptional talent while simultaneously enabling candidates to find opportunities that foster long-term career growth and development.

json.title: Senior Frontend Engineer - Grafana Data Transforms
json.descriptionHtml:
This position is posted by Jobgether on behalf of a partner company. We are currently looking for a Senior Frontend Engineer - Grafana Data Transforms in the United States.

This role offers the opportunity to work on cutting-edge data visualization and transformation tools that empower users to extract meaningful insights from complex datasets. You will contribute to designing, building, and maintaining scalable frontend systems, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to enhance performance, usability, and reliability. The position involves interacting with both internal teams and the broader user community to ensure that features and improvements are driven by real-world needs. You will be part of a dynamic, remote-first environment that values autonomy, innovation, and a strong user-first mindset. Ideal candidates are proactive, technically strong, and passionate about shaping how users interact with and transform data.

Accountabilities

  • Design, build, operate, and maintain frontend systems that support data transformation and visualization
  • Collaborate with your team to deliver new features and iterate on existing functionality based on user feedback
  • Engage with community and customer feedback to identify opportunities for product improvements
  • Ensure reliability, performance, and maintainability of frontend code across the platform
  • Influence product roadmap and contribute to setting team priorities and goals
  • Mentor peers, share knowledge, and promote best practices in code quality and frontend engineering


Requirements

  • Proven experience building frontend applications, preferably using React and TypeScript
  • Strong understanding of software engineering best practices, testing, and documentation
  • Experience delivering end-to-end projects independently, from requirements gathering to production
  • Pragmatic, curious, and capable of balancing engineering trade-offs
  • Excellent communication skills, particularly for a remote-first, distributed team
  • Ability to adapt in fast-paced, evolving environments and manage multiple priorities
  • Passion for community engagement and open-source software
  • Bonus: experience with cloud-based software, systems engineering, or high-scale web applications


Benefits

  • 💻 100% remote-first work environment with global collaboration
  • 💵 Competitive base salary between USD 148,505 - USD 178,206, with potential equity and bonuses
  • 📚 Career growth and skill development opportunities
  • 🏥 Comprehensive medical and dental benefits
  • 🌱 Inclusive and transparent company culture focused on autonomy and innovation
  • 🌍 Flexible work schedule aligned with EST time zones
  • 🌟 Employee ownership through Restricted Stock Units (RSUs)
  • 🏖️ Generous global annual leave policy including company-wide shutdown days

Jobgether is a Talent Matching Platform that partners with companies worldwide to efficiently connect top talent with the right opportunities through AI-driven job matching.

When you apply, your profile goes through our AI-powered screening process designed to identify top talent efficiently and fairly.

🔍 Our AI evaluates your CV and LinkedIn profile thoroughly, analyzing your skills, experience, and achievements.

📊 It compares your profile to the job's core requirements and past success factors to determine your match score.

🎯 Based on this analysis, we automatically shortlist the three candidates who best match the role.

🧠 When necessary, our human team may perform an additional manual review to ensure no strong profile is missed.

The process is transparent, skills-based, and free of bias — focusing solely on your fit for the role. Once the shortlist is completed, we share it directly with the company that owns the job opening. The final decision and next steps (such as interviews or assessments) are managed by their internal hiring team.

Thank you for your interest!

json.companySlogan: The AI-driven global platform to hire and get hired, efficiently. The right talent. The right job. Instantly connected.
json.companyDescription:
Job search is broken. Talents waste hours applying blindly, companies drown in irrelevant CVs.
Jobgether flips the model.
We’re an AI-powered career coach and matching platform helping people land remote and flexible jobs faster.
Jobgether designs your job search strategy, prepares you to stand out, and connects you only with roles that truly match.
Finding a job isn’t about applying to hundreds of listings anymore, it’s about having the right strategy and visibility to attract the right opportunities.

Purpose & Vision
Our purpose is to make remote job search guided, fast, and effective, reducing frustration and wasted effort for both talents and employers.
We envision a world where careers are built with intention, not luck.
Where flexibility is the norm.
Where no talent remains invisible.

Jobgether exists to ensure that every professional has a real chance to find the right remote job.

json.title: Marketing Strategist | Upto $200K/yr
json.descriptionHtml:
About The Job

Mercor connects elite creative and technical talent with leading AI research labs. Headquartered in San Francisco, our investors include Benchmark, General Catalyst, Peter Thiel, Adam D'Angelo, Larry Summers, and Jack Dorsey.

Position: AI Sales and Marketing Data Specialist

Type: Full-time

Compensation: $90,000–$200,000/year

Location: In-person at Palo Alto, CA office (5 days per week) or Remote

Commitment: 40 hours/week

Role Responsibilities

  • Use proprietary tools to annotate and label data for sales and marketing projects, ensuring exceptional accuracy and contextual relevance.
  • Deliver curated datasets that reflect real-world scenarios in sales strategy, marketing execution, and customer engagement.
  • Collaborate with technical teams to improve annotation workflows and develop efficient labeling systems for complex business data.
  • Support the training and evaluation of AI models through data selection, analysis, and refinement.
  • Adapt to evolving task guidelines, maintaining precision and professional judgment in fast-changing environments.
  • Apply analytical reasoning to identify and solve complex sales and marketing challenges that enhance model performance.

Qualifications

Must-Have

  • Proven professional experience in sales, marketing, or related roles such as sales manager, marketing strategist, or sales representative in wholesale or retail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with strong command of professional and conversational English.
  • Strong interpersonal, organizational, and analytical abilities.
  • Ability to exercise independent judgment and deliver consistent results under limited supervision.
  • Deep interest in the intersection of technology, innovation, and commercial strategy.

Preferred

  • Certifications or formal training in sales or marketing (e.g., sales management certification, marketing accreditation).
  • Experience mentoring or training others in sales or marketing best practices.
  • Familiarity with AI, data annotation, or model training processes.
  • Comfort participating in recorded sessions for data collection or evaluation purposes.

Compensation & Legal

  • Competitive pay ranging from $90,000 to $200,000 annually for U.S.-based professionals, depending on experience and location.
  • For international candidates, our recruiting team will share a localized compensation range based on your region and experience.
  • Specific benefits may vary by country; depending on your location, you may be eligible for comprehensive medical coverage.
  • U.S.-based applicants must reside outside of Wyoming and Illinois.
  • Visa sponsorship is not available.

Application Process (Takes 20–30 mins to complete)

  • Submit your resume or CV.
  • Participate in a 20-minute introductory interview to discuss your background and qualifications.
  • Successful candidates will move forward to a 15-minute follow-up call with the recruiting team.
  • Those who advance will participate in a technical discussion focused on their sales and marketing expertise.
  • Complete a take-home data annotation challenge.
  • Conclude with a meet-and-greet with the team.

Resources & Support

  • For details about the interview process and platform information, please check: https://talent.docs.mercor.com/welcome/welcome
  • For any help or support, reach out to: support@mercor.com

PS: Our team reviews applications daily. Please complete your AI interview and application steps to be considered for this opportunity.

,

json.title: Web Developer
json.descriptionHtml:
📍 Location: Remote

🕒 Job Type: Full-Time

🏢 Department: IT / Development

📑 Reports to: Technical Lead / Project Manager


We are seeking a creative and technically skilled Web Developer to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, coding, and maintaining websites and web applications across various industries. This role requires proficiency in front-end and back-end technologies, strong problem-solving skills, and the ability to deliver responsive, user-friendly solutions that align with business goals.


Key Responsibilities

  • Design, develop, and maintain websites and web applications.
  • Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code using best practices.
  • Ensure websites are optimized for speed, performance, and mobile responsiveness.
  • Integrate front-end designs with back-end services and databases.
  • Conduct testing and debugging to ensure cross-browser and cross-platform compatibility.
  • Collaborate with designers, content creators, and stakeholders to deliver engaging digital solutions.
  • Maintain website security, troubleshoot issues, and apply necessary updates.
  • Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies, frameworks, and industry trends.
  • Create reusable code libraries and workflows to support team efficiency.
  • Perform routine backups and ensure proper version control.


Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
  • Proven experience as a Web Developer, Software Engineer, or similar role.
  • Proficiency in HTML, HTML5, CSS, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, and PHP.
  • Experience with REST APIs, JSON, and SOAP.
  • Strong understanding of cross-browser compatibility, responsive design, and security principles.
  • Hands-on experience with CMS platforms (WordPress, Drupal, etc.).
  • Familiarity with both Windows and Linux environments.
  • Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with attention to detail.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork abilities.


Preferred Qualifications

  • Experience with frameworks such as React, Angular, or Vue.js.
  • Knowledge of server-side technologies (Node.js, Python, or Ruby).
  • Familiarity with MySQL, MongoDB, or PostgreSQL databases.
  • Experience with version control systems (Git, GitHub, GitLab).
  • Understanding of SEO best practices.
  • Cloud platform knowledge (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).

✨ If you are passionate about creating innovative web solutions and thrive in a collaborative environment, we’d love to hear from you.


📩 How to Apply: Please submit your resume and portfolio of previous web development projects.

json.companySlogan: Making companies a better place. One app at a time.
json.companyDescription:
Odoo is an open-source suite of integrated business applications actively programmed, supported, and organized by Odoo SA. Odoo is similar to many open-source projects where customized programming, support, and other services are provided by an active global community and partners network. The community is comprised of more than 1,500 active members and has contributed more than 4,500 modules to the ongoing enrichment of Odoo. The network of certified partners, established in more than 120 countries, deploys the solution locally. The software, with more than 1,500 downloads a day, is one of the most frequently installed business suites worldwide.

All Odoo Apps such as Odoo CRM, Odoo Sales, Odoo Accounting, Odoo WMS (Warehouse Management), Odoo HR, Odoo Project, Odoo Events, Odoo Marketing, etc. are integrated with each other.

Odoo is an open-source alternative to many software packages. It can be used by any retailer with its POS (Point Of Sales), and in any website with its CMS (website builder) synchronized with the e-Commerce app. In the enterprise resource planning software field, Odoo is an alternative to SAP ERP, Oracle E-Business Suite, Microsoft Dynamics, Netsuite, and others.

Odoo has offices in the US, Belgium, Luxembourg, India, Hong Kong, Dubai and Mexico. 

Awards:
- 2011 - INSEAD Innovator Award
- 2012 - Highest-ranked Belgian company in the Deloitte Technology Fast50 Benelux (growth of turnover of 1549% in the past 5 years).
- 2012 & 2013 - Bossie Award for the Best Open Source Solution
- 2013 - Trends Gazelles Award
- 2013 - Linux New Media Award for The Best Open Source solution compatible with European Accounting Systems
- 2013 - “L’Entreprise Prometteuse” by Ernst & Young
- 2018 - Trends Gazelles Ambassador 2018 for Middle Enterprises in the Walloon Brabant region
- 2020 - "Deal of the Year" by Trends-Tendances
- 2021 - "Manager of the Year 2020" by Trends-Tendances
- 2021 - Trends Gazelles Walloon 2021 in the Large Business Category

json.title: Staff Software Engineer, Social Media & Client Marketing
json.descriptionHtml:
Luxury Presence is the leading digital platform revolutionizing the real estate industry for agents, teams, and brokerages. Our award-winning websites, cutting-edge marketing solutions, and AI-powered mobile platform empower real estate professionals to grow their business, operate more efficiently, and deliver exceptional service to their clients. Trusted by over 80,000 real estate professionals, including 31 of the nation’s 100 top-performing agents as published in the Wall Street Journal, Luxury Presence continues to set the standard for innovation and excellence in real estate technology.

The Role

We’re spinning up a new team to take our client marketing platform to the next level — and we’re looking for a Staff Software Engineer to lead the charge. This team will own our social media offering, helping real estate professionals unlock 24/7, done-for-you marketing at scale.

This is a 0→1 opportunity with a small, high-agency squad (2–3 engineers). You'll partner with product, design, and AI to prototype rapidly, ship intelligently, and build AI-native tools that turn marketing into magic.

If you’ve worked on social, martech, or influencer platforms — or if you’re active on social media yourself — you’ll feel right at home. Bonus points if you’ve built integrations with TikTok, Instagram, or Facebook APIs, or have PropTech experience.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead the design and implementation of core systems for our social media marketing tools
  • Drive greenfield projects to deliver social-ready content pipelines, scheduling tools, and distribution integrations
  • Define architecture for scalable, AI-native experiences that serve thousands of clients
  • Rapidly prototype features using AI in your day-to-day (Langchain, OpenRouter, etc.)
  • Mentor a small team while remaining hands-on in code and technical decisions
  • Partner across AI, product, and marketing to bring innovative ideas to market fast
  • Push the boundaries of what social marketing can do for real estate pros



What We’re Looking For

  • Passion for building in an AI-augmented environment with rapid iteration
  • Experience with social media platforms, marketing tools, or creator ecosystems
  • 8+ years in full-stack engineering, with hands-on leadership in product development
  • Expertise in JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, and React
  • Strong systems thinker; comfortable designing scalable microservice architectures
  • Experience with event-driven systems (Kafka/SQS), GraphQL, and distributed databases
  • SaaS background with preference for multi-tenant and platform experiences
  • Strong communication and cross-functional collaboration skills
  • Real estate tech (PropTech), social platform APIs, or martech experience is a plus



Tech Stack

  • Frontend: React, Tailwind, Apollo, SingleSPA
  • Backend: Node.js, TypeScript (microservices), Python ETLs
  • AI: LangChain, LangFuse, OpenRouter, Mastra
  • Data: PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, Elasticsearch
  • Infrastructure: AWS, Kubernetes, Lambda
  • Messaging: Kafka, SQS



Join us in shaping the future of real estate
The real estate industry is in the midst of a seismic shift, and the future belongs to those who break new ground. As one of the fastest-growing companies in the proptech and marketing sectors, Luxury Presence challenges the status quo of what technology can do for real estate agents, leaders, and brokerages.

We’re a team of agile and tenacious innovators working collaboratively to drive the industry forward. Together, we build game-changing products that empower modern real estate entrepreneurs to dominate their markets. From award-winning web design to agile SEO solutions to cutting-edge AI tools, we deliver tech that anticipates market shifts and keeps our clients ahead of their competition.

Founded in 2016 by Stanford Business School alum Malte Kramer, Luxury Presence has grown to a global team ranked on the Inc. 5000 fastest-growing companies list three years in a row. We’re backed by world-class investors, including Bessemer Venture Partners, Toba Capital, and Switch Ventures, and have raised $52.6 million to date.

More than 15,000 real estate businesses rely on our platform, including 31 of the RealTrends top 100 agents featured in The Wall Street Journal. Additionally, many of the industry’s most powerful brokerages — including Compass, Coldwell Banker, and Sotheby’s International Realty — rely on Luxury Presence as a trusted business partner.

Every year since 2020, Luxury Presence has ranked on BuiltIn’s Best Place to Work lists. HousingWire named our founder and CEO a 2024 Tech Trendsetter, we’ve received several Tech100 Awards, and our lead nurturing tool just scored an Inman Innovation Award for Best AI-Powered Platform.

Luxury Presence is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.
json.descriptionText: Luxury Presence is the leading digital platform revolutionizing the real estate industry for agents, teams, and brokerages. Our award-winning websites, cutting-edge marketing solutions, and AI-powered mobile platform empower real estate professionals to grow their business, operate more efficiently, and deliver exceptional service to their clients. Trusted by over 80,000 real estate professionals, including 31 of the nation’s 100 top-performing agents as published in the Wall Street Journal, Luxury Presence continues to set the standard for innovation and excellence in real estate technology.The RoleWe’re spinning up a new team to take our client marketing platform to the next level — and we’re looking for a Staff Software Engineer to lead the charge. This team will own our social media offering, helping real estate professionals unlock 24/7, done-for-you marketing at scale.This is a 0→1 opportunity with a small, high-agency squad (2–3 engineers). You'll partner with product, design, and AI to prototype rapidly, ship intelligently, and build AI-native tools that turn marketing into magic.If you’ve worked on social, martech, or influencer platforms — or if you’re active on social media yourself — you’ll feel right at home. Bonus points if you’ve built integrations with TikTok, Instagram, or Facebook APIs, or have PropTech experience.What You’ll DoLead the design and implementation of core systems for our social media marketing toolsDrive greenfield projects to deliver social-ready content pipelines, scheduling tools, and distribution integrationsDefine architecture for scalable, AI-native experiences that serve thousands of clientsRapidly prototype features using AI in your day-to-day (Langchain, OpenRouter, etc.)Mentor a small team while remaining hands-on in code and technical decisionsPartner across AI, product, and marketing to bring innovative ideas to market fastPush the boundaries of what social marketing can do for real estate prosWhat We’re Looking ForPassion for building in an AI-augmented environment with rapid iterationExperience with social media platforms, marketing tools, or creator ecosystems8+ years in full-stack engineering, with hands-on leadership in product developmentExpertise in JavaScript/TypeScript, Node.js, and ReactStrong systems thinker; comfortable designing scalable microservice architecturesExperience with event-driven systems (Kafka/SQS), GraphQL, and distributed databasesSaaS background with preference for multi-tenant and platform experiencesStrong communication and cross-functional collaboration skillsReal estate tech (PropTech), social platform APIs, or martech experience is a plusTech StackFrontend: React, Tailwind, Apollo, SingleSPABackend: Node.js, TypeScript (microservices), Python ETLsAI: LangChain, LangFuse, OpenRouter, MastraData: PostgreSQL, DynamoDB, ElasticsearchInfrastructure: AWS, Kubernetes, LambdaMessaging: Kafka, SQSJoin us in shaping the future of real estateThe real estate industry is in the midst of a seismic shift, and the future belongs to those who break new ground. As one of the fastest-growing companies in the proptech and marketing sectors, Luxury Presence challenges the status quo of what technology can do for real estate agents, leaders, and brokerages.We’re a team of agile and tenacious innovators working collaboratively to drive the industry forward. Together, we build game-changing products that empower modern real estate entrepreneurs to dominate their markets. From award-winning web design to agile SEO solutions to cutting-edge AI tools, we deliver tech that anticipates market shifts and keeps our clients ahead of their competition.Founded in 2016 by Stanford Business School alum Malte Kramer, Luxury Presence has grown to a global team ranked on the Inc. 5000 fastest-growing companies list three years in a row. We’re backed by world-class investors, including Bessemer Venture Partners, Toba Capital, and Switch Ventures, and have raised $52.6 million to date.More than 15,000 real estate businesses rely on our platform, including 31 of the RealTrends top 100 agents featured in The Wall Street Journal. Additionally, many of the industry’s most powerful brokerages — including Compass, Coldwell Banker, and Sotheby’s International Realty — rely on Luxury Presence as a trusted business partner.Every year since 2020, Luxury Presence has ranked on BuiltIn’s Best Place to Work lists. HousingWire named our founder and CEO a 2024 Tech Trendsetter, we’ve received several Tech100 Awards, and our lead nurturing tool just scored an Inman Innovation Award for Best AI-Powered Platform.Luxury Presence is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.

json.title: Performance Marketing Manager  [397]
json.descriptionHtml:
About the Company:

The Local Jungle is a boutique digital marketing agency based in Denver, Colorado, specializing in helping independent auto repair shops compete with major dealerships through high-impact online marketing strategies. For over a decade, we’ve delivered results-driven solutions across PPC, Local SEO, CRO, analytics, and web design. Serving 20 long-term clients—family-owned repair businesses generating $2–5 million annually - we are now entering an ambitious growth phase, aiming to rapidly scale our team and client base while maintaining exceptional performance standards.


About the Role:

We are looking to hire a motivated, experienced Performance Marketing Manager to lead our fulfillment operations and drive measurable marketing results for our clients. The Marketing Manager will oversee end-to-end execution of digital marketing campaigns, manage a small team (Marketing Assistant, Web Developer, and Designer), and ensure that all client deliverables meet our high standards for quality, timeliness, and ROI.


This is a Full-time, remote role with opportunities to grow into a Head of Marketing position..



We are looking for a Performance Marketing Manager specifically with these requirements:

  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.
  • Strong expertise in CRO (Conversion Rate Optimization) and website project management (Wordpress).
  • Experience with Local SEO optimization and best practices.
  • Ability to track and measure Google Ads performance and ROI.
  • Hands-on experience managing analytics, tracking, and website optimization for multiple clients.
  • Strong project management and organizational skills.
  • Confident in managing and mentoring a small cross-functional team.
  • Self-directed with a high level of accountability.
  • Comfortable working during U.S. business hours (9–5 MST or equivalent overlap).
  • Data-driven decision-maker who thrives in a fast-paced environment.
  • Passionate about helping small businesses grow through effective marketing.


Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):

  • Oversee fulfillment of all marketing activities, including SEO, PPC, analytics, and CRO.
  • Manage the workflow of client projects through ClickUp to ensure on-time, high-quality delivery.
  • Supervise and mentor the Marketing Assistant and Web Developer.
  • Implement and maintain tracking and reporting systems (GTM, GA4, Looker Studio).
  • Analyze campaign data and optimize for higher ROI and client satisfaction.
  • Oversee website and landing page performance, including SEO health and conversion optimization.
  • Manage call tracking setup and reporting.
  • Collaborate with the operations team to refine internal SOPs for efficiency and scalability.
  • Ensure clear communication across all departments and with clients when necessary.
  • Maintain a deep focus on client retention through exceptional marketing results



Growth Opportunities/Perks:

  • Opportunity to grow into a Head of Marketing role.
  • Work directly with a 20-year digital marketing veteran with Fortune 500 experience.
  • Unlimited Paid Time Off (PTO).
  • High degree of autonomy and leadership ownership.
  • Be part of a small, high-performing, and collaborative remote team.
  • Gain experience working with advanced marketing systems and industry-leading tools.


This Position Is Perfect For You If…


You’re results-obsessed.

You live and breathe data. Numbers guide your every move, and you’re driven by measurable success.


You’re a systems builder.

You love improving workflows and creating processes that boost performance and efficiency.


You’re a confident decision-maker.

You take initiative, prioritize effectively, and don’t shy away from accountability.


You’re a leader and mentor.

You bring out the best in others through guidance, feedback, and support.


You’re passionate about marketing.

You’re constantly learning and excited to test new strategies that deliver real results.



Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.

Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Every role we post is fully remote, and every resource is designed to help you stand out, not just apply.

json.title: Content Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
Section 1: Position Summary

The Content Specialist will be responsible for content development, execution, and oversight of marketing campaigns and initiatives for the assigned line of business. Through consultation, creativity, and a focus on the user experience, this individual will be responsible for collaborating with marketing and business stakeholders to implement effective communications and crafting copy that drives business growth, client retention and desired outcomes. This includes developing content within Ascensus brand standards for a variety of touchpoints with a focus on writing for digital experiences such as web, email, video, and social media.

Section 2: Job Functions, Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Turn strategic initiatives and industry trends into tactical solutions
  • Understand and assess business needs in order to craft clear, concise, and effective messaging
  • Manage all aspects of complex communications, including content development, project planning, and the creation of multiple versions based on data, logic, and branding
  • Represent marketing at key meetings to provide status updates, consultation, general project support, and innovative solutions
  • Establish strong relationships with business stakeholders by delivering on project specifications and deadlines
  • Create meaningful content leveraging AI tools that is clear, actionable, and engaging—converting leads to clients and turning clients into loyal fans
  • Fluid in copywriting for a wide variety of marketing mediums across web, email, print, video scripting, presentations, articles, white papers and more.
  • Use Microsoft office suite – Word, PowerPoint and Excel—as well as project management and CMS software tools to assist in the management of workflow, content, planning, and other marketing operations
  • Participate in and adhere to quality control best practices related to proofreading, reviews, and securing approvals
  • Measure effectiveness of communications using such methods as A/B testing
  • Responsible for protecting, securing, and proper handling of all confidential data held by Ascensus to ensure against unauthorized access, improper transmission, and/or unapproved disclosure of information that could result in harm to Ascensus or our clients.
  • At Ascensus we are guided by our Core Values of People Matter, Quality First and Integrity Always®. They inspire us every day to prioritize an environment of respect for those we serve and one another and should be visible in your actions on a day-to-day.

Supervision

  • N/A

Section 3: Experience, Skills, Knowledge Requirements

  • Excellent writing, editing, and presentation skills
  • Ability to write and communicate effectively and professionally across multiple mediums, including digital, social and print, and considering SEO, SEO strategy and optimization tactics
  • Experience with AI copywriting tools
  • Excellent decision-making, communication, critical thinking, project management and follow-through skills
  • Ability to perform duties with accuracy, strong attention to detail, and meet deadlines consistently
  • Self-motivated team player who is comfortable working in a collaborative, fast-paced environment
  • Minimum of 5 years of related experience. Samples and portfolio are required
  • Four-year college degree, marketing/communications or related field
  • An understanding of a regulated industry; financial services experience a plus

For all virtual remote positions, in order to ensure associates can effectively perform their job duties with no distractions, we require an uninterrupted virtual workspace and there is also an expectation of family care being in place during business hours. Additionally, there is an internet work speed requirement of 25 Mbps or better for individual use. If more than one person is utilizing the same internet connection in the same household or building, then a stronger connection is required. If you are unsure of your internet speed, please check with your service provider. Note: For call center roles specifically, it is a requirement to either hardwire your equipment directly to the internet router or ensure your workstation is in close proximity to the router. Please ensure that you are able to meet these expectations before applying.

The national average salary range for this role is $80-100k in base pay, exclusive of any bonuses and benefits. This base salary range represents the low and high end of the salary range for this position. Actual salary offered will vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors including but not limited to location, experience, performance, and internal pay alignment. We do not anticipate that candidates hired will begin at the top of the range however, from time to time, it may occur on a case-by-case basis.  Other rewards and benefits may include: 401(k) match, Medical, Dental, Vision, Paid-Time-Off, etc.  For more information, please visit careers.ascensus.com/#Benefits.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

Be aware of employment fraud. All email communications from Ascensus or its hiring managers originate from @ascensus.com or @futureplan.com email addresses. We will never ask you for payment or require you to purchase any equipment. If you are suspicious or unsure about validity of a job posting, we strongly encourage you to apply directly through our website.

json.companyDescription:
Ascensus is a market-leading enabler of tax-advantaged savings—providing technology, services, and expertise that helps millions save for a better today and tomorrow.  

We’re also a premier savings program service provider, third-party administrator, and government savings facilitator. Our platforms, industry knowledge, and data-based insights enhance the growth and success of our partners, their clients, and savers.  

The company’s brands include Ascensus; Newport, an Ascensus company; and FuturePlan by Ascensus. For more information, visit ascensus.com. 

Read our Corporate Disclosures at https://www.ascensus.com/corporate-disclosures/.

json.title: Operations & Administrative Assistant
json.descriptionHtml:
About the Opportunity:

The organization is an organic growth agency that partners with ambitious B2B SaaS companies like SAP, Adobe, Loom, and Hotjar to turn SEO and content into growth engines.


The organization is hiring an Operations & Administrative Assistant to keep the business running smoothly across operations, sales, and client delivery. You’ll be embedded in the systems that power the work and play a key role in making sure nothing slips through the cracks.


You’ll handle core administrative tasks, help build repeatable processes, and support leadership as the business scales, while always looking for ways to make the organization more efficient with AI and automation. The role touches every part of the organization, including marketing, sales, recruiting, and client success.


This is a great opportunity for someone organized, proactive, loves tinkering with tools to find better ways of doing things, and early in their career who’s eager to grow. You’ll gain exposure to all sides of the business while developing the skills to take on bigger responsibilities over time.


If you thrive on structure, love problem-solving, and want to be part of a fast-moving agency that values autonomy and ownership, read on.


The organization requires this role to overlap at least 4 hours with US Eastern Time and ideally have working hours of 9am to 5pm ET.


Your responsibilities:

Your job as the Operations & Administrative Assistant will include, but won’t be limited to:


Project Management & Operations

• Follow up on meetings and add tasks to the project management tool


• Monitor Asana for overdue tasks or blockers and flag the appropriate team member


• Follow up on incomplete time sheets from team members


• Build monthly time tracking reports for leadership to understand team capacity and hiring needs


• Build custom GPTs to enable client teams to streamline their work and research


• Build SOPs for repeatable administrative tasks


Content & Editorial Support

• Use automations to generate content briefs with input from client teams


• Produce Clearscope reports


• Upload content into client content management systems like WordPress and Webflow


• Maintain and update client content brief templates, ensuring alignment with personas and roadmaps


Sales & Marketing

• Support podcast publishing workflow


• Make updates to the organization’s website


• Repurpose content using AI workflows and upload to social scheduling tool for approval


• Draft initial sales proposals using AI workflows and presentation templates


• Organize sales proposals and client files in Google Drive


Recruitment & People Ops

• Perform initial applicant screening (reject clear “no’s” and rate promising profiles)


• Schedule candidate interviews using Ashby


• Support hiring for specialist roles by setting up Clay sourcing and Ashby sequences


• Enable tool access and automation for freelancers (Drive, Airtable, etc.)


Who you are:

• 2+ years of experience as an Executive Assistant or Operations Assistant in a remote setup


• You proactively communicate progress and challenges to keep stakeholders informed.


• You have outstanding written and verbal communication skills.


• You’re organized, proactive, and resourceful.


• You try to solve problems independently before asking for help.


• Willingness to learn and take on evolving responsibilities as the team scales


• Familiarity with tools like Asana, Airtable, Google Drive, Slack, Notion, 1Password, Calendly, and Fireflies.ai.


• Basic understanding of marketing is a strong plus.


• You’re meticulous. Whether it be a well-placed comma, a pixel-perfect design, or clear communication, you sweat the details.


• You seek feedback. You’re eager to learn new things to grow and improve your skills.


• You believe in punctuality. Deadlines are not optional for you.


• You’re an intellectually curious critical thinker. Time flies by as you find yourself researching interesting topics or finding creative ways to solve a problem.


• You’re process-oriented. You try to be as efficient as possible, usually by creating checklists and systems. You're always looking for ways to improve a process.


• You make great decisions quickly. You have a bias toward action and learning on the fly. You don't shy away from making the best decision at the moment, knowing that you can iterate and improve as you go.


• You’re adaptable. You're flexible and agile. You realize that things change and often don't work out perfectly, so you do what needs to be done and keep moving forward.


• You’re great at working independently. You’re comfortable setting and achieving your own goals and can communicate what you’re working on. You don't need or want to be managed, and you don't depend on stress or high-pressure environments to get things done.


• You're not an asshole. There is a focus on a collaborative and respectful environment with team members and clients. There's no room for hostility. You're friendly, eager to jump in and take ownership, and love to work as a team to be successful.


Why you should work with this team:

The organization is here to help you do great work and grow personally and professionally.


• Remote flexibility: The organization is a 100 percent remote company, so you can work from anywhere.


• Rapid skill development: Working with this team means you’ll get more experience and develop your skills faster than you would at a large, slow-moving company.


• Opportunity for responsibility: There are ample opportunities to take on more responsibility and make a significant impact.


• Coaching: Coaching is provided to help you become world-class at your function.


• Team trips: The team takes trips each year to cities like Los Angeles, Boston, Austin, and Chicago to get some time together in person.


• Autonomy: You are provided with the trust and space to problem solve and make the role your own.

json.companyDescription: RemoteHunter is your dedicated AI job search assistant, turning the job hunt from a slow, individual effort into a quicker, smarter, and guided experience by streamlining each step of the process and speeding up your path to the right career opportunities.

json.title: Social Media Marketing Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
Role Type: Part-Time (15–20 hrs/week, delayed compensation — see below)

Location: Remote

Compensation Model: Retroactive pay + ownership stake (see below)


About FiNC


Think of FiNC as your civic utility company: one system that plugs everyone into a fair, citizen-led democracy. Our promise is simple: less waste, more representation. Every candidate seen. Every citizen heard. Every journalist free to speak.


We use Digital Politics (DP) as a shared lens to spot rigged patterns and judge leaders up vs down—power-first or people-first—so citizens can vote with clarity. As adoption grows, Digital Democracy (DD) will standardize fair rules, visibility, and accountability.


We organize the Meta-Movement—a movement of movements that connects citizens, underdog candidates, independent media, and grassroots orgs by Action Clusters (stances, strategies, endorsements) so lenses can differ and actions unite.


FiNC is building an organization structure akin to a cooperative-style nonprofit, where team members aren’t just employees, they’re partners and co-architects. Everyone plays an active role in shaping our mission, strategy, and growth.


If you’re ready to help create something beyond politics as usual—and to join a team designing the future of democracy itself—we invite you to step in. The future is now.


**Apply directly on our website, https://futureis.org/careers**


IMPORTANT: This involves DELAYED COMPENSATION – Please read carefully


To maintain our independence and avoid conflicts of interest, we are not accepting investors or financing that comes with strings attached. Instead, we are Crowd-Starting FiNC—building it together from the ground up.


We’re asking team members to contribute 15-20 hours per week during this phase, with all time tracked and paid retroactively once we become fully operational.


This model only works if you see it as a short-term investment for long-term rewards. Everyone who joins is a partner, receiving an ownership stake in FiNC. Our structure is similar to a Nonprofit Cooperative, moving beyond the traditional “employee vs employer” dynamic into something more collaborative and forward-thinking.


Please only apply if you’re open to this unique opportunity and ready to be part of something truly transformative.


Culture and Employment


A New Kind of Organization for a New Kind of Democracy


  • Neurodiversity and diversity-of-thought are strengths, not obstacles
  • Servant leadership, dynamic team structures, and shared ownership
  • Purpose over profits, value over hours, and respect for work-life balance
  • We reward authenticity, passion, and commitment—not conformity
  • We support individual weaknesses to enhance collective strengths
  • Continuous role assessments, long-term growth opportunities, and real career sustainability


From your first 2-way interview, you will see (and feel) how radically different we are.


Job Description


We are seeking a Social Media Marketing Specialist who deeply understands how to navigate various social media platforms and can help direct our content toward the right audiences. This role requires someone who knows how to engage with specific Facebook Groups, subreddits, Bluesky accounts, and/or other online communities where our mission will resonate.


At FiNC, we create compelling content that supports our bold mission to upgrade democracy. We need someone who can take this content and strategically share it with the right people, groups, and organizations. This includes facilitating reposts/shoutouts, earned media, and fostering relationships with key influencers and community leaders.


If you are highly social media-savvy, action-oriented, and passionate about connecting people to meaningful ideas, we want you on our team.


Objectives and Responsibilities:


  • Targeted Outreach: Promote FiNC’s mission by sharing original content in relevant social media groups, forums, and communities, such as Tiktok, YouTube, Facebook Groups, and Substack
  • Earned Media Strategy: Facilitate reposts, shoutouts, and other forms of earned media by connecting with influencers, community leaders, and organizations aligned with our goals
  • Engage and Respond: Actively respond to comments, DMs, and discussions on platforms like Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, and Bluesky to build relationships and encourage dialogue
  • Cross-Posting and Collaboration: Identify opportunities to cross-post or collaborate with other organizations, activists, and influencers to broaden awareness of FiNC’s mission
  • Community Research: Continuously identify and track new groups, platforms, and online communities where FiNC’s mission can gain traction


Skills and Qualifications:


  • Social Media Expertise: Deep understanding of how to navigate and engage with platforms like Tiktok, YouTube, Facebook, Substack, and others
  • Earned Media Knowledge: Experience with reposting, shoutouts, and fostering influencer and community collaborations (knowledge of influencer marketing is a strong plus)
  • Proven Outreach Experience: At least three years of experience in social media outreach, networking, or engagement roles
  • Exceptional Communication Skills: Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to build authentic relationships online
  • Mission Alignment: Passion for FiNC’s mission and the ability to articulate and advocate for our goals in a way that resonates with diverse audiences
  • Action-Oriented: Ability to take initiative, stay organized, and execute a targeted outreach strategy


**Apply directly on our website, https://futureis.org/careers**

json.companySlogan: FiNC: your civic utility—plug into a fair, citizen-led democracy. Every candidate seen. Every citizen heard.
json.companyDescription:
Welcome to the Future is Now Coalition (FiNC)—where we’re not just reforming politics, we’re replacing the rigged system that’s failed the people for decades.

FiNC is building a citizen-owned alternative political ecosystem—a full system shift that bypasses establishment control and puts citizens back at the center of power.

At the heart of this work are two core innovations:

🔍 Digital Politics (DP): A mindset shift that helps Americans “see the game” clearly. It reframes politics from Left vs. Right to People vs. Power, exposing how media, money, and parties control the narrative—and how citizens can break free.

🛠️ Digital Democracy (DD): The civic infrastructure to act on that clarity. A platform-in-development that ensures every candidate is seen, every citizen is heard, and every journalist is free to speak. DD will include tools like Politician Report Cards, Candidate Matchmakers, and Real-Time Consensus Tracking—all co-created with (and owned by) the public.

We’re not launching another app. We’re building the digital embodiment of democracy itself.

FiNC’s mission focuses on:
✅ True Citizen Representation – Politicians answer to people, not donors.
✅ A Level Playing Field – Third parties and underdog candidates compete without gatekeepers.
✅ Informed Citizenship – Politics made clear, accessible, and free from spin.

This isn’t just a project—it’s a Meta-Movement: a movement of movements working together across issue lines, party lines, and media silos to build something better.

If you've felt disillusioned by politics but energized by possibility, you’re not alone. FiNC isn’t here to flip the system to a new side, we’re here to give Americans the tools, clarity, and infrastructure to build a new one.

Join the shift.
🌐 futureis.org

json.title: Vice President of Marketing And Business Development
json.descriptionHtml:
Experience You Will Need:

  • Direct experience managing and growing enterprise-level key accounts at major pharma companies — specifically Amgen, Genentech, Johnson & Johnson, or similarly large organizations.
  • 10+ years in B2B sales with experience in pharmaceutical branding/marketing and media agencies.
  • Strong hunter mindset with a proven record of uncovering and closing opportunities.
  • Self-starter, motivated, resourceful, entrepreneurial, and solution-oriented.
  • Proven track record of building and leveraging strategic relationships within pharma organizations to drive sustained revenue growth.
  • Growth mindset: committed to learning, persistence, and continuous improvement.
  • Leadership skills to guide and influence cross-functional teams.
  • Consistent history of successful performance and organic revenue growth of at least $1M+ per year.
  • Ability to plan and execute effectively in a fast-paced, changing environment.
  • Strong communication, emotional intelligence, and executive presence when working with senior client stakeholders.
  • Excellent presentation and consultative selling skills aligned to pharma brand marketing plans.
  • High level of business acumen, strategic thinking, and problem-solving ability.

json.title: Conversion & Growth Lead, Motley Fool Money
json.descriptionHtml:
Who are we?

The Motley Fool is a purpose-driven financial services company on a mission to make the world smarter, happier, and richer. For 30 years we’ve been helping people make better investment decisions through transparency, education, and Foolish fun. We’re a fast-moving, collaborative team that values high-quality work, curiosity, and initiative. We care deeply about what we do, and we’re driven by the impact our work has on real people’s financial futures.

What does this team do?

We launched Motley Fool Money within The Motley Fool to cut through the noise in personal finance. We give real, useful advice on products like credit cards, mortgages, and savings accounts, helping readers make confident financial choices.

Motley Fool Money has been around for more than six years and reaches 20+ million people annually. We’re a performance-driven content site and we’re invested in connecting customers with the right personal finance products to help improve their financial outcomes. We’re looking for someone who understands how to stay focused on improving key metrics and has the creative and executional chops to bring impactful optimization solutions to life.

What would you do in this role?

The Conversion & Growth Lead is a key driver of performance improvement across our business. You’ll own the full lifecycle of conversion optimization – from identifying opportunities to executing tests to scaling what works.

This is a growth role that blends traditional CRO responsibilities (like A/B testing) with broader ownership of our site optimization strategy and roadmap. That means thinking beyond tests and tweaks: the better we convert our audience, the more we can grow that audience through smarter marketing, high-impact content, and new revenue strategies.

We’re looking for someone who sees the full picture, spots opportunities others miss, and turns strategy into action. You’ll work cross-functionally, supporting initiatives across the business. One day that might mean helping editorial prioritize based on performance gaps; the next, iterating on landing pages, or launching a new monetized experience. There’s no fixed playbook here – just the opportunity to learn fast, try new things, and make a real impact on our business and our readers’ lives. If you’re entrepreneurial, intellectually curious, and thrive in ambiguity, this could be your spot.

You should be comfortable analyzing your own data, prioritizing opportunities based on potential impact, and executing through multiple levers: testing, content updates, copywriting, UX enhancements, and site functionality improvements. You should be AI-literate – not just aware of the tools, but actively looking for ways to use them to accelerate analysis, improve creative output, and expand testing capabilities. Fluency in how digital content businesses operate, what motivates users, and which tactical changes drive performance and monetization is essential.

At the end of the day, your job is to help us meet and exceed our target KPIs. Here are some examples of how you’ll go about that:

  • Analyze data from GA, GSC, syndication platforms and other sources to identify growth opportunities and take action
  • Own and evolve our A/B testing roadmap, from idea to rollout to analysis
  • Write conversion-focused copy (CTAs, headlines, landing pages) that aligns with our editorial voice
  • Identify and scale high-impact revenue drivers across the site
  • Identify and execute on new site functionality or improvements to existing functionality that supports target KPI growth
  • Improve performance outcomes of content syndicated to external partners
  • Expand and optimize Motley Fool Money affiliate product pitches on our flagship investing site, Fool.com
  • Communicate key findings to stakeholders across the team

You’ll thrive in this role if you:

  • Are a creative problem solver who moves quickly from idea to execution
  • Can identify and fluidly shift focus to the highest-impact opportunities – whether that’s optimizing a paid campaign landing page, supporting an editorial initiative, or expanding our portfolio of monetized placements
  • Use AI tools to accelerate content production, testing, and analysis
  • Know what makes a landing page convert and how to test and improve it
  • Understand how to identify and use customer motivation to inform ideas
  • Have a strong eye for UX but don’t need a full design team to prototype or launch something new
  • Are resourceful and thrive in environments without a set playbook
  • Enjoy working cross-functionally and collaboratively

What do you need to apply?

  • 5+ years of experience driving performance growth for a digital property
  • Strong grasp of funnel optimization strategies across multiple channels including paid media, SEO, email, and editorial platforms like Google Discover
  • Proven track record of implementing A/B tests that delivered measurable results
  • Hands-on experience with CRO tools such as VWO, Convert, or Optimizely
  • Fluency in Google Analytics and/or other web analytics platforms
  • Sharp writing instincts, especially for conversion copy – headlines, CTAs, and high-traffic landing pages
  • Familiarity with AI-assisted tools for content generation, audience research, or A/B testing workflows (e.g. ChatGPT)
  • Bonus points for: Solid working knowledge of credit cards – beyond just using them. You understand how rewards programs, balance transfers, intro APRs, and issuer policies actually work (and maybe you've even helped friends pick the right card).

Annual Pay Range: $90,000 USD - $120,000 USD

By applying on this site, you acknowledge that The Motley Fool will be collecting the personal data you provide for our recruiting purposes. Please see our Applicant Privacy Notice for additional information about how we process, transfer, and store your data, including where that data is stored, and about any additional privacy rights you may have based on your jurisdiction.

json.companySlogan: Making the world smarter, happier, and richer through free and premium investing guidance.
json.companyDescription:
The Motley Fool’s name comes from William Shakespeare’s play “As You Like It”. The court jester, known as the Fool, could speak the truth to the king and queen without having his head lopped off. The Fools of yore entertained the court with humor that instructed as it amused. More importantly, the Fool was never afraid to question conventional wisdom. In the same way, we aim to speak the truth about money and investing...and to make financial guidance accessible to people of all backgrounds and experience levels.

At The Motley Fool, our purpose is to make the world smarter, happier, and richer. We help millions of people around the world achieve their financial goals every day. We believe in treating every dollar as an investment in the future you want to create. We believe that investing in great businesses, for the long term, is the most effective path to wealth. 

The Motley Fool provides free and premium investment guidance to millions of individual investors around the world on Fool.com through:
- Premium membership services that provide stock recommendations, detailed analysis of companies, model portfolios, live streaming video during market hours, and more.
- Free market news and commentary with hundreds of new articles published each week.
- Member-only tools and programming for building your ideal portfolio, tracking your performance, and monitoring companies of interest.

json.title: Content Manager - Social Media (Remote / Houston / Philippines / Metro Manila)
json.descriptionHtml:
Content Manager — The Voice of the Story

You know content isn’t just posts — it’s people.

Behind every caption, video, and graphic is a chance to spark trust, guide a decision, and remind someone that they’re not just buying a house — they’re building their future. You’re the type of person who thrives on bringing order to chaos, who can take scattered ideas and shape them into a clear plan, and who gets a spark of energy when you see engagement rise because of something you orchestrated.

In this role, you won’t just be scheduling posts — you’ll be shaping stories. You’ll guide a creative team of designers, editors, and AI video creators to produce content that reflects who we are and what we stand for. You’ll own the calendar, ensure consistency in tone and visuals, and use analytics to adapt and refine what connects with our community.

What You’ll Do

  • Build and manage the content calendar across Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, and TikTok.
  • Coordinate with agents to highlight wins, stories, and behind-the-scenes moments.
  • Review creative output from the designer, editor, AI video creator, and copywriter.
  • Track analytics weekly and adjust plans for stronger engagement.
  • Ensure every piece of content reflects HPT’s brand tone, visuals, and values.

What Success Looks Like

  • A clear and consistent content pipeline — no missed posts, no off-brand messaging.
  • Engagement and reach trending upward month after month.
  • Creative team members producing their best work under your guidance.
  • Data-driven insights shaping what we share, when, and how.
  • A social presence that builds trust and reflects HPT’s culture of care.

Requirements

About You

  • Strong, natural communicator who enjoys starting conversations.
  • Social media savvy — especially IG & LinkedIn.
  • Detail-oriented and disciplined about tracking outreach.
  • Friendly, curious, and persistent (but not pushy).
  • Experience in real estate, recruiting, sales, or community management is a plus.

More About You

  • Accountable: You own deadlines and results.
  • Caring: You create content that genuinely helps and informs our audience.
  • Coachable: You take feedback and improve quickly.
  • Knowledgeable: You know how to spot content worth sharing.
  • Transparent: You communicate openly and honestly.
  • Bonus points if you already know AI tools, but we will train you.

Benefits

Why You’ll Love This Role:

  • Stable, long-term opportunity with a top US real estate brand.
  • Work 100% remote — from the Philippines.
  • Clear process, repeatable results, and plenty of training.
  • Be part of a team culture, not a solo gig.
  • Growth opportunities to expand into more marketing or recruiting responsibilities.

Perks & culture

  • Fully remote forever + stable US payroll via PH-friendly channels.
  • Competitive salary + KPI bonus tied to video metrics & checklist completion.
  • Gear / software stipend once you pass probation—upgrade that ring light or HeyGen subscription.
  • Core values that read like real life: Accountable
  • Caring
  • Coachable
  • Transparent
  • Knowledgeable.

If you’re nodding along — you may be exactly who we’re looking for.

About The Houston Properties Team

Ranked Houston’s #1 boutique real-estate team with $2 B+ sales and 1,000 + five-star Google reviews, our purpose is simple: Empowering people to make wise decisions—at home and at work.

Our Core Values Drive Everything We Do

  • Accountable: We do what we say, and we stand behind it.
  • Caring: We treat every client and teammate like they matter — because they do.
  • Coachable: Feedback helps us grow.
  • Transparent: We value honesty, not spin.
  • Knowledgeable: We invest in learning to better serve others.

You’re the type of person who thrives on bringing order to chaos, who can take scattered ideas and shape them into a clear plan, and who gets a spark of energy when you see engagement rise because of something you orchestrated.In this role, you won’t just be scheduling posts — you’ll be shaping stories. You’ll guide a creative team of designers, editors, and AI video creators to produce content that reflects who we are and what we stand for. You’ll own the calendar, ensure consistency in tone and visuals, and use analytics to adapt and refine what connects with our community.What You’ll DoBuild and manage the content calendar across Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, and TikTok.Coordinate with agents to highlight wins, stories, and behind-the-scenes moments.Review creative output from the designer, editor, AI video creator, and copywriter.Track analytics weekly and adjust plans for stronger engagement.Ensure every piece of content reflects HPT’s brand tone, visuals, and values.What Success Looks LikeA clear and consistent content pipeline — no missed posts, no off-brand messaging.Engagement and reach trending upward month after month.Creative team members producing their best work under your guidance.Data-driven insights shaping what we share, when, and how.A social presence that builds trust and reflects HPT’s culture of care.RequirementsAbout YouStrong, natural communicator who enjoys starting conversations.Social media savvy — especially IG & LinkedIn.Detail-oriented and disciplined about tracking outreach.Friendly, curious, and persistent (but not pushy).Experience in real estate, recruiting, sales, or community management is a plus.More About You Accountable: You own deadlines and results. Caring: You create content that genuinely helps and informs our audience. Coachable: You take feedback and improve quickly. Knowledgeable: You know how to spot content worth sharing. Transparent: You communicate openly and honestly. Bonus points if you already know AI tools, but we will train you.BenefitsWhy You’ll Love This Role: Stable, long-term opportunity with a top US real estate brand.Work 100% remote — from the Philippines.Clear process, repeatable results, and plenty of training.Be part of a team culture, not a solo gig.Growth opportunities to expand into more marketing or recruiting responsibilities.Perks & culture Fully remote forever + stable US payroll via PH-friendly channels.Competitive salary + KPI bonus tied to video metrics & checklist completion.Gear / software stipend once you pass probation—upgrade that ring light or HeyGen subscription.Core values that read like real life: Accountable Caring Coachable Transparent Knowledgeable. If you’re nodding along — you may be exactly who we’re looking for.About The Houston Properties TeamRanked Houston’s #1 boutique real-estate team with $2 B+ sales and 1,000 + five-star Google reviews, our purpose is simple: Empowering people to make wise decisions—at home and at work.Our Core Values Drive Everything We DoAccountable: We do what we say, and we stand behind it.Caring: We treat every client and teammate like they matter — because they do.Coachable: Feedback helps us grow.Transparent: We value honesty, not spin.Knowledgeable: We invest in learning to better serve others.
json.companySlogan: Houston moves, handled right with local insight, smart tech & steady support from start to close.
json.companyDescription:
Buying or selling a home anywhere in Houston shouldn’t feel like guesswork. The Houston Properties Team turns market noise into clear next-steps by pairing neighborhood insight across the entire metro with proprietary tech and honest, steady guidance so every decision feels calm, informed, and truly your own.

What sets us apart

• Homes we list move 44 % faster and net 7 % more than the market average—results earned through $1 B+ in closed sales and thousands of on-the-ground transactions.
• 1,000 + five-star Google reviews confirm our commitment to communication and follow-through.
• A library of 60+ buyer guides and 2,000+ pages of Houston-specific content answers questions before they become worries.
• Hands-on support and tailored strategies replace templates, so every timeline and negotiation reflects what you need, not what’s convenient for us.

Ready to map out your next Houston move? Let’s talk.

json.title: Web Design Expert - Aesthetic Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
About The Job

Mercor connects elite creative and technical talent with leading AI research labs. Headquartered in San Francisco, our investors include Benchmark, General Catalyst, Peter Thiel, Adam D'Angelo, Larry Summers, and Jack Dorsey.

Position: Web Design and User Experience Specialist

Type: Full-time

Compensation: $90,000–$200,000/year

Location: Palo Alto, CA or Remote

Role Responsibilities

  • Use proprietary tools to label, annotate, and evaluate AI-generated web layouts, components, and visual elements.
  • Review and refine AI outputs to ensure aesthetic appeal, clarity, and functional design.
  • Collaborate with technical teams to design and improve annotation workflows related to layout, typography, color, and interaction design.
  • Provide feedback on AI-generated designs to enhance responsiveness, usability, and modern web standards.
  • Apply current design trends and best practices to guide AI development in user interface and experience design.
  • Support continuous improvement of internal tools and processes that enhance workflow efficiency.

Qualifications

Must-Have

  • Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Web Development, Computer Science, or a related field
  • 1–2 years of professional experience in web design or a related creative discipline
  • Strong portfolio demonstrating exceptional design taste, layout precision, and user experience insight
  • Deep understanding of color theory, typography, visual hierarchy, and responsive design principles
  • Familiarity with design tools such as Figma, Adobe XD, or Sketch
  • Excellent attention to detail, communication skills, and creative problem-solving ability
  • Commitment to advancing AI capabilities in design and digital aesthetics

Preferred

  • Experience in UI/UX design, front-end development, or creative roles at design or technology companies
  • Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and interaction design fundamentals

Compensation & Legal

  • Competitive pay ranging from $90,000 to $200,000 annually for U.S.-based professionals, depending on experience and location
  • International pay ranges are provided based on location and experience
  • Benefits vary by country; depending on your location, you may be eligible for medical coverage

Application Process (Takes 20–30 mins to complete)

  • Submit your resume and portfolio of design work to apply
  • Complete a 20-minute interview to demonstrate how you work with relevant tools
  • Successful candidates will move forward to the next round of interviews and meet with the team

Resources & Support

  • For details about the interview process and platform information, please check: https://talent.docs.mercor.com/welcome/welcome
  • For any help or support, reach out to: support@mercor.com

PS: Our team reviews applications daily. Please complete your AI interview and application steps to be considered for this opportunity.

,

json.title: Enterprise Account Executive
json.descriptionHtml:
(This is for a RevPilots Client)


Senior Account Executive


The focus is Digital Web Marketing Solutions Sales.


Location: Major City USA - Remote - you should be located in or near a major city in the USA.


About Our Client:

Our client is private equity-backed boutique digital solutions company looking for a motivated sales teammate ready to enter a fast-paced environment and contribute to driving significant growth. This opportunity is ideal for someone hungry for success, willing to roll up their sleeves, and excited about execution. You will contribute to driving significant growth and play a vital role in our company’s evolution. Growth potential is uncapped in this role.



Job Summary:

We are looking for a highly motivated and well-connected sales teammate with experience in digital web marketing solutions sales. This role is perfect for someone with a strong network and established relationships in the CMO offices. We offer the following solutions to both enterprise and mid-market customers:

  • Digital Web Marketing
  • Website Design and Development – execute in support of client vision for branding/positioning
  • Search Engine Optimization (SEO) – optimize client website traffic.
  • Social Media Marketing / Lead Generation – strategy and execution of leads through Digital Web Marketing
  • Search Engine Marketing / PPC – use paid advertising to increase a brand's visibility in search engine
  • Marketing Analytics – analyze and report on Digital Marketing Performance.
  • Marketing Automation – create and manage campaigns, nurture leads, and personalize customer experiences across multiple channels.


The successful candidate will leverage their connections to drive new business opportunities, develop strategic partnerships, and achieve sales targets. They will also be willing to learn about our different solutions so they can offer their customers a more holistic approach—one of our business's unique strengths and differentiators.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Sales Strategy and Execution: Develop targeted sales strategies to drive revenue growth. Utilize your established network to generate leads, identify opportunities, and build a robust sales pipeline.
  • Client Engagement: Leverage your connections and industry relationships to engage with potential clients and understand their business needs. Offer customized solutions that align with their goals, demonstrating the value and ROI of our services.
  • Solution Presentation: Create and deliver compelling presentations and proposals highlighting the benefits of our digital solutions. Effectively address client questions and objections to close deals and build long-term relationships.
  • Relationship Management: Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with clients, prospects, and industry contacts. Act as a trusted advisor, providing insights and recommendations that help clients achieve their business objectives.
  • Market Research and Networking: Conduct market research to stay abreast of industry trends and emerging opportunities. Utilize your network to gain insights, forge partnerships, and stay ahead of competitors.
  • Campaign and Project Coordination: Collaborate with internal teams, including marketing, development, and project management, to ensure the successful delivery of solutions. Manage client expectations and ensure projects are completed on time and to satisfaction.
  • Sales Reporting and Analytics: Track and report key sales metrics, including lead generation, pipeline status, and revenue forecasts. Analyze performance data to refine strategies and enhance sales effectiveness.
  • Professional Development: Continuously enhance your knowledge of digital marketing, web development, and custom applications. Stay updated on industry developments and best practices to maintain a competitive edge.


Qualifications:

  • Experience: 5+ years of experience in Digital Web Marketing solutions sales, with a proven track record of leveraging a solid network to generate and close deals.
  • Skills:
  • Established network and strong connections in mid-market or enterprise that have a need for our solutions
  • Excellent sales and negotiation skills with the ability to sell complex solutions.
  • Exceptional communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
  • Proficiency in CRM software and sales management tools.
  • Ability to understand technical concepts and communicate them effectively.
  • Experience working with the team in India
  • Experience with government RFPs for digital web marketing solutions is a plus.


Compensation:

  • Salary: $130,00-$150,000 | Bonus: $20K variable (quarterly), OTE: $230,000-$300,000+ (uncapped)
  • Remote work (Some travel required)
  • Health, Dental, Vision
