json.title: Content Creator | Chronicle Creations Inc
json.descriptionHtml:
Location: Dallas-Fortworth / Central Time Zone


Work Location: Hybrid


About Us


We are Chronicle Creations Inc., a startup building Dreambook, an adaptive learning tool designed to empower children to create their own stories. Our mission is to inspire children’s creativity by combining storytelling and art in an interactive, child-friendly platform. Our team includes professionals in software engineering, education, and finance, all committed to making Dreambook a success and supporting young creators in bringing their imaginations to life.


Job Summary


Chronicle Creations is seeking a Content Creator to lead the development of engaging video and visual content for Dreambook, our story creation app for kids. In this role, you’ll craft, edit, and publish creative content that highlights children’s literacy (e.g., reading and storytelling) while maintaining a consistent posting rhythm across platforms. You’ll organize and track the release schedule, align posts with campaign goals, and collaborate with the marketing team to refine strategy, captions, and engagement. This position focuses on hands-on creative execution—bringing ideas to life, monitoring performance, and helping keep Dreambook’s digital presence inspiring, consistent, and impactful.

Compensation


While this position is unpaid, contributors will receive company ownership through equity, reflecting both creative impact and long-term commitment to the mission and shared ownership. All Chronicle Creations Inc. team members value the investment in our growth and are eager to be part of building something meaningful from day one.


Required Qualifications


  • 3-5 years of professional content creation experience or freelance work
  • General knowledge and interest in children’s education and literacy
  • Proactive in communicating and collaborating in a team setting


Primary Responsibilities


Content Creation & Design


  • Create engaging short-form and long-form content for social media with an emphasis on short-form content.
  • Write creative captions and video descriptions aligned with Dreambook’s voice and goals.
  • Photo and graphic editing of social media related images (thumbnails, posted pictures etc.)
  • Edit and produce videos using tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Premiere Pro, CapCut, Final Cut Pro or Canva (or similar software).
  • Use AI tools to streamline workflow and enhance creative output


Secondary Responsibilities (These are areas where experience is a plus, not a must.)


Publishing & Platform Management


  • Engage with followers and other creators—responding to comments, questions, and relevant conversations.
  • Manage and schedule posts across Dreambook’s social media platforms (Meta, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, TikTok, etc.).
  • Use content management tools like Buffer or Hootsuite to organize and maintain a consistent publishing schedule.


Analytics & Strategy


  • Apply basic SEO principles to improve discoverability and reach.
  • Stay up to date with social media trends across short-form and long-form formats.
  • Monitor performance using tools such as Google Analytics (GA4), Meta Business Suite, and TikTok analytics.


To Apply:


Please submit the following:


  • Resume + Portfolio (please add a link to your portfolio or website in your resume)


Once we have reviewed your resume and portfolio, we will reach out via email to schedule an interview.


Visit our company website www.chroniclecreations.co  to acquaint yourself with our team. Learn more about Dreambook by visiting our product site https://dreambook.kids. We look forward to receiving your application.


About the mobile app Dreambook


Dreambook is a story creation app that empowers children of all reading levels whether they are still learning their letter sounds or reading independently. Children become storytellers by crafting personalized stories with custom AI-generated images and age-appropriate text. Designed to nurture imagination, literacy, and creativity, Dreambook offers customizable elements like character creation, themed settings, and reading levels. Stories can be enjoyed digitally, read aloud with a parent voice capture narration software, printed as keepsakes, or shared with loved ones, making Dreambook both an imaginative outlet and a powerful learning companion.

json.companySlogan: (e.g. “A dragon appears”)
json.companyDescription:
About Chronicle Creations Inc.

Chronicle Creations Inc. is a research-driven startup dedicated to igniting children’s creativity through technology-powered storytelling. Our flagship product, Dreambook, is an innovative iPad app designed for children aged 3-12, blending adaptive learning with interactive storytelling. Grounded in cognitive and educational research, Dreambook empowers young creators to design characters, build narratives, and bring their ideas to life—fostering both literacy and artistic expression in a way that feels intuitive, engaging, and scientifically tuned to their developmental stages.

Children are natural storytellers, and Dreambook transforms their innate creativity into a guided, enriching experience. With customizable characters, diverse settings, and dynamic storytelling tools, kids can create comics, picture books, and unique narratives, all while learning in a playful yet structured environment. 

At Chronicle Creations, we bring together experts from software, education, and child development to craft meaningful digital experiences for young creators. Every aspect of Dreambook is designed to feel both intuitive and enriching, seamlessly blending creativity with learning. By providing children with an engaging, research-informed storytelling platform, we’re helping to nurture the next generation of confident, imaginative thinkers.

json.title: Integrated Brand Marketing Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
Become the newest member of our exciting team at SROA Capital as we redefine self-storage!

At SROA, we offer a career and opportunity to grow. We strongly believe in growing our talent and promoting within. We are proud to be honored as one of the TOP WORKPLACES of South Florida by the Sun Sentinel two years in a row.


SROA Capital is a vertically integrated private equity real estate and technology platform that has evolved into a global asset manager with a successful track record of providing risk adjusted returns to its partners through its focused strategy of investing in self-storage. SROA is headquartered in West Palm Beach, FL and has invested, redeveloped, and developed self storage across the risk spectrum in major and secondary markets across the United States under the brand Storage Rentals of America and the UK under the brand Kangaroo Self Storage with approximately 900 employees globally.


The Brand Integrated Marketing Specialist will lead cross-channel campaign planning and execution connecting brand storytelling with performance marketing to drive awareness, engagement, and measurable growth. This role is responsible for translating brand & customer strategy into integrated marketing programs and campaigns that guide digital, social, paid media, content, and local activations.


Duties and Responsibilities

  • Develop marketing & creative briefs and manage integrated marketing campaigns that align with business priorities and revenue goals.
  • Partner with Digital, Creative, Operations and Revenue Management teams to ensure brand guidelines, standards, logo usage, and identity are consistency applied across all touchpoints (web, social, paid media, email, PR, and partnerships).
  • Build and maintain a marketing calendar that unifies paid, owned, and earned channels.
  • Manage agency and vendor partners to deliver creative assets and campaign execution on time and within budget.
  • Support the rollout of brand initiatives, ensuring alignment across ~700 local markets and franchise locations.
  • Collaborate with SEO, Paid Media, and CRM teams to ensure brand campaigns feed both awareness and conversion pipelines.
  • Work with Performance Insights & Operations Analytics lead to measure performance and deliver post-campaign analysis, connecting brand KPIs (awareness, engagement, sentiment) with performance metrics (traffic, leads, revenue impact).
  • Identify opportunities for cross-promotion, influencer partnerships, and content amplification.


Qualifications

  • 5–7 years of experience in integrated or brand marketing, ideally in multi-location, retail, or service-based industries.
  • Strong understanding of how to translate brand strategy into channel-specific execution.
  • Experience managing agencies, content creators, or influencer programs.
  • Proficiency in campaign measurement and reporting tools (Power BI, Google Analytics, GA4).
  • Excellent cross-functional communication and project management skills.
  • Creative thinker with a strong understanding of performance metrics and how to tie brand efforts to business outcomes.


SROA Offers:

  • Competitive pay with bonus potential
  • UKG Wallet – on-demand pay option
  • 100% paid medical coverage options for employee-only
  • Dental and vision plans for optimal care
  • Eight (8) paid holidays
  • Generous Paid Time Off (PTO), increasing with years of service
  • Paid Maternity and Parental Leave for growing families
  • 401(k) with substantial employer match and 100% immediate vesting
  • Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA), Health Savings Accounts (HSA), and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (DCFSA) for tax-advantaged savings
  • GAP Insurance for added financial protection
  • Employer-paid Life Insurance and Short-Term Disability coverage
  • Long-Term Disability (LTD) coverage for added peace of mind
  • Pet insurance – because your pets are family too
  • Storage Discounts to help you declutter and organize
  • Access to Voluntary Benefits for personalized coverage
  • Learning and development opportunities to maximize your potential and excel in your career
  • A great culture that values collaboration, innovation, and inclusivity


SROA is an Equal Opportunity employer and uses the federal government E-Verify system to verify employment eligibility.

json.companySlogan: Secure and Affordable Self-Storage Company
json.companyDescription:
Storage Rentals of America is a growing self-storage company that strives to offer the best storage experience. Since we were founded in 2013, we've grown to 29+ million rentable square feet of self-storage properties across 650 locations and 32 states. Our company is driven by a passionate and dedicated team that thrives in innovating the self-storage industry.

OUR MISSION
Our mission is to cultivate an excellent workplace where employees can thrive, firmly believing that a positive and healthy environment serves as the foundation for success in providing clean and secure self-storage at an exceptional value in the communities we serve.

Our Values
Integrity
We will do the right thing.
Respect
We maintain an environment in which the wellbeing and dignity of each customer and co-worker is valued.
Teamwork
We support each other and recognize outstanding performance.
Service
We care about our employees, customers, and our communities.
Continuous Improvement
We are problems solvers.

A Strong Team

At SROA, we believe our people are our most important asset in providing the best storage rental experience to our customers. We treat others the way we want to be treated and we create an environment that supports the feeling of inclusion and belonging. We reward outstanding performance and encourage our team to grow to reach their full potential. We know that an experienced and knowledgeable team is key to running a successful business. One that our customers can be confident doing business with. That's why we aim to attract the best candidates for every position.

json.title: Marketing Strategy Expert - Fully Remote
json.descriptionHtml:
About The Job

Mercor connects elite creative and technical talent with leading AI research labs. Headquartered in San Francisco, our investors include Benchmark, General Catalyst, Peter Thiel, Adam D'Angelo, Larry Summers, and Jack Dorsey.

Position: AI Sales and Marketing Data Specialist

Type: Full-time

Compensation: $90,000–$200,000/year

Location: In-person at Palo Alto, CA office (5 days per week) or Remote

Commitment: 40 hours/week

Role Responsibilities

  • Use proprietary tools to annotate and label data for sales and marketing projects, ensuring exceptional accuracy and contextual relevance.
  • Deliver curated datasets that reflect real-world scenarios in sales strategy, marketing execution, and customer engagement.
  • Collaborate with technical teams to improve annotation workflows and develop efficient labeling systems for complex business data.
  • Support the training and evaluation of AI models through data selection, analysis, and refinement.
  • Adapt to evolving task guidelines, maintaining precision and professional judgment in fast-changing environments.
  • Apply analytical reasoning to identify and solve complex sales and marketing challenges that enhance model performance.

Qualifications

Must-Have

  • Proven professional experience in sales, marketing, or related roles such as sales manager, marketing strategist, or sales representative in wholesale or retail.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with strong command of professional and conversational English.
  • Strong interpersonal, organizational, and analytical abilities.
  • Ability to exercise independent judgment and deliver consistent results under limited supervision.
  • Deep interest in the intersection of technology, innovation, and commercial strategy.

Preferred

  • Certifications or formal training in sales or marketing (e.g., sales management certification, marketing accreditation).
  • Experience mentoring or training others in sales or marketing best practices.
  • Familiarity with AI, data annotation, or model training processes.
  • Comfort participating in recorded sessions for data collection or evaluation purposes.

Compensation & Legal

  • Competitive pay ranging from $90,000 to $200,000 annually for U.S.-based professionals, depending on experience and location.
  • For international candidates, our recruiting team will share a localized compensation range based on your region and experience.
  • Specific benefits may vary by country; depending on your location, you may be eligible for comprehensive medical coverage.
  • U.S.-based applicants must reside outside of Wyoming and Illinois.
  • Visa sponsorship is not available.

Application Process (Takes 20–30 mins to complete)

  • Submit your resume or CV.
  • Participate in a 20-minute introductory interview to discuss your background and qualifications.
  • Successful candidates will move forward to a 15-minute follow-up call with the recruiting team.
  • Those who advance will participate in a technical discussion focused on their sales and marketing expertise.
  • Complete a take-home data annotation challenge.
  • Conclude with a meet-and-greet with the team.

Resources & Support

  • For details about the interview process and platform information, please check: https://talent.docs.mercor.com/welcome/welcome
  • For any help or support, reach out to: support@mercor.com

PS: Our team reviews applications daily. Please complete your AI interview and application steps to be considered for this opportunity.

,

json.title: Contract Content Marketing Coordinator (Remote)
json.descriptionHtml:
The physical location for the candidate selected must reside within the contiguous United States. Please note this is a contract role. Hours expected would be 2 days a week, 7.5 hours per day.

WHO WE ARE!

Susan G. Komen brings a 100% virtual working environment, and you can work anywhere within the U.S. We are a force united by a promise to end breast cancer forever. For over 40 years, we've led the way funding groundbreaking research, community health initiatives and advocacy programs in local communities across the U.S. Susan G. Komen is the ONLY organization that addresses breast cancer on multiple fronts such as research, community health, global outreach, and public policy initiatives to make the biggest impact against this disease.

Komen strives to have a culture of passionate, growth-minded professionals who thrive in a team environment and work collaboratively to inspire greatness in others! We take an ongoing approach to ensure open communication from all levels throughout the organization. It’s encouraged to give and receive feedback to ensure two-way accountability with a focus on continual improvement both personally and professionally!

What you will be doing in the role of a Content Marketing Coordinator (Contract)

The Temporary Content Marketing Coordinator will support the Brand Marketing team by assisting with analytics, reporting, SEO implementation and content/ project management across digital platforms. This role will work cross-functionally with internal stakeholders and external partners to ensure consistent brand execution and optimized content performance. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, organized and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment. Hours expected would be 2 days a week, 7.5 hours per day.

What You Will Bring To The Table

  • Analytics and Reporting
  • Pull and compile data for weekly, monthly and quarterly performance reports.
  • Track and analyze performance metrics for ShareForCures and other mission-related programs.
  • Support ad campaign tracking and contribute to insights that inform future content strategies.
  • SEO and Content Optimization
  • Coordinate with Komen’s SEO partner agency to request reports, gather recommendations and summarize key findings for internal teams.
  • Support foundational SEO best practices on the back end of web pages and YouTube videos, administrative support for update.
  • Content Management and Distribution
  • Manage YouTube channel uploads, organize videos, maintaining naming conventions and ensuring consistent branding.
  • Support the optimization of digital content across Komen.org and other owned platforms such as, embedding YouTube content and linking landing pages in YouTube descriptions.
  • Project Management and Collaboration
  • Oversee design requests from Mission in Asana, ensuring timelines are met and requests continue to move through the appropriate brand marketing team members.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Creative, Digital and Mission, to support ongoing content initiatives.
  • Draft basic ad copy and assist with campaign coordination as needed.

We Know You Will Have And Be Able To

  • Bachelor’s degree and 1–3 years of experience in digital marketing, content coordination, or a related role.
  • Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
  • Familiarity with SEO principles and analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, SEMrush, YouTube Studio).
  • Experience with Asana or similar project management software a plus.
  • Excellent communication and writing skills.
  • Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to shifting priorities.

So, what’s in it for you?

Komen Believes In The Importance Of Taking Care Of Our Employees So That In Turn They Can Be Committed To Supporting Our Critical Mission To Support Those Impacted By Breast Cancer And To Help Find Cures.  This Is What Komen Provides Away From The Computer

Competitive range of $21.54-$28.21/hour, exact compensation ranges are based on a range of factors including but not limited to the labor market, job level, internal equity, and budget. Offersgiven will takeinto consideration the candidate's skills, education, experience, geographic location, and other necessary credentials.

  • Flexible work arrangement in a fully remote working environment
  • A culture of learning and development
  • Bi-weekly pay days
  • And so much more!

Komen provides a remote and/or home-based working environment for all active employees. Komen defines remote as the ability to work from any physical location within the U.S. where an employee can perform specified work duties without disruption or distraction. Komen defines home-based roles as positions that are required to reside in a specific market. Work schedules for both remote and home based are determined by the organizational needs of each department.

Susan G. Komen is fair and equal in all its employment practices for people without regard to age, race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation. Additionally, we embrace Diverse Teams & Perspective, and we find strength in the diversity of cultural backgrounds, ideas, and experiences.

SORRY NO AGENCIES

json.industries: Philanthropic Fundraising Services, Non-profit Organizations, and Hospitals and Health Care
json.companySlogan: A force united by a promise to end breast cancer, funding groundbreaking research, community health & advocacy programs.
json.companyDescription:
In 1980, Nancy G. Brinker promised her dying sister, Susan, that she would do everything in her power to end breast cancer forever. Two years later, that promise became the Susan G. Komen® organization and the beginning of a global movement. For over 40 years, we've led the way funding groundbreaking research, community health initiatives and advocacy programs in local communities across the U.S. and in more than 30 countries. And with your help, we’ll continue pushing for progress to end breast cancer every day, until it’s a thing of the past. For information on breast cancer and breast health, please call: 1-877- GO KOMEN or visit http://komen.org/

Join us on social media:
Facebook: www.facebook.com/SusanGKomen
Twitter: www.twitter.com/SusanGKomen
Instagram: @SusanGKomen
Pinterest: www.pinterest.com/SusanGKomen
Blog: blog.komen.org

json.title: Demand Generation Specialist
json.descriptionHtml:
Demand Generation Specialist


  • Company: H2K Labs
  • Headquarters: Sarasota, FL
  • Role Location: On-premise or Remote
  • Products: RevvedUP, Revenue Room CXO, Revenue Room Salon, RevLab, Bootcamps
  • Team: Growth/Marketing
  • Reports to: CEO


Company Description

H2K Labs is a data-driven revenue growth advisory that works with media and data/information businesses and event organizers to help them improve profitability, modernize their revenue strategy, and out-sell the competition. We are launching a new business line, Revenue Room™ CXO, which is a professional network and executive education platform.


About Revenue Room™ CXO

Revenue Room™ CXO is H2K Labs’ executive-level membership and year round operating system for CEOs and revenue-critical C-suite leaders focused on fueling revenue, profitability and enterprise value creation by leveraging data and AI. You’ll sell annual memberships and related executive experiences to senior decision-makers.


About the role

H2K Labs is hiring a data-driven Marketing Manager to own full-funnel demand generation across our Revenue Room product portfolio. You’ll architect and run programs that convert awareness into qualified demand, event attendance, and paid memberships, using HubSpot Marketing Hub and Sales Hub as your command center. This is a hands-on builder role for an excellent writer and multitasker who thrives at the intersection of content, email, scoring, and sales alignment.

What you’ll do

  • Own demand generation strategy for RevvedUP, Revenue Room™ CXO, Revenue Room™ Salon, RevLab, and Bootcamps: pipeline targets, channel mix, budget, and testing plan.
  • Build and optimize multi-touch campaigns (paid, organic, social, content syndication, webinars/events) that drive MQLs, SQLs, memberships, and event registrations.
  • Run HubSpot end-to-end: lifecycle stages, lead scoring, workflows, email/drip/nurture, ABM lists, forms, landing pages, CTAs, tracking, and attribution; maintain Marketing Hub ↔ Sales Hub hygiene.
  • Create and edit high-performing content—landing pages, newsletters, promotional emails, event pages, ad copy, one-pagers—matching ICP pain points by segment and product.
  • Scale newsletters & email programs: segmentation, personalization, A/B testing, deliverability, and cadence governance.
  • Partner with Sales on SLAs, MQL/SQL definitions, sequences, and feedback loops; enable SDRs with messaging, snippets, and follow-up workflows.
  • Drive event and program conversions: launch calendars, promo plans, nurture paths, reminder sequences, and post-event upsell/cross-sell into memberships and bootcamps.
  • Instrument analytics & attribution: GA4 + HubSpot reports/dashboards for channel ROI, CAC, funnel conversion, velocity, and cohort health; present weekly insights and actions.
  • Continuously test & learn: copy, offers, creative, landing page UX, send times, subject lines, and pricing/packaging experiments.
  • Safeguard compliance (GDPR/CCPA), list governance, and deliverability best practices.


What you’ve done

  • 3-5+ years in B2B demand gen/growth marketing; recurring revenue or community/membership models a plus.
  • Expert in HubSpot Marketing Hub and Sales Hub (you’ve built scoring models, lifecycle stages, complex workflows, attribution reports, and sales handoffs).
  • Proven track record driving event attendance and paid membership conversions at scale.
  • Outstanding writing and editorial judgment; can switch from crisp conversion copy to value-led thought leadership.
  • Strong command of multi-touch attribution, lead scoring, segmentation, and lifecycle nurture design.
  • Expert in building pages, emails, newsletters and marketing assets in HubSpot and Canva
  • Analytics-fluent: GA4, UTMs, dashboards, and experimentation frameworks
  • Skilled multitasker who can manage multiple launches across product lines without dropping details.


Great to have

  • ABM experience (company/role-level targeting, intent data).
  • Webinar & virtual event platforms (e.g., Zoom Webinars).
  • SEO, GEO, and new AI fundamentals and keyword-driven editorial planning
  • Basic design chops (Figma/Canva) to move fast on assets.


Success metrics

  • Growth of our marketable database
  • Conversion of unknown to known
  • Pipeline: $X influenced/quarter; MQL→SQL ≥ Y%, SQL→Closed Won ≥ Z%.
  • Event: Registration→Attendance ≥ A%; cost per attendee ≤ target.
  • Memberships: Free→Paid conversion rate; CAC:LTV ratio.
  • Email: Open/CTR/Reply benchmarks; unsubscribe & spam rates within guardrails.
  • Funnel velocity: Days from first touch→SQL and SQL→Close.


Tools you’ll use

  • HubSpot Marketing Hub & Sales Hub (expert)
  • Lemlist
  • GA4
  • Looker Studio/HubSpot Reporting
  • Google Sheets
  • Webinar platforms (Gradual, Zoom)
  • Project management tools
  • Slack
  • Claude, ChatGPT, Jasper
  • Webflow


Work style & values

  • Builder’s mindset, bias to action, crisp communication, and strong cross-functional partnership with Sales, Product, and Community.
  • Data-first, customer-obsessed, and comfortable owning outcomes.


Compensation & Benefits

  • Competitive base + uncapped variable with accelerator tiers for over-performance.
  • 401K with matching after one year of service
  • Monthly health insurance stipend/allowance
  • Professional development budget; access to H2K Labs executive content and events.


Equal Opportunity

H2K Labs is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to an inclusive environment for all employees.

MQL→SQL ≥ Y%, SQL→Closed Won ≥ Z%.Event: Registration→Attendance ≥ A%; cost per attendee ≤ target.Memberships: Free→Paid conversion rate; CAC:LTV ratio.Email: Open/CTR/Reply benchmarks; unsubscribe & spam rates within guardrails.Funnel velocity: Days from first touch→SQL and SQL→Close.Tools you’ll useHubSpot Marketing Hub & Sales Hub (expert)LemlistGA4Looker Studio/HubSpot ReportingGoogle SheetsWebinar platforms (Gradual, Zoom)Project management toolsSlackClaude, ChatGPT, JasperWebflowWork style & valuesBuilder’s mindset, bias to action, crisp communication, and strong cross-functional partnership with Sales, Product, and Community.Data-first, customer-obsessed, and comfortable owning outcomes.Compensation & BenefitsCompetitive base + uncapped variable with accelerator tiers for over-performance.401K with matching after one year of serviceMonthly health insurance stipend/allowanceProfessional development budget; json.companySlogan: Data-Powered Revenue Acceleration for Media, Events, Data/Information and Marketplace Businesses
json.companyDescription:
H2K Labs helps companies operating in the media, data and experience economy accelerate revenue, profits, and enterprise value using data and AI. We’re operators, not theorists, helping our customers build the revenue operating system modern leadership teams need to align fast, execute faster, and outpace disruption. 

We power the Revenue Room™ ecosystem—anchored by Revenue Room™ CXO, an invite-only network for CEOs and revenue-critical C-suite leaders. Members get elite peer access, execution-grade frameworks, and executive education designed to move the P&L, not just the conversation. Not theory. Execution. 

Signature experiences include:
• RevvedUP — our flagship, invite-only summit for CEOs & CXOs. 
• RevLab — half-day, in-person executive rapid learning intensives that translate AI, data, and GTM into action-ready playbooks. 
• Curated dinners and salons that deepen trust, accelerate deals, and expand strategic networks. 

Why leaders choose H2K Labs: an exclusive, high-trust environment; operator-level insight; and a bias for results that increase valuation. If you’re building the future and can’t afford to fall behind, you belong with us. 

Interested in CXO membership, strategic partnership, or RevLab education for your team? Connect with us to start the conversation.

www.revenueroomconnect.com to access blogs, playbooks, podcasts and to join the community

www.h2klabs.com to learn more about our company

json.title: Ecommerce Brand Manager [402]
json.descriptionHtml:
About the Company:

Ultima Industries is a fast-growing premium automotive technology brand specializing in high-performance digital instrument clusters and display upgrades for enthusiast vehicles. We are a remote-first company with a product-first philosophy, committed to innovation, precision, and an elevated customer experience. Our culture values clarity, ownership, and continuous improvement, and we work with a talented network of collaborators who take pride in building something exceptional.


About the Role:

We are seeking an experienced and proactive E-Commerce Brand Manager to lead and scale our Shopify-based direct-to-consumer operations. This is a hands-on strategic role for someone who thrives in entrepreneurial environments, is deeply familiar with the mechanics of e-commerce growth, and understands what it takes to build a premium brand experience online. From optimizing conversion funnels to coordinating SEO/PPC specialists, the ideal candidate will drive revenue, improve processes, and keep our digital storefront aligned with our brand’s performance-driven identity.


This is a Full-Time remote position.


We are looking for an Ecommerce Brand Manager specifically with these requirements:

  • Excellent English written and verbal communication skills.
  • Proven experience managing and growing Shopify-based DTC e-commerce operations end-to-end.
  • Strong knowledge of Shopify site structure, product listings, content updates, and conversion optimization.
  • Hands-on experience with GA4, Search Console, Klaviyo (or similar tools) for performance tracking and optimization.
  • Deep understanding of SEO and/or PPC, either as a practitioner or with reliable freelancer contacts.
  • Experience writing and optimizing persuasive, accurate product listings, landing pages, and ad copy.
  • Skilled at developing and executing CRO initiatives including A/B testing, page speed improvements, and checkout optimization.
  • Proven ability to manage day-to-day e-commerce operations including coordinating with 3PL partners, ensuring listing accuracy, and maintaining stock status.
  • Strong project management and organizational skills; ability to document workflows and create repeatable SOPs.
  • Detail-oriented with high standards for accuracy, presentation, and brand consistency.
  • Bonus if you have freelance contacts familiar with Amazon listings, SEO, or advertising, although this is not an Amazon-focused role.


Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):

  • Oversee and grow Shopify DTC revenue using SEO, PPC, CRO, and content-driven strategies.
  • Manage all site updates, promotions, and new product launches to ensure accuracy and optimization.
  • Coordinate and manage external freelancers to support SEO, PPC, or Amazon-related initiatives when needed.
  • Continuously analyze and improve page performance and conversion funnels across the site.
  • Track, analyze, and report on key metrics including traffic, conversion rate, ROAS, and sales performance.
  • Develop and maintain SOPs for marketing campaigns, website management, and recurring tasks.
  • Work cross-functionally with 3PL fulfillment partners, creative collaborators, and analytics specialists.
  • Ensure all content and messaging on the site reflects our premium brand identity and UX standards.


Growth Opportunities/Perks:

  • Work directly with executive leadership who have a proven track record, including a prior 9-figure exit.
  • Potential to grow into a senior leadership role as revenue scales, with the opportunity to build and lead an internal or hybrid growth team.
  • Paid training and certifications available in platforms such as Shopify, Google Analytics 4 (GA4), and PPC tools.
  • 2 weeks of paid time off annually, in addition to standard holidays.
  • Health insurance stipend and equipment allowance provided.
  • Access to advanced marketing tools and continuous professional development resources.
  • Flexible work schedule.
  • Performance-based bonus opportunities as the company continues to grow.


This Position Is Perfect For You If…


You think like an owner.

You’re proactive, accountable, and execution-driven, focused on outcomes, not just activity.


You’re hands-on and data-savvy.

You’ve done the work yourself, not just managed others, and you use testing and analytics to guide every decision.


You’re process-oriented and organized.

You thrive in fast-paced environments, build repeatable systems, and keep projects on track without missing the details.


Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.


Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

json.title: Growth Marketing Manager
json.descriptionHtml:
Snapdocs is a rapidly growing company that is disrupting the residential mortgage market, bringing scalable and sophisticated software to a pillar of the US economy that still relies on fax machines and manila envelopes. Today, 20% of real estate transactions are processed through our platform. Our products rely on carefully designed workflows, AI-based automations, and empathetic user experiences to deliver best-in-class customer experiences. We are backed by investors like Sequoia, Y Combinator, and F-Prime.

We are an innovative team. As we expand our product offering to serve more customers in more ways, we need to grow our team with smart, hungry, and curious people. That's where you come in…

Snapdocs is looking for a skilled, results-oriented Growth Marketing Manager to join our dynamic team. In this role, you'll design and execute strategies that drive qualified leads, pipeline, and revenue. You'll collaborate closely with Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, and BI teams to ensure alignment, leverage data for insights, and continually optimize performance. This role reports to the Director of Growth Marketing & Operations and will work in tandem with our Campaigns Marketing Manager.

What You'll Do

  • Marketing Automation & AI – Manage lead nurturing workflows, database/CRM management, and audience segmentation. Continuously improve efficiency by designing and deploying automation in Hubspot and leveraging AI-powered tools.
  • Channel Management – Launch and optimize multi-channel marketing campaigns that drive pipeline and revenue, leveraging automation to streamline execution.
  • Performance Analytics – Build automated reporting and dashboards to track performance, measure ROI, and recommend optimizations.
    • Operational Improvements: Identify and implement process efficiencies across Marketing Sales CS to reduce manual work and accelerate campaign velocity.
  • Website & SEO Oversight – Optimize site performance to drive organic traffic and improve conversion rates.
  • Digital Marketing Excellence — Manage the strategy, execution, and optimization of paid campaigns across platforms such as LinkedIn, Google Ads, display, and native advertising.

    • Requirements

    • 5+ years experience in demand generation, lead generation, or digital marketing.
    • Expertise with marketing automation (HubSpot required). Proficient in Marketing Automation, CRM, and CMS tools.
      • Familiarity with Commerce Hub, Service Hub, and Sales Hub
    • Proven track record of implementing automation/AI and process improvements that reduce manual work and increase ROI.
    • Strong attention to detail.
    • Proficient in Google, Microsoft, and LinkedIn Advertising (with up-to-date certifications, when applicable)
    • Hands-on experience with SEO and basic website management/development.
    • Ability to manage multiple projects independently in a fast-paced environment.
    • Strong analytical and technical skills, with the ability to translate data and automation opportunities into business impact.
    • Familiarity with marketing operations, database management, and Salesforce (SFDC) campaigns.
    • Familiarity with BI tools and reporting (ie. Tableau, Power BI, SiSense etc.)
    • Knowledge of social media platforms for business use.
    • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
    • Vendor management and contract negotiation experience is a plus.
    • Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business, or related field.
    Compensation

    If you are located in the SF Bay Area, NYC, or Seattle Metro area, the base salary range for this role is $96,000 - $120,000. For all other locations, the base salary range is $84,000 - $105,000.

    At Snapdocs, we believe our differences make us stronger. We're building a team of curious, driven people from all backgrounds who are united by a shared desire to solve meaningful problems and build something that matters. We value trust, autonomy, and the kind of collaboration that brings out the best ideas—and the best in each other.

    To support our team, we offer a comprehensive & thoughtful benefits package for all full-time employees, which includes:

    • Excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage
    • 401(k) with up to 4% company match
    • 16 weeks of paid parental leave
    • Flexible Paid Vacation Time Off + 10 Sick Days for exempt roles
    • Generous Accrued Paid Vacation Time Off + 10 sick days for non-exempt roles
    • Summer & Winter Break (~1-week each) + 9 Holidays per year
    • Healthcare and Dependent Care FSA
    • HSA Employer Contribution ($75-150 for individuals, $150-$250 for families)
    • $15K Family Building Benefit (lifetime limit)
    • Life and Disability Insurance
    • $1,500 Annual Lifestyle Stipend to support your well-being

    Please note: Part-time employees are not eligible for benefits at this time

    Snapdocs is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

    California residents applying for positions at Snapdocs are subject to our candidate privacy policy. (www.snapdocs.com/california-candidate-privacy)

json.companySlogan: Make mortgage a snap.
json.companyDescription:
Mortgages help borrowers become homeowners. Yet, closing a mortgage is a complex transaction that requires multiple participants, processes, and technology. Borrowers are thrown into an intricate, stressful process instead of feeling excited and confident about this meaningful investment. And the teams responsible for delivering the loan should feel empowered to close efficiently. To improve both borrower experience and business outcomes, lenders and title companies operating at the center of the closing need the right tools—which is why we built Snapdocs.

Snapdocs is the leading digital closing solution connecting the people, processes, and technologies that power mortgage closings. Our platform automates every interaction between lenders and title companies across the mortgage closing process, from pre-closing through the sale of the loan. With our patented AI technology, hands-on customer service, and extensive settlement and notary networks, all mortgage participants enjoy accurate, smooth, and secure closings. This approach gives customers a competitive advantage by saving them time and money. Snapdocs makes mortgage a snap. For more information, please visit www.snapdocs.com.

json.companySlogan: We can change the world when we change our approach to technology.
json.companyDescription: We're a community of nonprofit professionals who recognize that technology is integral to our work and lives. We've seen firsthand in our communities that access to technology and using it effectively is a consistent barrier across all forms of inequity. Together we can dismantle existing systems of oppression and create new ways for our organizations to approach technology strategically and deploy it in racially equitable ways.

json.title: Digital Marketing Manager
json.descriptionHtml:
About The Company

Pinkbox Doughnuts isn't your old-school bakery. 70+ Insta-worthy, made-from-scratch flavors are available daily including our iconic Pinky & Pooh doughnuts! Our signature coffee menu is on point too and rotates frequently alongside the sweets to keep things fresh. With 13 shops across Vegas and St. George, Utah, locals can access premium doughnuts for delivery, catering and drive-thru with ease! It's easy to see why tourists also flock to the viral shop, especially since we've been voted "Best Doughnuts in Vegas" year after year. Coming soon to Boulder City & Salt Lake City, UT!


About The Role:

We are looking for a creative and performance-driven Digital Marketing Manager to lead the digital strategy for our portfolio of hospitality and restaurant brands. This role will oversee all online marketing efforts to build brand awareness, increase guest engagement, drive reservations, and support local store marketing initiatives. The ideal candidate can work remote or in-office and will bring strong experience managing campaigns across multi-unit and multi-market operations.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and execute digital marketing campaigns across all brands, including paid social, Google Ads, display, retargeting, email, and SMS
  • Manage and optimize brand websites, ensuring content is up to date, SEO-optimized, and mobile-friendly
  • Own the social media strategy across platforms (Instagram, Facebook, TikTok, etc.) to build brand presence and community engagement
  • Coordinate with operations, culinary, and creative teams to promote seasonal menus, promotions, events, and openings
  • Oversee email marketing strategy, including CRM segmentation, campaign planning, and performance tracking
  • Monitor online reviews (Yelp, Google, TripAdvisor) and manage reputation strategy in collaboration with location managers
  • Analyze and report on campaign performance, website traffic, and ROI using tools like Google Analytics, Meta Business Suite, and others
  • Work with influencers and content creators to support local and national campaigns
  • Stay current on hospitality and food & beverage trends, digital innovations, and competitor strategies


Qualifications:

  • 3–5+ years of digital marketing experience, preferably in hospitality, restaurant, or lifestyle brands
  • Experience supporting multi-unit and multi-market operations
  • Proficiency in Google Ads, Meta Ads Manager, Google Analytics, and email platforms (e.g., Mailchimp, Klaviyo)
  • Strong understanding of hospitality customer behavior and local marketing tactics
  • Excellent project management and organizational skills
  • Experience with design platforms (e.g., Canva, Adobe Creative Suite) is a plus
  • Ability to manage multiple brands and campaigns in a fast-paced environment
  • Ability to work remote while collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams


Physical Requirements & Work Environment

This position requires sitting and standing associated with a normal office environment. Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on the computer will occur. This description is intended to provide only basic guidelines for meeting job requirements. Must be able to handle several telephone contacts and emails daily, and frequent pre-scheduled face-to-face interactions with employees. Responsibilities, skills, and working conditions may change as needs evolve.

needs evolve.

json.companyDescription: Pinkbox can be enjoyed no matter what time of the day because it's is open and ready to serve 24 hours a day. The shop gives the options of enjoying doughnuts ‘to-go’ or in-store where you can snap a shot of your favorite doughnut for your social media page! Pinkbox Doughnuts℠ is a fun modern-day twist on your old-fashioned classic doughnut shop. We strive on being creative and always remain committed to making unique, fresh doughnuts every day.

json.title: UGC Creator
json.descriptionHtml:
About High Scale

At High Scale, we're redefining performance-driven content, creating data-driven campaigns that reach millions of people every day. Our mission is to deliver exceptional results for our clients by blending creativity with analytical precision.


Job Overview:

We are seeking a creative and passionate User-Generated Content (UGC) Creator to join our dynamic marketing and advertising team. As a UGC Creator, you will develop engaging and high-quality content for various digital platforms, helping our clients strengthen their brand presence, increase audience engagement, and drive conversions. Your work will be instrumental in shaping digital campaigns across industries, including beauty, technology, outdoor products, and entertainment.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Create engaging UGC content (videos, images, blogs, reviews) for TikTok, Instagram Reels, and YouTube Shorts
  • Manage social media: curate, schedule, and post content across platforms
  • Engage audiences, respond to comments, and build online communities
  • Optimize content for SEO and track performance metrics
  • Stay current with trends, algorithms, and digital marketing tactics


Requirements:

  • 2+ years as UGC creator, content creator, or social media manager
  • Professional-level English with excellent communication skills
  • Strong knowledge of digital marketing and social media trends
  • Proficient in video editing and content creation tools
  • Skilled in storytelling, photography, and videography
  • Organized, collaborative, and able to manage multiple projects


Preferred:

  • Agency experience
  • Influencer marketing and brand collaboration experience
  • Knowledge of paid media strategies


⚠️ IMPORTANT: TO APPLY, YOU MUST FILL OUT THIS FORM: https://forms.gle/qvDkGikSiwst5fdD8

Applications submitted without completing the form will be disregarded.

json.companySlogan: Branded creative, at-scale.
json.companyDescription:
We are the world-class leader in performance marketing. 

We front the costs. You only pay if you use the ads. No minimums or commitments. Simple. Easy. 

Our team has collectively produced over 1 million ad creatives that account for $12b+ ad spend across 1000 brands, while crushing ROAS and CAC targets with cutting-edge AI and true social-native video that consumers love.

We consistently produce over 2500 new video assets per week that are distributed primarily across Meta, TV and TikTok. 

If you spend more than $1M a month on paid media… let's talk. 

Email us:  partnerships@highscale.ai

json.title: Full Stack Software Developer – Education Platform
json.descriptionHtml:
Join a project to develop a comprehensive educational website for a coaching institute specializing in civil services exam preparation. This role involves building a modern, responsive, and SEO-optimized platform that delivers an engaging experience for students and streamlines administrative processes for the institute. The website will feature essential pages such as Home, About, Courses, Admissions, Blog, Resources, Results, and Contact, with integrated lead generation tools and dynamic content management. The backend will require a secure admin dashboard to manage courses, faculty, admissions, payments, study materials, blog posts, testimonials, galleries, and results. Online payment integration and automated email notifications are key components. The ideal candidate will leverage current web technologies to deliver a scalable, high-performing solution.

Deliverables

  • Design and develop a responsive, SEO-optimized frontend using React.js or Next.js
  • Implement key website pages: Home, About, Courses, Admissions, Blog, Resources, Results, and Contact
  • Integrate enquiry forms, WhatsApp chat, and course highlights for lead generation
  • Build a secure admin dashboard (CMS) for managing courses, faculty, admissions, payments, study materials, blog posts, testimonials, galleries, and results
  • Integrate online payment gateways (Razorpay or Paytm) and automate email notifications for admissions and enquiries
  • Ensure dynamic content management and scalability
  • Deploy the website on AWS, DigitalOcean, or Hostinger

Requirements

  • Proven experience in full stack web development, preferably for educational or content-driven platforms
  • Proficiency with React.js or Next.js for frontend development
  • Strong backend skills with Node.js/Express and MongoDB or PHP/MySQL
  • Experience integrating payment gateways and automating email notifications
  • Familiarity with cloud hosting platforms such as AWS, DigitalOcean, or Hostinger
  • Ability to implement responsive design and SEO best practices
  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
  • Excellent communication and time management abilities

About Twine

Twine is a leading freelance marketplace connecting top freelancers, consultants, and contractors with companies needing creative and tech expertise. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies and innovative startups alike, Twine enables companies to scale their teams globally.

Our Mission

Twine's mission is to empower creators and businesses to thrive in an AI-driven, freelance-first world.

The ideal candidate will leverage current web technologies to deliver a scalable, high-performing solution.Deliverables Design and develop a responsive, SEO-optimized frontend using React.js or Next.js Implement key website pages: Home, About, Courses, Admissions, Blog, Resources, Results, and Contact Integrate enquiry forms, WhatsApp chat, and course highlights for lead generation Build a secure admin dashboard (CMS) for managing courses, faculty, admissions, payments, study materials, blog posts, testimonials, galleries, and results Integrate online payment gateways (Razorpay or Paytm) and automate email notifications for admissions and enquiries Ensure dynamic content management and scalability Deploy the website on AWS, DigitalOcean, or HostingerRequirements Proven experience in full stack web development, preferably for educational or content-driven platforms Proficiency with React.js or Next.js for frontend development Strong backend skills with Node.js/Express and MongoDB or PHP/MySQL Experience integrating payment gateways and automating email notifications Familiarity with cloud hosting platforms such as AWS, DigitalOcean, or Hostinger Ability to implement responsive design and SEO best practices Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail Excellent communication and time management abilitiesAbout TwineTwine is a leading freelance marketplace connecting top freelancers, consultants, and contractors with companies needing creative and tech expertise. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies and innovative startups alike, Twine enables companies to scale their teams globally.Our MissionTwine's mission is to empower creators and businesses to thrive in an AI-driven, freelance-first world.

json.title: Sales Development Representative (SDR)
json.descriptionHtml:
Property.com is building the next generation of AI-powered home improvement and

contractor enablement platforms — connecting homeowners to market insights, property

data, and top local contractors. We’re a lean, ambitious startup with a strong technical

foundation, a clear market, and a bias toward action. Every early hire plays a critical role in

shaping the company, the product, and the customer experience.

Type:

Contract-to-Hire (1099 for 6–9 months, then W2)

Location:

Remote (U.S. preferred)

Experience:

2–4+ years preferred

About the Role

We’re looking for a Sales Development Representative to help grow Property.com’s

contractor customer base nationwide. This is a unique hybrid role blending outbound

prospecting, lead nurturing, and light closing, ideal for someone eager to grow quickly in a

fast-moving SaaS environment. Our customers are small to mid-size contractor businesses

(HVAC, plumbing, roofing, solar, etc.) who need better local SEO, property data, and lead

generation tools.

Responsibilities

• Identify, qualify, and engage outbound leads through email, phone, and social outreach.

• Nurture inbound leads and convert interest into demos or trials.

• Work closely with leadership to build the outbound motion from the ground up.

• Deliver compelling product messaging tailored to contractor businesses.

• Help onboard new customers and provide light customer support as needed.

• Maintain CRM hygiene and accurate reporting of pipeline activity.

• Meet and exceed qualified meeting and revenue targets.

Requirements

• 2–4+ years of SDR, AE, or similar sales experience (SaaS or related tech strongly

preferred).

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Proven record of hitting or exceeding targets.


• Comfortable speaking with owner-operators and decision-makers in contractor

businesses.

• Strong work ethic and ambition to grow into an Account Executive or leadership role.

• Willingness to help with onboarding and early customer success tasks in a startup

environment.

Bonus Points

• Experience selling to SMB or contractor markets (HVAC, plumbers, roofing, etc.).

• Familiarity with CRM systems and outbound tools.

• Startup or early-stage sales experience.

json.jobPosterTitle: Director of Recruiting
json.companySlogan: Your trusted AI partner for getting the most value from your home and making your real estate dreams a reality.
json.companyDescription:
Property.com is a national home services and real estate platform, offering invite-only, performance-monitored Pro Memberships for top contractors and real estate agents. Limited spots per region ensure exclusivity, with underperforming members replaced.

Built on deep property data and AI, the platform features Revana, an intelligent home advisor, assisting homeowners with maintenance, upgrades, and financing. Live home advisor support further enhances guidance.

At its core, Property.com fosters a trusted, vetted network of contractors, real estate agents, other home service professionals, investors, property managers and trade organizations, creating a collaborative, high-quality ecosystem where stakeholders deliver exceptional service and value.

json.title: Growth Marketing Manager
json.descriptionHtml:
About the Opportunity:

The organization is the most powerful customer support AI for complex businesses like fintechs, healthtechs, marketplaces and delivery services.


This team is building ground up from the premise that most support responses should be automated with transparent, customizable AI, and that support teams should spend their time managing automation and engaging with complex cases, not grinding through high volumes of simple tickets. Once teams are freed from reactive support, the program aims to help them tackle what’s next: providing personalized concierge services to their customers.


To deliver this combination of powerful AI systems and well designed tooling, the organization is leveraging Jamie’s experience as an early member of Google’s generative AI team and Steve’s experience building for operational teams at Stripe, as well as the experience of a team who have joined from places like Stripe, Canva, Atlassian, Dropbox and Dovetail.


The team is growing fast, has paying customers, real revenue, an exciting roadmap and a strong sales pipeline. Over USD 50m has been raised from leading VCs and angel investors, including QED, Blackbird, Square Peg, Claire Hughes Johnson (ex Stripe COO), Cristina Cordova (Linear COO), Bob Van Winden (Stripe Head of Support), and Cos Nicolaescu (Brex CTO).


Global customers include:

• The largest telehealth company in Australia,

• The largest bank for teens in the US,

• One of the largest NFT marketplaces by trading volume,

• The leading virtual specialty-care platform in the US,

• One of the largest flexible rent-payment platforms in the US,

• One of the largest Web3 gaming companies

… and a handful of other enterprise customers with over 1 million support tickets a year.


What’s unique about this opportunity?

• Warm, mature, flexible culture. Low ego, high trust team. No tolerance for ‘talented jerks’. The team embraces a) working efficiently, and b) working flexible hours to fit in life priorities outside of work. Commitment to building a diverse team is strong and folks from underrepresented backgrounds are especially encouraged to reach out. User obsession and eagerness to learn are valued over traditional credentials.


• High pay, high expectations, high performance. The intention is to match unicorn / scale up pay at base salary and offer a potentially life-changing equity stake in the business. The team receives the same monthly updates sent to investors because they are considered investors and owners too.


• On the technical cutting edge. With users, the organization is defining what an AI-first SaaS product looks like. No one has figured out what the UI/UX, capabilities and data models of an AI-first company are — it’s white space to invent. The AI agent problems being solved are beyond the cutting edge at the biggest research labs. The organization is building on a modern tech stack, with Typescript, React/Remix, PrismaORM, NestJS and some Python sprinkled in.


• No nonsense recruitment process. The process is: 1) informal chats with Amy and Remy to present the pitch and understand candidate interests and goals, 2) a two day paid work trial where candidates come in and ship with the team. There’s no better way for each party to figure out if working together is a fit than to actually work together.


The organization is hiring a founding Growth Marketing Lead to own demand generation from the ground up. This person will build systems to drive pipeline, primarily through paid ads, SEO, account-based marketing, website optimization, and lead generation. The role offers broad autonomy on strategy and budget allocation and allows for experimentation with campaigns, community events, out of home advertising, or other tactics if the candidate has experience and sees an opportunity. This role is perfect for someone who wants broad ownership, thrives on experimentation, moves fast from strategy to execution, and prefers building the playbook rather than following one.


What you'll do:

• Build and manage demand generation programs across paid ads (LinkedIn, Google, display, etc.), SEO, content marketing, and other channels to drive qualified pipeline


• Design and execute account-based marketing campaigns including prospect mapping, personalized outreach, warm introductions, and retargeting to engage target accounts


• Own marketing technology and automation including lead scoring, email nurture sequences, attribution tracking, and budget optimization across the stack


• Plan and execute events including digital and in-person formats like fireside chats, workshops, and community gatherings with end-to-end lead capture and follow-up


• Partner with sales and product marketing on pipeline planning, ICP refinement, messaging alignment, and smooth lead handoff processes


• Track and optimize full-funnel performance including campaign metrics, lead quality, conversion rates, and run continuous experiments to improve results


The right candidate:

You have a track record of building demand programs that have generated pipeline at startups, growth-stage companies, or scrappy teams within larger organizations. You are comfortable setting strategy and executing campaigns yourself, and you understand what is required for early-stage growth


You might be a fit if you:

• B2B growth marketing experience at enterprise SaaS or AI startups


• Proven paid marketing expertise managing budgets across LinkedIn, Google Ads, and B2B channels


• Track record driving demand in B2B in a fully sales-led motion (not PLG)


• Built marketing systems with strong instincts for enterprise messaging and channels


• Strong analytical skills for optimizing CAC and ROI


• Experience or willingness to learn account-based marketing strategies and systems


• Excited to build growth systems that combine paid acquisition with direct engagement


If you don't quite match this and are from an under-represented background, you are strongly encouraged to reach out. It is known first hand that diverse teams are higher performing and the team is proud to reflect a broad spectrum of identities and lived experiences.

json.title: Baseball On Air Sports Personality - MLB
json.descriptionHtml:
On-Air Sports Personality (MLB)


About Fan Arch:

  • Fan Arch is a leading sports media platform dedicated to providing fans with engaging, insightful, and data-driven content. Through our collaborative network of over 1,500 athletes and team of niched-down creators, we facilitate unique sports media activations across all the major sports.


Responsibilities:

  • Create compelling, original content related to your sports niche of expertise, including videos, analysis, trade rumors and predictions
  • MLB/NHL Team Based Content
  • Develop and maintain a deep understanding of teams, players, and league trends
  • Research and analyze statistics, rumors, and trends to provide informed insights
  • Produce daily content covering game previews, trade rumors, and post-game analysis
  • Collaborate with our social media team to create engaging snippets for various platforms
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest news, injuries, and roster changes that may impact your sports
  • Contribute to special projects, such as draft projections, season previews, and playoff coverage


Requirements:

  • Experience in sports content creation, preferably with a focus on a specific niche or team
  • Demonstrated knowledge of a specific sports niche and understanding of content trends
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex statistical data
  • Excellent writing and communication skills with a keen eye for detail
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Familiarity with SEO best practices and content management systems



Preferred Qualifications:

  • Authentic long-time fandom of your specific sports niche
  • Experience with video content creation and editing
  • An active presence on sports fan forums or social media platforms


What We Offer:

  • Commission-Based Salary
  • Opportunity to collaborate with our network of over 1500+ Professional Athletes
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Professional development opportunities in sports journalism and content creation

json.companyDescription: Fan Arch is a prominent sports media platform that boasts a collaborative network of over 1,500 athletes, offering a diverse range of sports-related content to fans worldwide. Leveraging its extensive athlete partnerships, Fan Arch delivers compelling athlete stories, amplifies athlete brands, and provides an unmatched sports media experience for fans.

json.title: Vice President of Software Engineering (Defense)
json.descriptionHtml:
Overview

A pioneering technology company is seeking a Vice President of Software to lead the development of mission-critical systems at the intersection of advanced software, autonomy, and real-time operations. This is a senior leadership role for someone who thrives in high-stakes environments and wants to shape the future of intelligent systems.


Why Join?

  • Work on cutting-edge technology that impacts global security and sustainability.
  • Lead a world-class team solving complex engineering challenges.
  • Competitive compensation package including base salary, equity, and comprehensive benefits.
  • Opportunity to define strategy and architecture for next-generation autonomous platforms.


The Company

My client is an innovative, fast-growing organization operating in one of the most contested domains of the 21st century. They combine hardware, software, and AI to deliver advanced capabilities for critical missions. The company values creativity, technical excellence, and collaboration, and is committed to building solutions that matter.


The Role

As VP of Software, you will:

  • Own the vision and execution of the entire software stack, from embedded systems to cloud infrastructure and AI-driven decision tools.
  • Lead and scale a multidisciplinary team, setting a culture of excellence and accountability.
  • Define architecture and product roadmaps that enable speed, resilience, and security.
  • Partner with hardware, operations, and executive teams to deliver integrated solutions at operational tempo.
  • Ensure compliance with industry standards while driving innovation under constraint.


Essential Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, or related field.
  • 15+ years of experience in software and systems engineering, with at least 5 years in senior leadership roles.
  • Proven track record delivering mission-critical software in regulated industries (aerospace, defense, automotive, etc.).
  • Technical fluency across embedded systems, cloud platforms, DevOps pipelines, and front-end/back-end frameworks.
  • Ability to obtain and maintain a security clearance.


What Will Make You Stand Out

  • Experience with flight software or autonomy systems in aerospace platforms.
  • Familiarity with AI/ML operations, sensor fusion, and ground system architectures.
  • History of scaling products from prototype to deployment across multiple platforms.
  • Executive experience managing software across diverse product baselines.


Benefits

  • Base salary range: $200,000–$370,000 (dependent on experience).
  • Significant equity participation in a high-growth company.
  • Comprehensive health, dental, and vision coverage.
  • Flexible time off and paid holidays.
  • 401(k) plan and parental leave.
  • Opportunities for professional development and leadership growth.


If you are interested in this role, please apply with your resume through this site.


SEO Keywords for Search

Vice President of Software jobs, VP Software Engineering, Head of Software Development, Software Leadership roles, Aerospace Software jobs, Defense Software Engineering, Embedded Systems VP, Cloud Software VP, AI Software Executive, Autonomy Software jobs, Mission-Critical Software roles, DevSecOps leadership, Software Architecture VP, Space Technology Software jobs, Robotics Software VP, AI/ML Software Engineering, CTO track roles, Software Director aerospace, VP Engineering defense, Software Systems leadership, Executive Software jobs.


Disclaimer

Attis Global Ltd is an equal opportunities employer. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on any of the grounds protected by law, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, sex, race, national origin, religion or belief, disability, pregnancy and maternity, marital status, political affiliation, socio-economic status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, and/or gender reassignment. M/F/D/V. We operate as a staffing agency and employment business. More information can be found at attisglobal.com.

Attis are an Executive Search & Recruitment company connecting businesses with the best Geospatial Technology & GTM talent to shape a healthier, safer and more sustainable tomorrow.

📡 EO & Remote Sensing

json.title: Senior Frontend Engineer - Remote (f/m/x)
json.descriptionHtml:
Your mission

You actively shape your position, we want you to get involved and contribute ideas.

  • You will work in a cross-functional team and combine your expertise with the of your team members to ensure rapid feature development, highest automation and of course a great product
  • You are taking care of testability, app performance and the software architecture for an application that is used by millions of active users at a time
  • You love to develop a beautiful frontend for the end-user to ensure great usability and UX
  • You ensure the stability and reliability of our services with the help of metrics and logging tools
  • You present your results to other areas of software development and take care of their operational implementation, gladly passing on your knowledge to them

Your profile

  • Have experience (5+ years) in developing with Vue.js and Nuxt.js
  • You are common with scss and ideally a css magician
  • Enjoy working together closely with DevOps, backend engineers, QA engineers and product people
  • Are keen to receive and give feedback in pairing and code review sessions
  • Have strong communication skills and a customer-driven mindset
  • Communicate fluently in English

Why us?

  • Work-Life Balance: 30 days of paid vacation.
  • Commuter Benefits: Public transportation tickets provided.
  • Professional Development: Annual education budget of €1,500.
  • Workation Opportunities: Combine work and vacation annually.
  • Wellness: Access to over 7,000 gyms and spas in Germany through Wellpass.
  • Corporate Benefits: Exclusive discounts for major brands and platforms.
  • Diversity: Join an international team with diverse cultural backgrounds.

Please note: This is a fully remote position, but requires working within a German or European time zone to ensure smooth collaboration with the team.

About Us

Welcome! Bonjour! Selam! Olá! Hej!

We are a Hamburg based mobile marketing agency, connecting advertisers with their highest value users through our owned and operated apps. We created an innovative business model that focuses on rewarding users for testing and engaging with the apps of our clients. Our products are available in DACH, US, UK & Canada.

Right now round about 80 employees from all over the world are working here with us in Hamburg. We are a divers & fun team, always looking for new talents to join us. Looking forward to meeting you!

json.title: Marketing Communications Manager
json.descriptionHtml:
About the Opportunity:

Effective communication is critical to building brand awareness, engaging prospects, and converting potential buyers into paying customers. The organization is looking for a Marketing Communications Manager to help scale content creation across a wide variety of channels, audience segments, and funnel stages.


What you’ll do:

• Manage the organization’s organic social accounts (LinkedIn / Meta / YouTube) and employee social advocacy program


• Strategically use AI tools to support the ideation, content creation, and editing process


• Brainstorm content topics across the buyer’s journey that align with relevant audience segments, campaign themes, and business objectives


• Create engaging, relevant assets that address the needs of B2B audiences, including videos, articles, thought leadership, guides, reports, and event sessions


• Write sharp, conversion-oriented copy for social posts, ads, and landing pages


• Edit contributed content to ensure writing is consistently high-impact and on-brand


• Manage end-to-end content production for assigned projects, including creative briefs, copy development, internal reviews, design development, and web production


• With direction from the SEO/GEO lead, optimize web content to improve visibility and rankings in search engines and LLMs


What you’ll bring:

• 5 to 8 years of content marketing and social media management experience with a strong preference for B2B SaaS


• Strong writing and editing skills across content formats (long-form, short-form, video, and events)


• Curiosity, as the organization is constantly exploring new topics, use cases, and customer pain points in content


• Track record of strategic collaboration on publishing calendars, multichannel campaigns, and thought leadership topic ideation


• Experience using generative AI, SEO/GEO research, analytics, and CMS tools as part of the content and social planning, production, and optimization process


• Experience working cross-functionally with product marketing, brand marketing, growth marketing, and design


• Strong project management, time management, and prioritization skills


• Previous PR or thought leadership experience is a plus


• Previous influencer and partnership marketing experience is a plus


Why work with this team:

• The organization is profitable with plenty more opportunity ahead, which is good news for your career growth.


• Competitive pay, equity and benefits are offered. The base salary for this role is $120,000 to $150,000.


• The organization is a fully remote company. Work from wherever you want in the Americas.


• Smart people and a great culture are part of the experience. See the company handbook.
