json.title: Front End Engineer (React / Next.js)
json.descriptionHtml:
Position: Senior Front-End Engineer (React / Next.js)

Salary: $120,000-$160,000/year


Overview

A growing technology team is seeking a Senior Front-End Engineer with deep experience in React and Next.js to help drive the development of scalable, high-performing web applications. The ideal candidate has 3–10 years of hands-on experience building and maintaining modern front-end systems, with a strong eye for performance, architecture, and user experience.

This role offers the opportunity to contribute throughout the full development lifecycle — from concept and design through deployment and optimization — while collaborating closely with design, product, and back-end teams. The position suits someone who writes clean, maintainable code, enjoys mentoring others, and stays current with emerging front-end technologies.


Key Responsibilities

Front-End Development

  • Build, optimize, and maintain responsive web applications using React, Next.js, and TypeScript.
  • Develop reusable UI components and ensure design and code consistency across projects.
  • Translate requirements and mockups into performant, accessible, and visually refined interfaces.
  • Integrate front-end components with RESTful and GraphQL APIs.

Architecture & Performance

  • Design modular and scalable front-end architectures aligned with long-term product goals.
  • Lead the implementation of new Next.js applications using SSR, SSG, and ISR for performance and SEO optimization.
  • Improve performance through profiling, code-splitting, and lazy loading.
  • Enhance front-end tooling and workflows using modern build tools (Webpack, Vite, Turbopack, etc.).

Collaboration & Leadership

  • Partner with UX/UI, product, and back-end teams to deliver seamless user experiences.
  • Serve as a technical authority on React and Next.js, contributing to architectural discussions and code reviews.
  • Promote best practices and modern standards within the engineering organization.

Quality & Mentorship

  • Conduct thorough code reviews and maintain code quality standards.
  • Mentor junior and mid-level developers, encouraging skill development and team growth.
  • Troubleshoot, debug, and resolve complex front-end issues across environments.

Continuous Improvement

  • Stay current with front-end frameworks, tools, and design patterns.
  • Evaluate and introduce technologies that enhance developer productivity and product performance.
  • Contribute to improving the front-end development process and documentation.


Qualifications

Required

  • 3-10 years of professional experience in front-end engineering.
  • Extensive hands-on experience with React and Next.js, including:
  • Server-side rendering (SSR) and static site generation (SSG)
  • Dynamic routing and API routes
  • Next.js 13+ App Router architecture
  • Strong proficiency in TypeScript, JavaScript (ES6+), HTML5, and CSS3/SCSS.
  • Solid understanding of state management patterns (Redux, Zustand, Context API, or Recoil).
  • Experience integrating with REST and GraphQL APIs.
  • Deep understanding of front-end build pipelines, including Webpack, Vite, or Turbopack.
  • Familiarity with performance optimization, accessibility, and SEO fundamentals.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills.
  • Proven experience integrating and managing headless CMS (such as Contentful, Hygraph, Sanity, or Strapi).
  • Experience with unit testing frameworks such as Jest, React Testing Library, or Cypress.

Preferred

  • Backend exposure: Java, node, graphql
  • Migration experience (not just from a support position): legacy, jQuery, next.js
  • AEM (Adobe Experience Manager) is notable but not critical
  • E-commerce experience is preferable
  • Exposure to Node.js, Express, or backend-for-frontend (BFF) patterns.
  • Experience with design systems (Storybook, Radix, shadcn/ui, Material UI, Chakra, etc.)
  • Experience with monorepo management (Nx, Turborepo).
  • Familiarity with React Server Components and Next.js Edge functions.
  • Understanding of modern CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Vercel, or similar).


Who You Are

A self-driven, detail-oriented engineer with strong ownership over your work.

Comfortable working independently while engaging constructively with cross-functional teams.

A proactive problem-solver who values clarity, scalability, and performance in code.


Workplace Accommodation

Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to personal characteristics or background. Reasonable accommodations are available for individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.


Equal Opportunity Statement

This employer is committed to diversity and inclusion, and welcomes applicants of all backgrounds. All qualified candidates will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected classification.

json.jobPosterTitle: Senior Technical Recruiter at Prosum
json.companyDescription:
Prosum is an award-winning Staffing Solutions provider specializing in Contract, Contract-to-Hire, and Permanent placements in the Information Technology industry. 

Our seasoned recruitment team brings a unique approach to your staffing needs. In addition to our keen understanding of local market needs, we employ a distinctively personal interview process. We take the time to get to know each candidate, including their expertise, training, goals and individual personality. 

This human approach allows us to be more flexible, more attentive and, most importantly, to do the right thing. It also means we empower our experts to go beyond cookie-cutter solutions in favor of a tailor-made staff augmentation plan.

And that means we’re more likely to find candidates who will thrive in your organization. 

We are the link that gets you from where you are now, to where you want to be and beyond.

json.title: Senior Global Campaign and Digital Marketing Manager
json.descriptionHtml:
Lookout, Inc. is a globally recognized cybersecurity leader delivering advanced protection for the most vulnerable element of any enterprise security strategy — human error and manipulation. Cloud-native by design, the Lookout platform offers rapid, scalable deployment and simplified security operations, defending the frontline of human-centric attacks—the mobile device. Attackers now target the human element more than ever, with mobile devices providing the most direct path to their victims. Using social engineering techniques that exploit basic human instincts like trust, curiosity, and urgency, they deceive users into revealing sensitive credentials, allowing them to slip past legacy security solutions.

Lookout Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) continuously monitors mobile endpoints for signs of human-centric attacks, as well as traditional malware, software vulnerabilities, and other anomalous activity. It uses advanced threat detection techniques, including artificial intelligence (AI) and behavioral analysis, to identify threats before they escalate across the enterprise. Learn more at www.lookout.com and follow us on the Lookout Blog, LinkedIn, and X.

As Lookout enters its next phase of growth, we’re scaling our global marketing engine to drive demand, pipeline, and brand leadership. We’re looking for an experienced Senior Global Campaign & Digital Marketing Manager to build and run world-class campaigns that accelerate growth and fuel sales.

The Role

In this highly visible role, you will own the strategy and execution of integrated global marketing campaigns designed to drive awareness, engagement, and pipeline. You’ll be responsible for orchestrating multi-channel programs—paid, owned, earned, and partner—to generate qualified demand for Lookout’s cybersecurity solutions.

This is an opportunity to shape Lookout’s growth strategy, working at the intersection of digital marketing, campaign orchestration, demand generation, and pipeline impact.

Key Responsibilities

Campaign Strategy & Orchestration

  • Develop and execute global, integrated marketing campaigns aligned to business priorities and target personas.
  • Partner with Product Marketing, Field, and Sales to define campaign strategy, target segments, messaging, and offers.
  • Build campaign blueprints that span top-, mid-, and bottom-of-funnel tactics to drive engagement and conversion.



Digital Marketing Leadership

  • Own digital demand strategy across paid media, email, web, social, SEO/SEM/GEO, and ABM channels.
  • Manage performance marketing campaigns with a focus on pipeline generation and ROI.
  • Continuously optimize channels and content through data-driven insights and testing.



Pipeline Impact & Measurement

  • Establish clear KPIs for pipeline contribution, lead quality, conversion rates, and ROI.
  • Partner with Marketing Operations to build dashboards and track performance across the funnel.
  • Identify optimization opportunities across the buyer journey to accelerate velocity and improve efficiency.



Cross-Functional Collaboration

  • Collaborate closely with Product Marketing, Field Marketing, Partner/Channel Marketing, and Comms to ensure consistent and impactful execution.
  • Coordinate campaign rollout across regions to ensure global scale with local relevance.
  • Partner with SDR/BDR and Sales teams to align lead follow-up and conversion plays.



About You

  • 8+ years of experience in B2B demand generation, digital marketing, or integrated campaign management.
  • Proven track record driving pipeline growth for cybersecurity or SaaS companies.
  • Deep understanding of digital channels, performance marketing, and modern campaign orchestration.
  • Strong analytical skills and experience with marketing automation, CRM, and reporting tools (e.g., Marketo, Salesforce, 6sense, Google Analytics, etc.).
  • Excellent cross-functional communication and project management skills.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-moving, high-growth environment.



The US base salary range for this full-time position is available below. We offer base + bonus + equity + benefits. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process. Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits.

Remote - US

$130,000 - $178,000 USD

json.title: Sales Development Representative
json.descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Sales Development Representative

Job Type: Full-Time

Reports To: SDR Manager

Location: Selected US Locations, Remote, M-F

Restriction: This opportunity is for candidates residing in the selected US locations listed below

Compensation: $26.45 Hourly w/ Variable Pay (up to $75,000 OTE) + Benefits


The Digital Marketing Recruiters

Digital Marketing Recruiters has been in the digital marketing and recruitment space for over 25 years. We work with highly skilled marketing, digital marketing, and sales professionals and match them with our clients from diverse industries across the United States. Our selection process incorporates comprehensive resume screening, shortlisting, conducting video-recorded interviews and providing client information, administering written assessments (if required by the client), arranging client interviews, and facilitating job offers and placements.


The Client

Intero Digital is a tech-forward digital marketing agency that has a comprehensive roster of services starting with SEO and Paid Media, Content and PR, Amazon, Omni, and Creative Services. We are a remote-first company with offices in San Diego, CA, Colorado Springs, CO, Columbus, OH, Farmington, UT, and Columbia, MO.


The Role

Intero Digital is seeking a confident and outgoing Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our team. Sales Development Representatives are responsible for setting up sales calls, supporting the sales team, and providing exceptional service to prospects with a friendly, confident, and well-informed approach.


The candidate may be based in any of the following US states:

AL, AZ, CA, CO, FL, GA, IL, IN, KS, KY, MI, MN, MO, NC, NJ, NV, NY, OH, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, and WI.


Responsibilities

  • Initiate outbound phone calls and emails to engage prospects with the goal of setting a specific number of calls per week with sales team members.
  • Navigate SEO + Marketing tools to provide data to our prospects.
  • Demonstrate excellent soft skills to guide conversations with prospects effectively.
  • Adhere to established turnaround times, productivity, and quality standards.
  • Continued learning about the digital marketing space to educate our potential prospects.


Employees Who Thrive In This Role Are

  • Comfortable in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment.
  • Communicate effectively in new situations.
  • Motivated by their individual results.
  • Are assertive and speak up.
  • Embrace feedback one-on-one and in a group setting.
  • Autonomous and able to plan their own day.
  • Proficient in navigating multiple computer applications simultaneously, including Dialer (AirCall), CRM (HubSpot), and Excel.
  • Thrive in a high-call-volume remote environment without micromanaging.
  • Have experienced the ups and downs of cold-calling and emailing.


Benefits

We provide an environment where our employees can grow and advance. We have a fun and engaging work environment where we work hard and continue to strive for excellence. This position includes the following benefits:

  • 100% Remote Work
  • 12-Week Parental Leave Program (if regular full-time)
  • 1-Week Winter Break
  • 13 Paid Holidays
  • Employer Covered Benefits
  • 96.5% Medical Insurance
  • 100% Long-Term Disability Insurance
  • 100% $50,000 Life Insurance Policy
  • Additional Elective Benefits Available
  • Pet Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Short-Term Disability Insurance
  • Hospital Indemnity Insurance
  • Legal Insurance
  • 401(k) Matching
  • After 1 Year of Employment

json.jobPosterTitle: Connecting Elite Digital Marketing Talent with Industry-Leading Teams
json.companySlogan: Connecting Elite Digital Marketing Talent with Industry-Leading Teams
json.companyDescription:
Matching talented digital marketing professionals with growth-focused businesses​!

The vast world of digital marketing is constantly evolving and dedicated efforts are necessary to stay up to date on all of the latest trends and required skill sets. As a company competing in the online space, digital marketing is an essential part of your marketing strategy and the right professional can make a significant impact on your success. Without the right people you can be easily surpassed by your competitors, and many companies lack sufficient internal resources to find employees who know how to create and present a strong digital presence.

Searching through digital marketing recruiting agencies you’ll find that only the best offer a truly tailored service, and our team has over 30 years of digital marketing experience to make that service a reality. We believe not only in filling online marketing jobs, but helping companies find the best people who themselves can build successful digital marketing careers. Both the candidate and the company have to resonate with each other in terms of culture, values, and goals, and we focus on bringing them together in a way that benefits everyone.

json.title: Freelance Content Creator
json.descriptionHtml:
ROLE DESCRIPTION:


We're seeking compelling content to amplify our marketing efforts and drive engagement across channels. Our team specializes in SEO, PPC, web development and design, email marketing, and social media marketing. This is a remote, freelance, project-based, contractor position.

Roles that you've had in the past that are similar: Videographer, UGC Creator, Content Creator.

This role will include shooting your own video and photography content designed for digital marketing including placements on websites, paid ads, organic TikTok, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, Pinterest, etc.


You will be responsible for creating new video and photo assets for our team and submitting them based on the assignment deadlines. How that works: From time to time, our project managers will email you with creative brief requests that include the project’s details. You review each project offer and accept or reject to take it on. Be in communication with our team as you create and submit your content. Get it approved. Get paid.


Many of our brands are looking to get their products into the hands of content creators to assist in the creation of authentic, high quality user generated content. This includes a range of content types from unboxing, review, try-on, to lifestyle videos and more. Other projects may sometimes entail a more customized creative brief request.


We're primarily looking for creators experienced across industries like fashion, beauty, wellness, consumer products, technology, food and beverage, and experiences and vice industries for those comfortable doing so. We are open to talented applicants from all backgrounds who can create engaging content.


This is not an ‘influencer’ role, so you will not be asked to post the content to your own social media profiles (though you are welcome to!). The content you produce will be used by the client to post on their social media, on their website, etc. However, if you're an influencer with strong engagement, we'd be open to considering your application for other types of campaigns.


Whether you're a seasoned freelancer or looking to leverage your professional content creation skills for extra income (and maybe some cool free products), this is a great opportunity to collaborate with exciting brands while producing high-quality photos and videos.


Our company has a strong remote culture and has been supporting global team members for over a decade. Some of our clients are based outside the U.S., so we welcome your application no matter where you're located!


(QUALIFICATIONS) YOU SHOULD HAVE:

  • Minimum 1+ year of photography, videography, and/or video production experience.
  • A relevant online portfolio or PDF of your current work, showcasing strong skills in brand storytelling
  • Video editing capabilities with social media apps, video editing apps or video editing software such as Adobe Premiere, CapCut or Final Cut.
  • Comfortable being in front of the camera as on-screen talent and able to memorize scripts when needed.
  • A strong understanding of digital and social media best practices and trends.
  • A strong understanding of image and video display standards on all social platforms, various audience types as well as knowledge of what kind of content has the propensity to go ‘viral’.
  • Your own equipment (camera, lighting, microphones) and knowledge of how to use it.
  • Excellent written and spoken English
  • The ability to take direction well and perform assigned tasks in a timely and productive manner.
  • Openness to constructive criticism and collaboration from team members.
  • The ability to stay highly organized with great attention to detail and be deadline-oriented.


BONUS POINTS:

  • A relevant online portfolio or PDF of your current work, showcasing strong conceptual, design, and typography skills.
  • A passion for social media, photography, and videography.
  • The ability to identify emerging trends on TikTok and Instagram (audio, video, etc.) that can benefit our clients.
  • The ability to keep audiences entertained, engaged, and informed as the on-screen talent and video producer.


YOUR DUTIES AND TASKS:

  • Must be able to successfully prioritize multiple projects with strict deadlines.
  • Create a wide range of content/assets that support digital and social campaigns (e.g., : photography, videos, reels, social media posts, and more).
  • Execute the video production process from beginning to end for both repurposed and original content: research, concepts, scripting, filming, and editing/post-production.
  • Stay up-to-date with current and emerging technologies and trends in social media, design tools, and applications.
  • Implement feedback and edits received from internal and external (client) teams.
  • Actively track, prioritize, organize, plan, and complete content assignments.
  • Research assets, photography, music and other assets as needed.


COMPENSATION:

  • Payment varies based on the nature of each content creation gig offered to you, with most ranging between $50 to $500 for more complex multi-deliverable projects.
  • Pay dates are every Friday, for assignments completed and approved by the team, through Wednesday of the same week.

json.companySlogan: #1 ranked SEO company with exceptional outcomes in digital marketing, PPC, email marketing, social media, and web design
json.companyDescription:
Coalition Technologies is one of the leading SEO & web design agencies in the United States. Our purpose is to provide exceptional online marketing services to a wide variety of clients and industries and we do that by using data to inform the strategies employed by some of the best and brightest people in our industries.
	
Our purpose and values would be meaningless if we didn’t have the people to carry them out. We are a team of expert developers, inspired creatives, passionate digital strategists, and talented marketers. Coalition’s team is 250+ people strong in Los Angeles, India, the Philippines, Europe, and Seattle.

Coalition has a 97% client retention rate and a 99% client satisfaction rate. Our customers earn a combined $80,000,000 in revenue each month through online sales. They also receive nearly 22,000,000 visits each month through their websites.

Founded in 2009 by one of the country’s leading SEO minds, we have powered our success by working harder and working smarter than our competitors. Whether you need a good Los Angeles web design company, a skilled SEO team or a top notch branding agency, don't settle for an inferior Los Angeles web design company, Coalition Technologies is your solution.

Let us show you how we can benefit your business in tremendous ways. Call us at 310-827-3890 or email sales@coalitiontechnologies.com.

json.title: Content Editor
json.descriptionHtml:
Job Overview:

We seek an experienced, detail-oriented Content Editor to join our content team at iQuanti. The Content Editor will be responsible for reviewing and editing content across various client projects, ensuring the highest quality standards, accuracy, and alignment with client specifications.


This role will require expertise in the BFSI (Banking, Financial Services, and Insurance) sector, with the ability to review and refine content in multiple formats.


As a key part of our content team, the Content Editor will work closely with writers to provide clear, actionable feedback and ensure that all content meets or exceeds iQuanti’s editorial standards while aligning with client expectations and brand guidelines.


The ideal candidate will have a sharp eye for detail, strong editorial skills, and a deep understanding of communicating complex financial topics clearly and engagingly.


Key Responsibilities:

1. Content Review & Editing

• Review and edit a wide variety of content types, including blog posts, rich media assets, video scripts, and website copy.

• Ensure content is grammatically correct, free from spelling or typographical errors, and adheres to iQuanti’s editorial standards.

• Line edit to focus on structure, flow, clarity, and conciseness while maintaining the content’s original intent.


2. Fact-Checking & Accuracy

• Fact-check all content to ensure accuracy, including verifying statistics, data, quotes, and other factual claims.

• Ensure sources are credible, up-to-date, and meet the client’s approval criteria.

• Collaborate with writers to resolve any discrepancies or inaccuracies in content.


3. Client Alignment & Brand Consistency

• Ensure all content aligns with client expectations, style guides, and feedback.

• Maintain strong communication with clients (via account managers or directly) to clarify expectations and incorporate feedback into content revisions.

• Adapt content to suit different clients' specific industry requirements, particularly in the BFSI sector.


4. Content Feedback & Writer Development

• Provide writers with constructive, clear, and actionable feedback to help them improve their skills and ensure content quality.

• Collaborate with the content team to address recurring writing issues or content trends that need improvement.

• Assist in onboarding and mentoring junior writers, offering insights into industry best practices and writing techniques.


5. Quality Assurance

• Ensure that all content that is produced meets iQuanti’s high editorial and quality standards.

• Review content for consistency and ensure it aligns with SEO best practices where applicable.

• Perform additional quality checks as needed, ensuring final deliverables are polished and ready for client review or publication.


Preferred Qualifications:

• 3-5 years experience editing content in the BFSI (Banking, Financial Services, and Insurance) sector.

• Strong background in editorial roles, with a proven ability to work across various content formats.

• Exceptional attention to detail, with the ability to catch grammar, spelling, and factual errors.

• Strong knowledge of SEO best practices and how they apply to content creation and editing.

• Ability to adapt to different client voices, preferences, and brand guidelines.

• Excellent communication skills, with experience providing clear and constructive feedback to writers.

• Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and project management tools is a plus.

• Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Communications, or related field (or equivalent experience).


Salary - $60K - $70K
json.descriptionText: Job Overview: We seek an experienced, detail-oriented Content Editor to join our content team at iQuanti. The Content Editor will be responsible for reviewing and editing content across various client projects, ensuring the highest quality standards, accuracy, and alignment with client specifications.This role will require expertise in the BFSI (Banking, Financial Services, and Insurance) sector, with the ability to review and refine content in multiple formats.As a key part of our content team, the Content Editor will work closely with writers to provide clear, actionable feedback and ensure that all content meets or exceeds iQuanti’s editorial standards while aligning with client expectations and brand guidelines.The ideal candidate will have a sharp eye for detail, strong editorial skills, and a deep understanding of communicating complex financial topics clearly and engagingly.Key Responsibilities:1. Content Review & Editing• Review and edit a wide variety of content types, including blog posts, rich media assets, video scripts, and website copy.• Ensure content is grammatically correct, free from spelling or typographical errors, and adheres to iQuanti’s editorial standards.• Line edit to focus on structure, flow, clarity, and conciseness while maintaining the content’s original intent.2. Fact-Checking & Accuracy• Fact-check all content to ensure accuracy, including verifying statistics, data, quotes, and other factual claims.• Ensure sources are credible, up-to-date, and meet the client’s approval criteria.• Collaborate with writers to resolve any discrepancies or inaccuracies in content.3. Client Alignment & Brand Consistency• Ensure all content aligns with client expectations, style guides, and feedback.• Maintain strong communication with clients (via account managers or directly) to clarify expectations and incorporate feedback into content revisions.• Adapt content to suit different clients' specific industry requirements, particularly in the BFSI sector.4. Content Feedback & Writer Development• Provide writers with constructive, clear, and actionable feedback to help them improve their skills and ensure content quality.• Collaborate with the content team to address recurring writing issues or content trends that need improvement.• Assist in onboarding and mentoring junior writers, offering insights into industry best practices and writing techniques.5. Quality Assurance• Ensure that all content that is produced meets iQuanti’s high editorial and quality standards.• Review content for consistency and ensure it aligns with SEO best practices where applicable.• Perform additional quality checks as needed, ensuring final deliverables are polished and ready for client review or publication.Preferred Qualifications:• 3-5 years experience editing content in the BFSI (Banking, Financial Services, and Insurance) sector.• Strong background in editorial roles, with a proven ability to work across various content formats.• Exceptional attention to detail, with the ability to catch grammar, spelling, and factual errors.• Strong knowledge of SEO best practices and how they apply to content creation and editing.• Ability to adapt to different client voices, preferences, and brand guidelines.• Excellent communication skills, with experience providing clear and constructive feedback to writers.• Familiarity with content management systems (CMS) and project management tools is a plus.• Bachelor’s degree in English, Journalism, Communications, or related field (or equivalent experience).Salary - $60K - $70K

json.companySlogan: Superior Digital Performance Driven By Advanced Analytics & Modeling.
json.companyDescription:
iQuanti was founded to deliver on the promise of high-performance digital marketing, combining deep analytics, proprietary technology, and a results-driven approach. Today, we partner with some of the world’s largest Fortune 500 brands, including American Express, Avis, Allstate, and Wyndham, helping them achieve measurable growth through data-driven marketing.

Honored as a 10-time Inc. 5000 company (2013–2024), iQuanti has consistently been recognized among the fastest-growing companies in the U.S. Our enterprise SEO platform, ALPS, was also "Highly Commended" at the Drum Search Awards USA 2018, showcasing our commitment to marketing innovation.

With several hundred professionals worldwide—90% of whom have data or engineering backgrounds—we operate from offices in New York, London, Toronto, Mexico City, and Bangalore.

Our expertise spans Digital Marketing Strategy, Enterprise SEO, Paid Search, Display, Conversion Optimization, Digital Analytics, Website Design, and Development—helping brands maximise performance and accelerate growth.

json.title: Digital Marketing Specialist (Paid Media / HubSpot Focus)
json.descriptionHtml:
About Ironpaper:

Ironpaper is a B2B growth agency that works with remarkable clients to achieve their growth goals through inbound marketing. Our growing team is very collaborative and passionate about the work we do. We provide an inclusive and supportive environment that enables our employees to grow and be challenged to do their best work.


We embrace diversity in all forms, value the talents, perspectives, and contributions of people from all backgrounds, and encourage people from diverse backgrounds to apply. You can read more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://www.ironpaper.com/dei-at-ironpaper


We strongly encourage you to apply even if they don’t meet 100% of the criteria for the position. We’ll do our best to match you to a role that best meets your skills, experience, and interests.


About the job:

Ironpaper seeks an experienced digital marketer to develop and execute inbound marketing strategies, leveraging data and automation to optimize client performance. The ideal candidate is a conceptual thinker, embraces technology and AI, and can drive results while thinking critically and strategically.


Qualifications include:

  • Proven experience (3+ years) in planning and executing inbound and digital marketing campaigns. Agency or similar experience preferred.
  • Advanced skills in at least one platform: Google Ads/PPC or LinkedIn paid campaigns. If experience is limited to one, a commitment to learning the other within the first 2 months is required.
  • Experience with HubSpot is required. Creation of automation, reports, and dashboards is a plus.
  • Ability to conduct SEO audits and apply best practices to improve website performance, ensuring alignment with broader marketing strategies.
  • Proficiency with AI tools to assist with campaign analysis, optimization, and deriving data-driven insights to improve performance.
  • Conceptual thinker who can connect marketing efforts to broader business objectives and ensure campaigns support long-term growth.
  • Articulate communication skills to clearly explain marketing strategies and campaign results to internal teams and clients.
  • Strategic mindset to develop marketing campaigns that not only drive immediate results but align with the client’s long-term business goals.
  • Critical thinking to analyze data and identify trends that guide marketing decisions.
  • Proactive and self-motivated, consistently looking for ways to optimize and improve marketing effectiveness.
  • Must be able to work full-time remotely within the US (excluding California) from 9 am to 6 pm EST.
  • Strong desire to learn advanced analytics and leverage AI tools and platforms like Google Analytics, HubSpot, etc.
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with a collaborative approach.
  • Inherently kind and open to feedback, working effectively in a remote team.


Your Day-to-Day:

Campaign + SEO Reporting:

  • Consistently gather and report on the performance of marketing campaigns and SEO initiatives to inform campaign strategy. Build reports. Refine and monitor account performance around messaging themes, landing pages (LPs), ad copy, blog posts, and content offers. Use AI tools to enhance reporting accuracy and derive actionable insights.

Campaign Building + Technical Expertise:

  • Build compelling, effective campaigns in HubSpot, Pardot, LinkedIn, etc. with the Ironpaper methodology and account strategy in mind. Ensure they align with Ironpaper’s methodology and account strategy. Leverage marketing automation and AI tools to optimize campaign workflows and performance.

Campaign Optimization:

  • Track and optimize the performance of individual campaigns and conversion points. Collaborate with the Growth Specialist for larger shifts/iterations. Monitor performance across channels, particularly low-performing metrics, and identify what needs to be optimized. Derive insights from campaign data. Use real-time data to continuously optimize messaging and strategy.

Effective Campaigns:

  • Campaigns that are error-free, regularly optimized, and contribute to account goals and growth. Ensure that all campaigns are thoroughly checked and optimized for maximum performance. Collaborate across teams to support consistent optimization. Error-free execution is a key priority.

Campaign Insights + Communication:

  • Understand the performance of campaigns and digital marketing efforts as a whole. Derive insights and share with client and internal teams. Communicate campaign strategies and results clearly to clients, ensuring alignment with their business goals.

QA + Optimization Context:

  • DMs should be providing feedback to content, design, and development depending on campaign performance or as part of their QA process before campaigns go live. Leverage AI and analytics tools to assess campaign performance. Provide feedback to content, design, and development teams based on performance data, particularly during the QA process before campaigns go live.

CRM & Automation Management:

  • Implement and manage client CRM accounts in platforms such as HubSpot, ensuring automation is used to improve marketing workflows and lead nurturing. Integrate CRM tools with other systems and manage workflows to ensure seamless performance tracking and reporting. Use data properties to better understand marketing outcomes.


Benefits you’ll enjoy:

  • Compensation is based on your skills, knowledge, and abilities. The range for this role is 60-78K. Additional compensation opportunities are available for senior and leadership roles.
  • Work-life balance
  • Friendly, collaborative, and supportive culture
  • Focus on learning and professional development
  • Comprehensive PTO benefit with a company-wide winter holiday week break
  • Permanently remote work
  • Medical plan options with generous employer contributions
  • Free dental and vision insurance for you
  • 401k plan with employer matching to 4%
  • Flexible Fridays


__________________________________________________________________________________

BEWARE OF HIRING SCAMS: Ironpaper will never ask for personal information such as your Social Security Number, date of birth, or banking details during the hiring process. If you are hired, you will provide information securely through our official employee onboarding portal.


To ensure you are communicating with Ironpaper, always apply through our official careers page and verify emails are from our @ironpaper.com domain. We communicate via email and LinkedIn. We do not use Discord, WhatsApp, or texting.

json.companySlogan: Ironpaper is a B2B growth agency that helps companies achieve core business objectives.
json.companyDescription:
Ironpaper is a growth agency based in New York City.  Our mission is to help our clients achieve growth through marketing and sales. We seek to unify the marketing and sales journey to deliver a more remarkable buyer experience and, ultimately, drive growth for our clients.

Since 2002, we have driven growth for our clients in the areas of digital marketing, web strategy, lead generation, sales nurturing, content marketing, advertising, and marketing/sales automation.

As an agency that integrates technology, design, marketing, content and digital strategy, we embrace hard problems and creative challenges in order to drive results. Ironpaper's process is data-driven and highly iterative. We cut through the clutter that burdens many organizations.

Our team is made up of individuals who like to create, build, learn, and think. We are committed to solving growth challenges related to the buyer's journey. Our work is an intersection of creative strategy and data-driven decision making. 

Accolades include:
- HubSpot Diamond Partner
- Digital Agency Network "Best Agency in the US,"​ 2017
- CIO Review's “20 Most Promising Digital Marketing Solution Providers 2017,” and featured cover story
- Official member, Forbes Agency Council

Contact Ironpaper for your proposal or to learn more: Visit us at http://www.ironpaper.com/contact or call us at 212-993-7809.

json.title: Growth Marketing Manager (B2B SaaS / Inbound Demand Generation)
json.descriptionHtml:
About Ai-RGUS

Ai-RGUS is AI software for security systems that identifies vulnerabilities and automates problem resolution. Originally developed for Duke University, Ai-RGUS provides a single pane of glass for reporting on the performance of every connected device: cameras, access control, power supplies, and other security hardware across leading manufacturers. Using AI, Ai-RGUS identifies operational and cybersecurity vulnerabilities including camera view and recording problems, then delivers actionable alerts streamlining maintenance. Ai-RGUS powers a proactive security strategy that maintains system integrity and compliance. It is a trusted solution across the industry and is SOC2-type II compliant and aligned with HIPAA privacy guidelines.


The role

We’re looking for a self-directed Growth Marketing Manager to build and scale our inbound engine. You’ll own social media visibility, content performance, and inbound lead flow across channels (LinkedIn, Twitter/X, Facebook, website, and email). You’ll work to convert engagement into qualified inquiries.


Responsibilities

Develop and execute a content plan that positions Ai-RGUS as a thought leader in security technology and AI.

Increase engagement and followers on company and executive LinkedIn profiles.

Create, repurpose, and schedule posts, videos, and case studies that resonate with integrators, end users, and industry media.

Optimize landing pages, CTAs, and nurturing emails for conversion.

Track, analyze, and report performance metrics with clear ROI linkage.

Coordinate occasional freelancers for design or copy support.


Requirements

3+ years experience in B2B marketing, ideally SaaS or security technology.

Strong writing portfolio and comfort working directly with technical founders.

Proven ability to grow organic reach and inbound leads without large paid budgets.

Analytical mindset: you measure everything and act on data.

Resourceful, scrappy, and comfortable in a startup.


Key qualifications

Must-have

3–6 years in B2B SaaS or technology marketing with proven inbound pipeline contribution.

Demonstrable success growing LinkedIn presence (company + execs) using content and engagement, not just ads.

Competence in content creation (short-form posts, videos, infographics) and coordination with designers or freelancers.

Experience setting up lead capture funnels (landing pages, CTAs, email nurturing).

Strong grasp of analytics: Google Analytics, LinkedIn Analytics, HubSpot (or equivalent CRM/automation).

Ability to write for technical and non-technical buyers in clear, concise English.

Basic video editing or graphic tools (e.g., Canva).


Nice-to-have

Familiarity with physical security, surveillance, or AI/ML products.

Ability to handle lightweight SEO and keyword research.


Why Ai-RGUS

Real impact: your work directly drives revenue.

Opportunity to define our brand voice in a growing market.



When applying, also send a message with 2–3 content samples and a short note on one inbound campaign you’ve built that worked.

json.jobPosterTitle: Ai software to manage the security system efficiently, Inspect. Detect. Solve. Image quality problems, days of recording, access control, network…
json.companySlogan: AI to manage security systems proactively
json.companyDescription: Ai-RGUS is AI software for security systems that identifies vulnerabilities and automates problem resolution. Originally developed for Duke University, Ai-RGUS provides a single pane of glass for visualizing and reporting on the performance of every connected device: cameras, access control, speakers, power supplies, and other security hardware across leading manufacturers. Using advanced computer vision algorithms, Ai-RGUS verifies the view of each camera to ensure a clear picture free of blur, block, tilt, glare, and low-light, and it confirms that each camera is recording and retaining sufficient days of recording for compliance purposes. Ai-RGUS pinpoints operational and cybersecurity vulnerabilities at the source, delivering actionable alerts that eliminate duplicate notifications. Alerts are fully customizable and integrate with existing ticketing systems and workflows to streamline maintenance. By unifying visibility across all devices, Ai-RGUS powers a proactive security strategy that minimizes downtime, proves compliance, and maintains system integrity. Ai-RGUS is now a trusted solution across the industry, has successfully passed SOC2-type II audits and is aligned with HIPAA privacy guidelines.

json.title: PHP and WordPress Developer
json.descriptionHtml:
A Public Sector client of ours is looking for a PHP and WordPress Developer to work on their ongoing project in the Raleigh, NC office.


Below are the additional details of this role:


Required Qualifications:


We need a minimum of 5+ years of hands-on experience in the following.


  • Extensive experience with PHP Development
  • Experience with WordPress Development
  • Experience reviewing existing code to diagnose and repair issues related to missing WordPress login PHP files
  • Experience restoring the login functionality for administrative and content management access.
  • Identify problematic custom PHP code, outdated plugins, and legacy configurations that contribute to website instability, applying fixes as necessary


This role can be W2 or 1099/C2C and is open for anyone with valid work authorization in the US. H1B transfer candidates are more than welcome to apply for this role.

json.title: Vice President of Paid Media - Startups (Remote US)
json.descriptionHtml:
Directive Consulting is the leading B2B performance marketing agency that delivers real revenue - not just leads.

We use Customer Generation (a marketing methodology developed by us) to cut through the noise. Forget MQLs - we’re here to drive pipeline, fuel SQLs, and scale brands that are serious about growth. From Paid Media and SEO/Content to CRO, RevOps, and Go-To-Market Strategy, we build marketing engines that win in SaaS and across B2B industries.

We move fast. We think boldly. We are elite. We hire people who challenge the status quo and push campaigns past what’s expected - sparking demand for bold, innovative brands. If you live for performance, love solving hard problems, and want your work to actually mean something, you’ll fit right in.

But here’s the fun part - we don’t just deliver results; we’re shaping the future of marketing. Ready to build something that breaks the mold? Come join us.

  • This role is listed internally as Director of Demand Generation*

About The Role

We’re looking for a bold, accountable leader to head our Demand Generation department — someone who thrives in the fast-moving world of B2B and SaaS marketing and knows how to build teams, drive client impact, and lead from the front.

As Director of Demand Generation, you’ll serve as the strategic and operational lead for our Startups Division. You’ll manage a high-velocity portfolio of startup and SMB clients, guiding a cross-functional team of Associate Directors and Demand Generation Manager to deliver measurable results across Paid Media, SEO, and CRO. Paid Media is about 90% of the offering.

This role goes beyond strategy — it's about building a high-performance culture, owning outcomes, and earning client trust. You’ll report to the COO and be expected to lead with clarity, communicate expectations, and hold your team to a high bar. Playing a vital part in the agency’s leadership team and future success.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead, coach, and inspire a team of about 20 digital marketers (Paid Media, SEO, and CRO) to deliver consistent, high-quality work across both strategy creation and execution.
  • Develop Associate Directors into strong people managers & client leaders, capable of inspiring teams and growing accounts
  • Own key KPIs across client retention, NRR, campaign performance, and team engagement
  • Act as executive sponsor for top-tier accounts, driving alignment in ABRs, renewals, and escalations; bring transparency and calm under pressure
  • Shape the strategic direction of the Startups division, including forecasting, hiring, budgeting, and margin management
  • Be a force of positive energy, clarity, and confidence for both clients and internal teams, especially when stakes are high or timelines are tight
  • Partner cross-functionally with Sales + other service lines to fuel new business, upsells, cross-sells, and client success.
  • Own department planning and growth - budgeting, capacity, and hiring to keep us healthy and thriving

What You Bring

  • 7–10+ years leading client-facing performance marketing teams in an agency environment, with deep B2B and SaaS expertise
  • Proven success managing fast-paced, high-volume accounts, including Director oversight of 30+ clients and strategizing multi-service delivery
  • Experience coaching and developing managers and senior ICs; a clear framework for expectations, feedback, and growth
  • Fluent enough to audit paid media platforms (Google Ads, LinkedIn, review sites like G2/Capterra), with working knowledge of SEO and CRO
  • Strong executive presence and composure, able to represent the agency confidently in C-level meetings and high-pressure conversations
  • Comfort with KPI tracking, reporting, and making decisions that drive results
  • Natural communicator who brings clarity to ambiguity and inspires others to rise to a high bar
  • A reputation for follow-through, reliability, and doing what you say you’ll do
  • Bonus: Experience speaking, publishing, or mentoring in the B2B/SaaS marketing space
  • Another Bonus: Familiarity with RevOps concepts, lifecycle metrics (like LTV:CAC), or client onboarding frameworks

What We Offer

  • Compensation for this role includes a competitive base salary plus performance-based bonus eligibility
  • 🙏 Medical, dental, vision plans, disability, and life insurance coverage for you and your family that fit your lifestyle
    • Including a 100% employer-paid plan for you and a 50% employer contribution for your dependents
  • Benefits to Support the Whole Person:
    • 🧠 Mental - Access to certified therapists through Spring Health, membership to Headspace
    • 💪 Physical - Physical therapy through Omada, thousands of Aaptiv virtual workouts, complimentary One Medical membership for primary and virtual care
    • 🛫 Time Off - Unlimited PTO (2-week minimum), Paid Company Holidays, Your Birthday Off, End of Year Recharge (Closed December 24 - January 1), Paid Parental Leave
    • 💰 Financial - Traditional and Roth 401(k) with a 3% company match
    • 🌟 Bonus - Annual bonus based on tenure, which scales in total amount over time
    • 🌴 Annual All-Agency Trip
Work Environment Requirements

As a remote-first company, you’ll have the ability to work from anywhere in the US, with the option to enjoy our state-of-the-art offices in Irvine, California. For some positions, as posted, we will accommodate global opportunities where we have established businesses, including Canada, the UK, and Australia. For global locations, you must have established and current work authorization and permanently reside in that country.

This role has the opportunity to operate 100% virtually from your home office. We primarily collaborate with our colleagues through virtual meetings (Zoom), and Slack. In this role, you will be required to operate a laptop computer (PC or Mac available), computer software platforms, and other office productivity tools as necessary. Due to the nature of this role, you must be able to remain stationary for extended periods, must be able to observe and interpret written and/or verbal communication, must have reliable internet access, and a professional background.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.

If you require reasonable accommodations in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, direct your inquiries to careers@directiveconsulting.com.

Additional Information

At Directive, one of our core values is People First. We’re committed to fostering a more diverse and inclusive culture in the digital landscape. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

json.companySlogan: We're the performance marketing agency built for B2B companies. Start generating revenue with Customer Generation.
json.companyDescription:
The world's largest B2B brands trust the global team at Directive Consulting to bring their performance marketing campaign results to life. Directive's proven Customer Generation methodology has generated +$1B in revenue for clients in the last 10 years by blending best-in-class campaigns across Paid Media, Content + SEO, Design, Strategy, and RevOps.

It's time for B2B companies to stop guessing about marketing ROI and start predicting sales revenue with industry-leading financial modeling. Build a winning game plan with Directive.

You can find our talented team in the Americas, EMEA, and APAC!

json.title: Head of Paid Media - Startups (Remote US)
json.descriptionHtml:
Directive Consulting is the leading B2B performance marketing agency that delivers real revenue - not just leads.

We use Customer Generation (a marketing methodology developed by us) to cut through the noise. Forget MQLs - we’re here to drive pipeline, fuel SQLs, and scale brands that are serious about growth. From Paid Media and SEO/Content to CRO, RevOps, and Go-To-Market Strategy, we build marketing engines that win in SaaS and across B2B industries.

We move fast. We think boldly. We are elite. We hire people who challenge the status quo and push campaigns past what’s expected - sparking demand for bold, innovative brands. If you live for performance, love solving hard problems, and want your work to actually mean something, you’ll fit right in.

But here’s the fun part - we don’t just deliver results; we’re shaping the future of marketing. Ready to build something that breaks the mold? Come join us.

  • This role is listed internally as Director of Demand Generation*

About The Role

We’re looking for a bold, accountable leader to head our Demand Generation department — someone who thrives in the fast-moving world of B2B and SaaS marketing and knows how to build teams, drive client impact, and lead from the front.

As Director of Demand Generation, you’ll serve as the strategic and operational lead for our Startups Division. You’ll manage a high-velocity portfolio of startup and SMB clients, guiding a cross-functional team of Associate Directors and Demand Generation Manager to deliver measurable results across Paid Media, SEO, and CRO. Paid Media is about 90% of the offering.

This role goes beyond strategy — it's about building a high-performance culture, owning outcomes, and earning client trust. You’ll report to the COO and be expected to lead with clarity, communicate expectations, and hold your team to a high bar. Playing a vital part in the agency’s leadership team and future success.

What You’ll Do

  • Lead, coach, and inspire a team of about 20 digital marketers (Paid Media, SEO, and CRO) to deliver consistent, high-quality work across both strategy creation and execution.
  • Develop Associate Directors into strong people managers & client leaders, capable of inspiring teams and growing accounts
  • Own key KPIs across client retention, NRR, campaign performance, and team engagement
  • Act as executive sponsor for top-tier accounts, driving alignment in ABRs, renewals, and escalations; bring transparency and calm under pressure
  • Shape the strategic direction of the Startups division, including forecasting, hiring, budgeting, and margin management
  • Be a force of positive energy, clarity, and confidence for both clients and internal teams, especially when stakes are high or timelines are tight
  • Partner cross-functionally with Sales + other service lines to fuel new business, upsells, cross-sells, and client success.
  • Own department planning and growth - budgeting, capacity, and hiring to keep us healthy and thriving

What You Bring

  • 7–10+ years leading client-facing performance marketing teams in an agency environment, with deep B2B and SaaS expertise
  • Proven success managing fast-paced, high-volume accounts, including Director oversight of 30+ clients and strategizing multi-service delivery
  • Experience coaching and developing managers and senior ICs; a clear framework for expectations, feedback, and growth
  • Fluent enough to audit paid media platforms (Google Ads, LinkedIn, review sites like G2/Capterra), with working knowledge of SEO and CRO
  • Strong executive presence and composure, able to represent the agency confidently in C-level meetings and high-pressure conversations
  • Comfort with KPI tracking, reporting, and making decisions that drive results
  • Natural communicator who brings clarity to ambiguity and inspires others to rise to a high bar
  • A reputation for follow-through, reliability, and doing what you say you’ll do
  • Bonus: Experience speaking, publishing, or mentoring in the B2B/SaaS marketing space
  • Another Bonus: Familiarity with RevOps concepts, lifecycle metrics (like LTV:CAC), or client onboarding frameworks

What We Offer

  • Compensation for this role includes a competitive base salary plus performance-based bonus eligibility
  • 🙏 Medical, dental, vision plans, disability, and life insurance coverage for you and your family that fit your lifestyle
    • Including a 100% employer-paid plan for you and a 50% employer contribution for your dependents
  • Benefits to Support the Whole Person:
    • 🧠 Mental - Access to certified therapists through Spring Health, membership to Headspace
    • 💪 Physical - Physical therapy through Omada, thousands of Aaptiv virtual workouts, complimentary One Medical membership for primary and virtual care
    • 🛫 Time Off - Unlimited PTO (2-week minimum), Paid Company Holidays, Your Birthday Off, End of Year Recharge (Closed December 24 - January 1), Paid Parental Leave
    • 💰 Financial - Traditional and Roth 401(k) with a 3% company match
    • 🌟 Bonus - Annual bonus based on tenure, which scales in total amount over time
    • 🌴 Annual All-Agency Trip
Work Environment Requirements

As a remote-first company, you’ll have the ability to work from anywhere in the US, with the option to enjoy our state-of-the-art offices in Irvine, California. For some positions, as posted, we will accommodate global opportunities where we have established businesses, including Canada, the UK, and Australia. For global locations, you must have established and current work authorization and permanently reside in that country.

This role has the opportunity to operate 100% virtually from your home office. We primarily collaborate with our colleagues through virtual meetings (Zoom), and Slack. In this role, you will be required to operate a laptop computer (PC or Mac available), computer software platforms, and other office productivity tools as necessary. Due to the nature of this role, you must be able to remain stationary for extended periods, must be able to observe and interpret written and/or verbal communication, must have reliable internet access, and a professional background.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.

If you require reasonable accommodations in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, direct your inquiries to careers@directiveconsulting.com.

Additional Information

At Directive, one of our core values is People First. We’re committed to fostering a more diverse and inclusive culture in the digital landscape. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

json.title: Freelance Animator – Product Explainer
json.descriptionHtml:
Join a project focused on creating a compelling video and animation showcase for a global proxy network provider. This role involves illustrating the platform’s advanced infrastructure and features, such as rotating sessions, geo-targeted endpoints, and API-based integration. The objective is to deliver clear, engaging visual content that highlights secure, scalable, and anonymous web access, with an emphasis on reliability and compliance. The animation will help communicate the value of the platform to developers, marketers, and organizations seeking solutions for web scraping, market intelligence, ad verification, SEO monitoring, and automation. This is a remote, short-term assignment for a personal project.

Responsibilities

  • Develop a concise animated explainer video that visually communicates the platform’s core features and benefits
  • Collaborate to understand technical details and translate them into accessible, engaging visuals
  • Emphasize use cases such as web scraping, market intelligence, ad verification, SEO monitoring, and automation
  • Ensure the animation aligns with the project’s tone and messaging, focusing on reliability, security, and compliance
  • Deliver the final video within the agreed timeframe and provide source files as needed

Skills And Requirements

  • Proficiency in animation and video editing software (e.g., After Effects, Premiere Pro, or similar)
  • Ability to simplify and visualize complex technical concepts for a broad audience
  • Strong storytelling and visual communication skills
  • Experience creating explainer videos or technical showcases is preferred
  • Self-motivated, able to work independently, and deliver high-quality work on a tight schedule
  • No onsite presence required; remote collaboration
  • Availability for a short-term, single project

About Twine

Twine is a leading freelance marketplace connecting top freelancers, consultants, and contractors with companies needing creative and tech expertise. Trusted by Fortune 500 companies and innovative startups alike, Twine enables companies to scale their teams globally.

Our Mission

Twine's mission is to empower creators and businesses to thrive in an AI-driven, freelance-first world.

json.companySlogan: Global network of experts
json.companyDescription:
Twine is home to a network of over 750k+ freelance experts and 50k+ clients across 195 countries. We connect talented people with flexible work and help businesses find the perfect expert for any project - big or small.

For Businesses & Clients:
Tired of endlessly searching for the right talent? We’ve got you covered. Twine makes it easy to find and hire freelance experts in tech, creative, AI and more. From software developers and graphic designers to animators and content creators. Our global network means you can hire the one-in-a-million expert remotely or locally. 

Ready to hire? Head to www.twine.net

For Freelancers, creators and consultants:
Ready to take control of your career and say goodbye to the 9-5? Join our community and discover top-tier projects from clients all over the world. Build your free portfolio and find work that truly inspires you. Forget the endless job boards; we're here to help you do what you love.

Ready to get started? Head to www.twine.net/freelancers

For AI Companies
Need high-quality, human-powered data to train your AI? Our diverse global network of contributors is ready to help. From voice recordings and video datasets to AI model rating experts and annotators, we can get you the custom audio-visual datasets or the AI training expertise you need to take your models to the next level.

Ready to get the data you need? Head to www.twine.net/ai

bring transparency and calm under pressureShape the strategic direction of the Startups division, including forecasting, hiring, budgeting, and margin managementBe a force of positive energy, clarity, and confidence for both clients and internal teams, especially when stakes are high or timelines are tightPartner cross-functionally with Sales + other service lines to fuel new business, upsells, cross-sells, and client success.Own department planning and growth - budgeting, capacity, and hiring to keep us healthy and thrivingWhat You Bring7–10+ years leading client-facing performance marketing teams in an agency environment, with deep B2B and SaaS expertiseProven success managing fast-paced, high-volume accounts, including Director oversight of 30+ clients and strategizing multi-service deliveryExperience coaching and developing managers and senior ICs; a clear framework for expectations, feedback, and growthFluent enough to audit paid media platforms (Google Ads, LinkedIn, review sites like G2/Capterra), with working knowledge of SEO and CROStrong executive presence and composure, able to represent the agency confidently in C-level meetings and high-pressure conversationsComfort with KPI tracking, reporting, and making decisions that drive resultsNatural communicator who brings clarity to ambiguity and inspires others to rise to a high barA reputation for follow-through, reliability, and doing what you say you’ll doBonus: Experience speaking, publishing, or mentoring in the B2B/SaaS marketing spaceAnother Bonus: Familiarity with RevOps concepts, lifecycle metrics (like LTV:CAC), or client onboarding frameworksWhat We OfferCompensation for this role includes a competitive base salary plus performance-based bonus eligibility🙏 Medical, dental, vision plans, disability, and life insurance coverage for you and your family that fit your lifestyleIncluding a 100% employer-paid plan for you and a 50% employer contribution for your dependentsBenefits to Support the Whole Person:🧠 Mental - Access to certified therapists through Spring Health, membership to Headspace💪 Physical - Physical therapy through Omada, thousands of Aaptiv virtual workouts, complimentary One Medical membership for primary and virtual care🛫 Time Off - Unlimited PTO (2-week minimum), Paid Company Holidays, Your Birthday Off, End of Year Recharge (Closed December 24 - January 1), Paid Parental Leave💰 Financial - Traditional and Roth 401(k) with a 3% company match🌟 Bonus - Annual bonus based on tenure, which scales in total amount over time🌴 Annual All-Agency TripWork Environment RequirementsAs a remote-first company, you’ll have the ability to work from anywhere in the US, with the option to enjoy our state-of-the-art offices in Irvine, California. For some positions, as posted, we will accommodate global opportunities where we have established businesses, including Canada, the UK, and Australia. For global locations, you must have established and current work authorization and permanently reside in that country.This role has the opportunity to operate 100% virtually from your home office. We primarily collaborate with our colleagues through virtual meetings (Zoom), and Slack. In this role, you will be required to operate a laptop computer (PC or Mac available), computer software platforms, and other office productivity tools as necessary. Due to the nature of this role, you must be able to remain stationary for extended periods, must be able to observe and interpret written and/or verbal communication, must have reliable internet access, and a professional background.To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform essential job functions.If you require reasonable accommodations in completing this application, interviewing, completing any pre-employment testing, or otherwise participating in the employee selection process, direct your inquiries to careers@directiveconsulting.com.Additional InformationAt Directive, one of our core values is People First. We’re committed to fostering a more diverse and inclusive culture in the digital landscape. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
json.companySlogan: We're the performance marketing agency built for B2B companies. Start generating revenue with Customer Generation.
json.companyDescription:
The world's largest B2B brands trust the global team at Directive Consulting to bring their performance marketing campaign results to life. Directive's proven Customer Generation methodology has generated +$1B in revenue for clients in the last 10 years by blending best-in-class campaigns across Paid Media, Content + SEO, Design, Strategy, and RevOps.

It's time for B2B companies to stop guessing about marketing ROI and start predicting sales revenue with industry-leading financial modeling. Build a winning game plan with Directive.

You can find our talented team in the Americas, EMEA, and APAC!

json.title: On-Air Media Personality (New York Yankees)
json.descriptionHtml:
About Fan Arch:


Fan Arch is a leading sports media platform dedicated to providing fans with engaging, insightful, and data-driven content. Through our collaborative network of over 1,500 athletes and a team of niched-down creators, we facilitate unique sports media activations across all the major sports.


Responsibilities:

  • Create compelling, original content focused on the New York Yankees, including videos, analysis, trade rumors, and predictions
  • MLB Team-Based Content
  • Develop and maintain a deep understanding of Yankees players, team dynamics, and league trends
  • Research and analyze statistics, rumors, and trends to provide informed insights
  • Produce daily content covering game previews, trade rumors, and post-game analysis
  • Collaborate with our social media team to create engaging snippets for various platforms
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest news, injuries, and roster changes affecting the Yankees
  • Contribute to special projects, such as draft projections, season previews, and playoff coverage


Requirements:

  • Experience in sports content creation, preferably focused on MLB or a specific team
  • Demonstrated knowledge of the New York Yankees and understanding of content trends
  • Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex statistical data
  • Excellent writing and communication skills with a keen eye for detail
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Familiarity with SEO best practices and content management systems


Preferred Qualifications:

  • Authentic, long-time New York Yankees fandom
  • Experience with video content creation and editing
  • An active presence on sports fan forums or social media platforms


What We Offer:

  • Commission-Based Salary
  • Opportunity to collaborate with our network of over 1,500+ professional athletes
  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Professional development opportunities in sports journalism and content creation

json.title: Amazon Marketing Sales Consultant
json.descriptionHtml:
Job Title: Amazon Marketing Sales Consultant

Job Type: Full-Time

Reports To: VP of Enterprise Strategy

Location: United States, Remote, M-F

Restriction: This opportunity is for candidates residing in the United States

Compensation: $80,000 Annually + Commissions ($140,000 to $160,000 OTE) + Benefits


The Digital Marketing Recruiters

Digital Marketing Recruiters has been in the digital marketing and recruitment space for over 25 years. We work with highly skilled marketing, digital marketing, and sales professionals and match them with our clients from diverse industries across the United States. Our selection process incorporates comprehensive resume screening, shortlisting, conducting video-recorded interviews and providing client information, administering written assessments (if required by the client), arranging client interviews, and facilitating job offers and placements.


The Client

Intero Digital is a tech-forward digital marketing agency that has a comprehensive roster of services starting with SEO and Paid Media, Content and PR, Amazon, Omni, and Creative Services. We are a remote-first company with offices in San Diego, CA, Colorado Springs, CO, Columbus, OH, Farmington, UT, and Columbia, MO.


Why Intero Digital?

  • We are leading the way in our AI and generative engine optimization services as SEO and digital marketing are evolving quickly.
  • Work in a remote-first, high-energy environment with a team that values innovation and creativity.
  • You will earn the freedom to experiment with new partnership and sales strategies in a world that’s evolving rapidly with AI.
  • We have a channel program with some agency and fractional CMO traction—and a huge opportunity to scale into new verticals and partner categories.


The Role

As an Amazon Marketing Sales Consultant, you will be responsible for driving new revenue growth through both inbound lead management and proactive outbound prospecting. You’ll leverage your Amazon marketing expertise and network to identify opportunities, pitch solutions, and close business. The ideal candidate is a proven sales professional with a strong understanding of Amazon’s advertising ecosystem and experience selling agency services.


Key Responsibilities

  • Manage, qualify, and close inbound leads from our marketing pipeline.
  • Proactively hunt for new leads and opportunities through networking, outreach, and referrals.
  • Leverage an existing book of business or industry connections to drive new client growth.
  • Deliver compelling sales presentations and proposals that clearly communicate ROI-driven Amazon marketing solutions.
  • Collaborate with internal teams to ensure a smooth transition from sales to account management.
  • Meet or exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets.
  • Stay current with Amazon trends, tools, and competitor strategies to position our agency as a trusted expert.


Requirements

  • 3+ years of experience in sales, business development, or account management.
  • Proven track record of closing deals and exceeding quotas.
  • Previous agency experience in digital marketing, Amazon marketing, or eCommerce strongly preferred.
  • Strong knowledge of Amazon Seller Central, Vendor Central, and the Amazon Ads ecosystem.
  • Demonstrated ability to prospect, develop, and manage a pipeline of opportunities.
  • Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
  • Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to work independently and drive results.


Benefits

We provide an environment where our employees can grow and advance. We have a fun and engaging work environment where we work hard and continue to strive for excellence. This position includes the following benefits:

  • 100% Remote Work
  • 12-Week Parental Leave Program (if regular full-time)
  • 1-Week Winter Break
  • 13 Paid Holidays
  • Employer Covered Benefits
  • 96.5% Medical Insurance
  • 100% Long-Term Disability Insurance
  • 100% $50,000 Life Insurance Policy
  • Additional Elective Benefits Available
  • Pet Insurance
  • Dental Insurance
  • Vision Insurance
  • Life Insurance
  • Short-Term Disability Insurance
  • Hospital Indemnity Insurance
  • Legal Insurance
  • 401(k) Matching
  • After 1 Year of Employment


Tags

United States, Remote, Work From Home, WFH, Full-Time, Digital Marketing, Digital Marketing Agency, Amazon Marketing, Amazon Marketing Agency, Amazon Marketing Consultant, Amazon Advertising Sales Consultant, Amazon Ads Business Development Manager, Amazon PPC Sales Executive, Amazon eCommerce Sales Consultant, Amazon Marketing and Sales Specialist, Amazon Agency Sales Manager, Amazon Digital Marketing Sales Executive, Amazon Advertising Account Executive, Amazon Marketing Business Development Executive, eCommerce Sales Consultant (Amazon Focus), Amazon Growth Consultant, Amazon Media Sales Representative, Amazon Ads Consultant, Client Acquisition, Lead Generation, Sales Strategy, Pipeline Management, Revenue Growth, Client Relationship Management, ROI-Driven Sales, Strategic Prospecting, B2B Sales, Negotiation and Closing Skills, Presentation Skills, Amazon Advertising (Amazon Ads), Amazon PPC (Pay-Per-Click), Amazon DSP (Demand-Side Platform), Amazon Seller Central, Amazon Vendor Central, Amazon Sponsored Ads, Amazon Display Ads, Amazon eCommerce Strategy, Amazon Marketplace Growth


Digital Marketing Recruiters Job Opportunities

Visit our Careers Page at https://www.digitalmarketingrecruiters.com/job-listing/ to see our latest job opportunities. The positions listed below remain open while they are posted. If a position is no longer listed on our Careers Page, it has either been successfully filled or officially closed.

  • Affiliate Marketing Manager
  • Call Center Manager
  • Email Marketing Specialist
  • Founding Account Executive
  • Head of Marketing
  • Paid Media Manager
  • Sales Data Analyst
  • Sales Development Representative
  • SEO Sales Manager
  • YouTube Marketing Specialist
